title: The slimmest desktop mechanical keyboard on the market
text: This is the slimmest desktop mechanical keyboard on the market.  The Kailh low-profile blue switches feel different than the full size version.  They feel much tighter and smoother in my opinion.  The replacement key cap sets that you see will not fit this keyboard, but the included caps are good enough.  The switches feel crunchy and a bit loud at first.  They quiet down and smooth out once they break in a little.  The RGB lighting system is excellent.  The white color is a very clean white.  It does not have a blue or pink tint.  I love not having to lift my wrists so much.  It really reduces fatigue.  The removable USB cable is great for storage, but the socket is recessed and very tight.  Many micro USB cables will not fit the recess.  The weight is just right.  It is heavy enough to stay put without being too heavy to push out of the way.  This is a unique product, and I have not found anything else like it.  Give it a try.

title: Work great

title: Nostalgia!
text: Functionally speaking, mine has worked perfectly. No issues. As others in the reviews have said, you need a 5v 1amp adapter to plug into the wall if you don't want to plug into the TV to power it. I tried a 2amp adapter and the system would not turn on. So, it definitely must be a 1amp. The controller cord is incredibly short. I recommend getting a set of longer ones. I wanted a second controller anyhow so that didn't matter to me. I got a set of 10ft controllers and have been fine. I like that I can save my spots for every game in the system. You can find the whole listing on NES' website. This thing is so tiny! Shows how far tech has come. All those games on this lil thing. The only downside, which isn't a downside because I thought about it before getting and made the choice is that the games on this system are built in. There are no cartridges. That means if I want more, I cannot have them. If you want games not on the listing, you then you should with a different system than the mini and be able to swap cartridges. If that is not a concern, then you're all set like me!

title: Horrible DRM, buy steam version instead
text: I preordered this game through Amazon, which does not in fact give you a steam code, but a code to use through telltale's website. Nonetheless I was excited to play it as soon as it came out, so i downloaded it off the telltale website. The authentication as soon as you start the game requires you to make and sign in with a telltale account, but there have been HUGE server issues, which leaves me with no game to play for a second day now as the game can't connect to telltale's servers to authenticate a game i preordered. Support of the telltale forums has said to just be patient, but I find it unacceptable that people on Steam have already been playing since yesterday and pirated copies have already made their way around. I'll update when the issues are fixed but for now AVOID THIS VERSION

title: Parents! Read Carefully and Believe Me, You Don't Want to Buy This!
text: Gather round gamers and let me tell you a story. I call it "Busted Headset and the Father with Infinite Patience". I purchased this headset in December 2019 as a gift and by February 2020 the unit no longer charged. I contacted the manufacturer expecting a quick resolution consisting of a return and replacement. Instead, I ventured into a return process that resembled one of those hedge mazes. The replacement process began on February 29, 2020 and a replacement unit was finally received on April 7, 2020. Over the course of 22 excruciating emails, I was instructed to try different chargers, reset it with a paperclip, and send at least a dozens of photos. I had to send a copy of the invoice, but not from a mobile device! Oh no, only a screenshot from a PC using a Snip tool is acceptable! Then they decided the claim was valid and instructed me to break the headset in a very specific method (because failure to follow any instructions could invalidate the claim). Empowered by their instructions I snapped off an earpiece and cut the wires. Next, they asked for photos of the broken unit. Sadly, the photos were insufficient proof  and they decided they needed the unit and instructed me to mail it. In keeping with their increasingly bizarre instructions, we had to include a QR code. Fingers crossed, we sent it off, worried that we may have taped the box incorrectly and blown the deal. Finally, we were sent notice that a replacement unit was on the way. Now they're bugging me with requests for customer service surveys, to which I reply, if you don't know how awful it is by now, you'll never know.

title: Boring For Those That Played Out Rollercoaster Tycoon 1
text: If you've never played the Rollercoaster Tycoon series, than by all means, quickly buy the sequel because it's probably one of the most enjoyable games ever.  It has a simple concept behind it yet the game keeps you hooked for months.  If you love designing and creating, this IS the game for you as it's basically a layman's theme park builder.  For those that did play the first game, I have a small warning for you:  Unless you're hopelessly addicted to the first game and its many expansions, you probably won't get much out of the sequel.  It's almost a carbon copy of the first game.  Some of the rollercoaster building mechanics have changed, there are new attractions, and you can now play on maps that are realistic portrayals of the popular Six Flags theme park chain.  Other than that, everything is the same, even the graphics (which are usually the first thing to get updated in a sequel) don't look any different.  My recommendation for anyone that is the patient type and wishes to buy this game is to wait a month or two.  There are already two expansions for the sequel.  Games like these are quickly packaged into bargain combo packs and I imagine it won't be long before both expansions are available with the original game at a low price.

title: Fun Story. Painfully Boring Combat System.
text: I love mario games and have played them since I was 2, but the combat in this game is terrible. You have to constantly buy and find cards that are all 1 use and then to attack you need to select the move, paint it if you want, flick it upwards, click to use it, then time taps correctly to get the full value from the card. This long drawn out process is then repeated until the enemies die or you run out of card which sucks bad. If this game had the combat system of Super Mario RPG and the story telling of paper mario it would have been a home run. Instead the entire game revolves around dodging enemies so you don't have to fight in this terrible combat system, solving easy puzzles, item hoarding, and painting white spots to farm items. The dialog is well written and the graphics are cool. Too bad

title: Good - But NOT a software for Dig-N-Rig unit
text: We bought this software hoping, but not clear, that this would be additional software for the Tonka Dig-N-Rigs game. If you are not familiar with Dig-N-Rigs, its a GREAT game that comes with a dashboard unit that mounts on your computer keyboard. You load the software and then all of the controls are on this dashboard, like the steering wheel, crane levers, key, and horn. It is a 5-star game and my 4 year old son said, after playing for a few moments that he would be playing the rest of the day and the rest of his life. We'll, just realize that Construction 2 is not a supplement to that game and you just use your mouse. Its still a good game but not near as gratifying as Dig-N-Rigs, and I hope they eventually come out with supplemental software to that game.

title: So far a good alternative to the Genki Covert Dock
text: I own a Genki Covert Dock and desired a second similar product to use as yet another switch dock to use in another room. This product is 25 dollars cheaper, so it caught my eye. These kinds of products are great for tucking an entire switch dock behind your wall-mounted tv or for travel. The Genki Covert Dock has a lot of promise of testing as to not harm your switch as other 3rd party docks can, so I was excited to see that the product page for the Hagibis GaN dock also addressed concerns with 3rd party switch docks causing systems to brick. The size of this thing is incredible, and the red and blue color scheme is very fun. The USB C cable that comes with the device is also very heavy duty. It is a nice braided cable that has a lot of body to it, so I don't imagine it will pinch or crimp without a lot of serious intent. The dock itself was true plug-and-play. I plugged the dock into a power strip, HDMI into the dock, and the USB C into my switch. The switch went dark and the image switched to the tv. I think I'll make sure there is no pressure on the USB C cable when using it as a switch dock. Taking the joycons out to allow the device to lay flat achieves this. The Genki Covert dock comes with a 90 degree low profile USB C cable to avoid this kind of concern. Maybe Hagibis will consider swapping the cable to one of a similar design in the future.

title: Works like a charm!
text: We have had our Kinect sensor since they first came out and have always had issues mounting the ideal position for it.  We have had it under the set, under with zoom, and above the TV.  Our makeshift mount for the above the TV worked at first as we have a Samsung 55" Touch of Color TV that has a glass bezel frame.  Most commercial mounts didn't appear that they would fit our set.  However, when we found this model of Kinect Mount at low cost, we had nothing to lose.  We got it in a plain packaging, no instructions.  However, it was the greatest thing as it met all the needs we could've hoped for.  The photo makes it look like cheap knockoff plastic design.  It is not.  It's the sturdiest thing we've tried so far and even has locking clips to secure the sensor to it.  Repositioning is a breeze!  Try it!

title: Best Gaming Headset You Will Find At This Price Or Even ones costing mcu h more!
text: I have owned many headsets from Logitech, Plantronics and my last 2 were some higher priced Racer Carachias and Kraken Pro and these put all of them to shame. First is the build quality, all top notch materials and construction which will seem to last for a very long time. Second is the comfort, these include 2 different ear cups but I use the default memory foam cups and they are the most comfortable headset I ever tried. Also included is a gorgeous box and carrying pouch. They dont squeeze your head at all and feel like a dream even after hours and hours. The Mic is detachable and is outstanding quality in both construction and sound. Last but not least is the sound quality! these bad boys use a larger than most 54mm drivers that are also unique in that they use the frequency range of 15hz - 20khz that deliver amazing sound. All the cords are long, tough and braided. Now this does come with the standard analog jack but it includes a usb control for volume and mic and is also a soundcard which allows you to activate a virtual 7.1 surround. The surround was not the best BUT if you use the Razer Synapse Virtual 7.1 surround software it becomes unreal! If I activate the razer surround and then the 7.1 button on the headphone cord I can literally pinpoint any enemy in CS:GO, it's outstanding! Every PC magazine and related websites all rate this headset as one of THE BEST you can get, even beating out headsets costing 3x more and I can see (I mean hear) why. Just go read some reviews on these badboys and see how so many praise these. These are worth way more then the crazy low price they sell these out but don't take my word. just do the research.

title: Doesn't work good.
text: These just don't work well. I used them on 2 controllers and they still sucked. I love Kontrol Greek but this just sucks. Their thumbsticks work great, their grips work great but these don't. Even with the medium strength ring it is nearly impossible to aim. I had my sensitivity on max and it was like I was on 3. It did help aim though. I could bring the recoil down and I could hit the enemy with most of my shots. You don't over steer with your aim (mainly because it's hard to even aim) and its easier to get back on the enemy if the recoil takes you away. I haven't tried any other brand and at the moment I don't plan to. I hope this was helpful and I hope that you have an amazing day.

title: Protect Your Investment

The compartment for the 360 is padded and has an extra cover over the top to seperate it from the rest of the case. Other compartments are shaped to fit 2 controllers, wires, and 6 games. To top it all off, the whole case is protected by the hard case, aluminum shell (preferable over a soft shell case). The only problem with this case is that there is no place to put the power adapter. I tried to fit it in with the controllers, the wires, even the 360 compartment, but no luck. So for now I put the adapter in a seperate bag.

title: Great keyboard that feels better than the g15

One point I do not like but most would is that in gaming mode the windows key press is cut from the keyboard meaning even if you have it disabled via your registry you cannot press the windows key which I use for skype, ventrilo and teamspeak. Some may complain of the spacebar but it feels fine except it feels as if it could become a sticky press down the line but overall not a significant problem. title: Ive had this for a month and it works perfectly would not recommend going to gamestop and paying 70 dollars when this ...
text: Was having an issue of my Xbox One not powering on. When I hit the power button it would chime and then turn off. I would have to unplug all the power cables and reset the power brick anywhere from 20-50 times to get the power brick light to turn white and then turn on my xbox. I youtubed countless videos, and none of them worked. I tried taking the power brick apart cleaning it, using a different cable, sticking in the cable to the back of the power brick halfway and wiggling it to try and discharge the static, none of that worked only hoping that after enough times of resetting the brick it would turn on. Ive had this for a month and it works perfectly would not recommend going to gamestop and paying 70 dollars when this is a perfect replacement.

title: Great replacement joysticks thus far!
text: I recommend watching a joystick replacement video on YouTube (Spawn Wave for example) to decide if you want to DIY.  About 30 minutes for me to replace both with no prior experience.  Screws and parts are small, so keep them sorted and go carefully, and you'll be fine.  I had to figure out the metal replacement lock pins on my own, but they were fairly straight forward.  There is one inside each black side strip right behind the round black release push-button on the outside of the controller, if you can't find them.  Remove one screw and pull out the silver metal u-shaped bracket to replace them.  The u-shaped bracket was tight for me, so just keep at it gently to pull it straight out from the side strip.  Calibrate your joysticks when done!  We've only been using the replacement joysticks a few days, so I can't comment on durability yet, but performing perfectly so far!

title: This cable works well
text: I intended to purchase an Wii HDMI converter but I was seeing mixed reviews on these adapters, Some reviews were mentioning that the adapters where getting hot to the touch, breaking into pieces, and not operating after a few uses. The only ones that were reliable were no longer available to purchase. I searched some more online and youtube and found a video for this cable. Even though I would like to have full 1080P resolution on my Sharp LCD television, this cable converts the 480P resolution on the Wii to something watchable. I am able to stream Netflix  and Hulu on this tv and  the clarity is pretty close to standard definition channels from Directv. I recommend this product to anyone on the fence about the Wii to HDMI converters.

title: Real Time Tribe
text: This is a cute, family friendly game.  You start off with a handful of characters that all wash up on shore on the island you select.  You can set priorities for individual tribe members, such as gathering food, construction, or science.  You can also designate building to be constructed.  Creating new characters is accomplished by clicking one tribe member onto an adult tribe member of the opposite sex, and then you have a small infant running around the island.  Each character has his or her own strengths.  This is a casual, fun game.  Since the game is in real time, your people will age and continue to work, even you are not playing the game.  If you enjoy Tycoon games, you will probably like this game as well.

title: Vocabulary and Spelling -- a great learning tool for kids and adults
text: My Word Coach DS (we liked the Wii version so much that we also bought the DS game - the DS stylus makes it easier to write, but my son likes the Wii's fun factor, and the Wii remote seems to keep him more involved in the learning process) - Do you have a kid who hasn't read enough to build a large vocabulary and strong spelling skills OR a kid who finds words fascinating? This game works for both, and provides lots of word practice with a series of different games -- my kid seemed almost surprised at the end of his first series that he had learned so much. There's lots of reading (definitions, etc.) which I think would make it tricky for kids much younger than ten. The game has progress graphs and high score history for encouragement and provides a word review after play. There are vocabulary games (e.g. Split Decision where you match the word on the screen to its correct definition) and spelling games (what could be more fun than grafitti-style spray painting to fill in the missing letter or correct a wrong letter?), with six training games in all and a couple of 'recreational' DS games. There are lots of options to keep a player's interst as the game gets harder -- for instance, both definitions may be wrong in Split Decision. My soon-to-be eleven year old plays until the professor tells him to stop for the day (after he's mastered a profile-determined word list). There's a slight learning curve, but he figured it out on his own without getting frustrated. He intuitively began picking up on clues such as how to guess a word from the definition. My son says it's "lots of fun -- almost, but not quite, like a regular game." I predict libraries and after-school programs will be holding lots of competitions with this game.

title: good game,very solid gameplay

The realism in the game is amazing,along with the graphics, and you don't need an Area 51 computer for the game to run smooth, that in itself is a great triumph, for the makers of this game, and I salute you. The zoom feature is just right which is the L Key, Plus you can hit the enter key,,,,type...view all to reveal the map, You can type in a few more phrases,if you want to.This will probably be the only true american revolutionary game you will ever get your hands on, Go buy this game,I know a good game when I play it. One of the reviewer, said the soldiers can only fight, I beg the differ, they can shoot some of the wildlife, for food,then take it to the storehouse. I would like to clarify one of the reviewer,statement,saying the soldiers move too fast,, well let me say, there is a slider button on the option menu,so you can slow the movements of the troops, and every thing else.

title: it doesn't work consistently
text: i really like that the mouse is quiet and when working it moves around fluidly without choppiness. i really like how bright and pretty both the mouse and the keyboard are, the keyboard being a perfect backlighting for playing in the dark, which i do a lot . the problem i have with this mouse and keyboard are that they work inconsistently. in the middle of using them, not even during a pause, they will stop working, which can be detrimental for gaming obviously. that is what they are intended for and why i bought them. it will take a bit of prodding for them to come back on when this happens. it's not like they are shutting down to save power during non-use, it is in the middle of using them. i have spent a bit of time with customer service, which btw are very nice and professional every time i have needed them, troubleshooting and trying to solve the problem. eventually i had to have them exchanged, to no avail. the new mouse and keyboard did the exact same thing over and over again. to me, this indicates there is a problem with this product in the manufacturing . i don't recommend purchasing this item. they say "you get what you pay for" but even at this price, i paid for more than a few hours of continuous play time. it's very unfortunate.

title: A fun game with realistic play.
text: I find this game to be pretty fun with rather realistic play. There are a variety of lures to buy and choose from with tips on how to use them and what you can catch with them. Hardcore fisherman might even get a big kick out of the fact that you can even choose different rods, reels, and lines. I love that fact that you can actually choose what music to listen to on the boat's radio. You can cast any way you want to with different ways to reel in different lures. Setting the hook takes a flick of the wrist just like in real life and you have to watch the tension and drag. There are quite a few lakes to unlock and the environments are expansive. While the actual fish look pretty realistic, the graphics elsewhere might seem sub-par. The water looks poor, the underwater scenes are dark, and the underwater terrain and vegetation are HEAVILY pixelated. Although the graphics could have been better, even for Wii, I feel the flexibility and realism of play make up for it. The fishing rod peripheral included feels solid, however, when casting, I would keep both hands on the remote and nunchuck so that the weight of the nunchuck doesn't break the reel, which feels like the weakest point. If you do that, which isn't really awkward or uncomfortable to do, the rod should last a long time I think. The game, however, probably isn't really too difficult to play without the rod. I really like how the rod can be adjusted for left or right hand use, even though I'm just right handed.

title: Everything I could have asked for on my Quest 2!
text: I've been debating getting an elite strap for my quest 2 since I bought it. It seemed expensive and I still would have to also buy the oculus brand battery or deal with attaching my 3rd party power pack. I usually kept my power pack in my pocket, or sometimes attached to the fabric stock strap with rubber bands. This new head strap checks every box I could have asked for. It's very comfortable and easy to adjust. Huge difference having weight on the back to balance the headset. Having a spot to attach my own battery, and even easily swap them out, is a game changer! Product feels very well made and came in very nice hard packaging. For the price you can't beat it.

title: A Grand Zelda Adventure
text: Fear not, Zelda loyalists, this new GBC adventure, even though developed by Capcom, lives up to the Zelda name in every way possible.  Even surpassing Link's Awakening in the gameplay department, this game is a treat for Zelda purists and newcomers alike. There is great variety in Link's adventure this time around - you'll find yourself doing everything from riding mine carts to hopping, swimming, and flying around with your newfound animal buds.  These animals are a great additon to the game: You'll meet all three on your quest, but you get one to "keep" as your pet. The main item here is the mystical rod of seasons.  Adding great depth to the game, you'll gain the power to change the weather and landscape at will with the help of a nearby tree stump.  The other items, found in dungeons and other places, are definetly the most amazing and innovative items seen yet in a Zelda game, including it's parter pak, Oracle of Ages.  I won't list any of them here, but later in the game you yourself will be astounded. If the new 3D incarnations of the series are too easy for you, be prepared to meet your match.  The action in this game is great, sometimes overwhelming, as the many enemies and huge, tough, bosses will certainly leave you gasping for a breather.  Don't delay, even if those flashy Game Boy Advance games have caught your eye.  You won't be seeing anything this good on a handheld system in a long time.  And, even though its marketing scheme, don't pass up on Ages either.  The two games Link together once you've completed one of them, adding more items, dungeons, and bosses into the mix.  Get one, and if you're thirsting for an especially big adventure, get both.  You won't regret it, and besides, its ZELDA.  Do I really need to tell you this?

title: Who knew pollinating plants would be so fun?
text: First and foremost I consider myself to be a ''hardcore'' gamer who likes to play Gears, Halo, COD etc... Eventually I became fatigued by all the shooting games and bought this just to see what it was like. This game plays like Little Big Planet as you travel through different stages pollinating plants and wildlife and figuring out simple to medium puzzles. The music within the game is relaxing and the character designs are cute. Every time you finish a level you unlock a costume for your own character which gives you a sense of personality that I feel add to the depth of this game. The UnderGarden is a game you should definitely check out if you don't have a PS3 with LBP - it's fun, relaxing and has great music, great level designs (I love the artwork that they put into it) and great character designs. The UnderGarden is a casual game that all casual games should strive to be - fun and enjoyable.

title: great old school dungeons and dragons rpg!!!!!
text: The game is an old dungeon and dragons game, that has been enhanced some. It works great. No glitches, slow screens, black screens, missing audio or video files, patches are available if needed. I didnt need any patches or updates. I do wish that it would of stated it was a steam download. It would of been nice to have a warning. I had to set up a free steam account and download their stuff to get it. It wasnt hard just time consuming. There are an amazing amount of variety in the type of characters in your party. I mean many many not just the regular fighter, mage, cleric and rogue stuff. The world is vast and interesting, the quests are numerous and some are a bit confusing, i doubt you will get it perfect the first time. The game has super replayablity. Your thief can pick pocket people which is nice!! You will need to pause each round of battle to give out the battle commands to the whole party. It is very much like dungeons and dragons second edition game rules. Leveling, learning and memorizing spells. Its as great game and well worth the money. The graphics are good, a bit dark but good, very well done game!!!!

So just be aware of that when you order. The product description really should mention that. title: One of the best VNs ever gets a great remake with extras....
text: This game does an excellent job of living up to its Elite title, rewarding fans of the original game and anime, as well as providing a great experience for newcomers.  What distinguishes this version of the game is that unlike the original game(which had a very unique art style, but used stills) and most of the VNs on the market, this game uses animation assets from the anime to add some immersion and flair that keeps the player's attention.  This includes new animation built for character routes that weren't detailed on the anime.  The Switch package includes a short 8-Bit side story game, which is cute with good art and a good 8 bit soundtrack but is short and not very deep.  The PS4 version has the better extra package imo, with a full-fledged side story VN that takes 10-20 hours to finish.  However, the portability of the Switch makes it much more convenient and it truly feels like an interactive novel playing around going through the game.  So if the extras are the determining factor, get the PS4 version.  If the main game is, get it on Switch.  Highly recommended.

title: Excellent Teaching Tool!
text: I cannot recommend this game enough!  My eight year old homeschooled daughter loves this game.  After getting frustrated with the difficulty in getting her to remember her times tables, I purchased this game to try to help.  She has gone from not wanting to even try the 7's to getting all 10 questions correct in 30 seconds.  She gets excited when she beats her previous time and tries to beat it.  If your child gets motivated by trying to beat their score, this is the game for them.  They don't have to compete against anyone else, it's just working on beating their own score.  There are several different names that can be entered and their scores are independent of each other.  There are different levels for addition and subtraction so even adults can tune up their skills.

title: Fun Game
text: This game is not only challenging and fun, but it is hilarious!  The chuzzles have their own personality.  If you take too long with your turn, one of the creatures will fall asleep.  Sometimes they wear sunglasses.  If you get a giant chuzzle and left click about 5x, it will blow up its cheeks and if you keep clicking it will burp really loud.  If you left click on the regular chuzzle at least 6 or so times, it will sneeze, and if you continue clicking it will sneeze so hard it blows of all of its hair.  If you left click and hold and move the entire row of cuzzles back and forth 5 or 6 times really fast, then release, the eyes of all the chuzzles in the row will roll around and they make funny noises.  If you don't know where to move but don't want to lose points on a hint, then just sit there for 30 secs....the one who rolls his eyes is the one you need to move, so watch the board carefully.  Sometimes it doesn't want to give you the clue, so it will frown and make a mean noise.  I'm sure there're more funny things that I will continue to discover about this fun game.

title: Cryostasis- interesting morality tale
text: Cryostasis is a first person game that sort of defies description. Some may call it a FPS, others an adventure game. I believe it melds these two concepts together, and does them well.  You play a Russian scientist at the North Pole who is sent to investigate an ice breaking ship that has run aground and become incased in ice.  The big hook of this game is the 'Mental Echo' ability that allows you to re-live the last moments of dead crew members and try to correct things that they did wrong before they died.  This is a very unique premise, and I rather enjoyed it.  There is a lot of trial and error with the Mental Echo ability, but it is pretty painless as you can retry as often as you like (with no loading or game over penalties!)  Some people have been comparing this game to Bioshock, but that is an inaccurate comparison.  Just because there is a lot of water and water effects around your character does not make this game even remotely close to Bioshock.  The action is not very good, and you have several melee options, as well as some rifles to collect.  The combat consists of approaching your enemy and hitting him, then backing up while they attack, then approach and repeat.  The monsters subscribe to the jump out from the shadows (ala Doom 3) mentatilty to provide cheap scares, however there are some tense moments.  The color palette is pretty bland as the ship is iced over, so lots of blue and grey.  Some areas of the ship heat up to melt the ice, and the true colors come out, and look very good.  Combat overall is actually pretty bad compared to current action games.  Keep in mind that this game is not about the action, which makes me feel like this is more of an adventure game. Very good story, creepy atmosphere, and great graphics make this a good choice overall, just know what you're getting into. Also this game is a graphics whore, so have a good system to run it!

title: One of the worst games I've ever played
text: This is not a review because I'm a new player and the game is too hard. I am a high level player of these NHL games and after a full week of playing and giving it countless chances, I can say that this is one of the worst games of all time. The features are amazing. I love how in depth the game is. But the gameplay itself is beyond pure garbage. The opposing AI will never ever be off your player. They can read exactly where you're going and make turns as you make them. Physics means nothing to the opposing AI while your AI is a joke. Passing feels completely random and don't even bother using stick lift. It doesn't work. The AI has a recovery time of zero while you get held down by unrealistic physics. I can't even begin to explain how frustrating it is. I like things to be difficult. I don't want to easily win every game. Losing games is good because that means the challenge is there. But I cannot deal with feeling cheated because of how unfair the game is. Winning even feels bad because the experience is so frustrating. EA is awful and I cannot stress enough that no one should waste their money on this horrible game.

title: Durable, solid keyboard with excellent lighting features and great tactility.
text: This is a great mechanical keyboard.  The switches are light and have a good tactile response, allowing you to type quickly and with conviction.  This thing is a workhorse.  I use it for programming several hours each day.  The fact that you can customize each individual key's color makes this keyboard ideal for a large number of applications.  I used to own one of the original BlackWidow keyboards and while that was also a great keyboard, this one is even better.  The Synapse driver software saves your lighting, mapping and macro configurations to your Razer account.  This does require you to log in once, but that's about all you have to do.  You can of course save and load your configuration without having internet access.  You just need internet access to download the driver and register for an account, that's it.  This keyboard has made typing much more ergonomic, enjoyable and efficient.  Worth every penny.

title: My sailing fanatic son loves this game
text: I bought this as a christmas gift for my son (10) who loves to sail.  When I looked at it closely when it arrived, I worried that perhaps it would be too sophisticated for him.  But he loves it, and says the graphics are really cool.  My husband plays it too and they are both learning more about sailing as they play.  My husband (almost no sailing experience), and says the game is helping him to understand racing more, and my son can try different strategies and see how the game reacts.  We live in a cold area, so it's a great way to enjoy sailing while we wait for warm weather so we can get out on the lake!

title: Customer Service Outweighs Product Quality
text: I've owned Xbox rechargeable batteries before and the problem I've always had is that I needed to replace the batteries themselves every time to charge. This docking station intends for you to replace the battery first, and never have to touch it again. The problem I encountered is that the plastic hooks that keep the battery locked in are very weak and broke on one of the batteries after the first use. In addition, the dock station is VERY picky, and it takes more time than it should to dock my controller than it should. I am working with the company via their warranty policy to fix these issues. So far their customer service has done a much better job than the product itself has. All in all I wouldn't purchase this again, but if you're looking for something cheap and temporary, this product is for you.

title: Amazing Game

The controls are very responsive and after the tutorial at the beginning I feel I have a pretty good grasp of them. I love running and jumping off building to scare the people below. The voice acting is also excellent. I can't say enough good things about it.

title: Unbelievably awful
text: Being a fan of Hellboy, I was kind of looking forward to Hellboy: The Science of Evil.  However, also being a veteran gamer, I wasn't looking all that forward to the game, simply because of the terrible history of licensed video games.  Well, I didn't expect too much out of the game, but what you get here may even be below your lowest expectations.  Hellboy: The Science of Evil puts you in the shoes of the title character as you brawl through numerous hordes of baddies and take on the occasional boss.  That's it.  That's all you do from beginning to end in this game, and it gets boring very, very quickly.  Not to mention that the game as a whole is quite short, quite easy, and features some technical issues that all combine to make the game quite bad.  The game features some bland environments and choppy animation, and the clipping issues are more distracting than anything else.  Co-op multiplayer is also available where you can play as Abe Sapien and Liz in addition to playing as Hellboy, but it offers nothing to improve the experience at all.  Hellboy film stars Ron Perlman, Selma Blair, and Doug Jones lend their voices to the game, but they all sound so bored that they just add nothing.  No matter how much of a Hellboy fan you may be, avoid Hellboy: The Science of Evil like the plague.  There's no challenge, innovation, or anything else to even come close to holding your interest.

title: A Wonderful Suprise
text: I didn't know what to expect when I purchased this game but I must say I am glad I got it.  The gameplay is fun and the basics are easy to grasp.  There are quick tutorials in the first few battles that give good explanations for the various options during battle so there is no confusion.  The more you play the deeper the battles can become depending on how you play.  New characters and formations are introduced that really allow you to decide how you want to play.  Certain formations are better for defense while others excel at offense and there are other formations that can give stat boosts depending where you place your characters.  Another good point is that the game offers three difficulty levels so the player can pick a difficulty that best suits there skill level.  I have played with all three difficulty levels active and there is a difference that becomes more apparent as you progress further into the game.  Easy mode is very good for players who don't play many tactics based RPGs and allows you to focus more on the story.  Normal is good for just about anybody who enjoys tactics based RPGs and has some skill in them.  Hard on the other hand starts off not to bad but gets really intense later on.  So be prepared with the best tactics you can muster or you will end up being very frustrated very quickly.  The story so far has been better then I expected and the ability to bond with some of the characters really adds a fun element to the game as certain choices will effect how those characters feel about you.  In the end this is a fun game with lots to offer for most gamers.  Oh and the mouse pad and pillow case are actually good quality as well so don't think there just going to send you some cheep freebies.  The soundtrack is also rather good and is worth a listen if your a fan of game soundtracks.  Have Fun!

title: Fantastic, fun, and positive game for the whole family.
text: Fantastic game.  Played it with the kids and they absolutely love it.  Bright and colorful levels, fantastically cute and well designed characters, and engaging fun gameplay make this a must have for any XBox owner.  The framerate on the XBox One X is smooth and locked at 60FPS.  And after all that, the message of the game, one of perseverance, positive action, and just plain fun is something that we need a lot more of in this world.  I got 2, one for us and one for gifting this Christmas.  I have a feeling, I am going to need a couple more copies.  Do yourself and your family a favor and give this game a try, you won't be disappointed.

title: Give it time
text: Most people who reviewed this did it shortly in. Not seeing all its flaws but focus more on the "new" facial features from real actors.(Cool I admit) That really is all the game has. Searching for clues and trying to read people. The story plays out the same no matter what you do. Its like you don't even need to be envolved. The shooting system is terrible, with no physics or realism to people you shoot.(That we had in Red Dead Remption) Nothing feels weighted or real.(The cars all handle like modern front wheel drive sport compacts not two ton rear wheel drive dinosaurs with leaf springs and you can not be hurt in them) The damage to the cars is also lame as well as the 86-87mph speed cap.(UNREALISTIC and really mad me mad. They give you real named cars of the period and you get a 140mph Duesenberg and you can go 86-87. Sound fun?) Now you wonder why I only focus on the cars. Well after you beat the game you have 8 lifeless miles of L.A. to drive.(There seriously there is nothing else to do and you can't go into most of interesting buildings.) The feeling of this game is like you control nothing. You can not take out your gun, you have to really try to hit a person with your car and even then they don't usually die. You can't go in the water(Like RDR), and there are no mini games or anything to do. The music really defines the game. There are two or three songs worth listening to and the rest is trash, they have talk radio and shows.(Samething Jack Benny is a good touch but the rest of the radio is annoying) I do not recomend this game to anyone. You can get all you need of it off of a video sample because thats how distant this game seems.

title: Great Game!
text: I was anxious to upgrade to the new Bejeweled 2.  I first downloaded the free trial and the 60 free minutes went way too fast.  After purchasing the unlock key online I have logged over 100 hours playing since November, it's that addictive!  The four different versions of the game (classic, puzzle, action and endless) all have bonus versions that unlock when you reach specific levels.  For Classic, it's level 20 and for Action it's level 9.  The Endless level criteria is somewhere over level 200 but I haven't reached that one yet.  This is a great game, if you liked Bejeweled you will love Bejeweled 2!

title: Excellent Golf Sim
text: This is a very good golf simulation. The graphics are great, even on a PC without 3d cards.  You have different options for play, Tri-Click or Trueswing. The Trueswing has 2 options, horizontal or vertical (Vertical  you pull back and move forward the mouse while horizontal you move left to  right) Tri-Click is a bar that move up and down (Power bar) and you click  where it reaches your desired power. I prefer trueswing because i think its  more realistic. The are 7 courses with game but you can download new ones  from the internet. Also a course architect which lets you make your own  course. There are 3 types of play, recreation, practice and tournaments. In  tournaments you can play individually or in team play. I could go on more  about the features and there are alot more but this is just a great game  and anyone, golf player or not should have this in their game collection.

The aesthetic alone is clean, very cute, and very obviously Pikachu! I've gotten a lot of compliments on it. It has compartments for pretty much any switch accessory you'd need, and it has plenty of room for more stuff if needed. It even has room for a 3DS and games! There's an elastic strap to keep everything in place as well. The only thing I'd add is more velcro enclosures in the top compartment pockets to keep stuff up top from shifting. Other than that, it's absolutely worth the price. I'm super happy with it!

title: Best online for simulations!
text: I went to ground school with the aspirations of becoming a private pilot.  While taking my flight lessons, I purchased this game and used it as a backup and practice when not in the classroom or in the cockpit.  This game is worth buying just for the schooling provided.  Microsoft did such an amazing job of recreating some of the greatest planes that I felt like I was sitting in my plane.  Using the many online programs that go with this game, you can talk to ATC, have live weather conditions and even see who's flying around you.  This is the next best thing to flying and I still prefer this version over FSX.

title: Controller may not work as expected!
text: So I have used this controller for about two weeks after buying the switch in late November and it was perfectly fine. Despite having some missing features of the pro controller, it still felt great to use for the switch. Fast forward about 8 months, I have not used the controller at all and when I go to use it, the right joystick basically does not function at all. It has a mind of its own and my question is how could this happen if I had only used it for a short period of time and put it away safely? Maybe I was just unlucky to get a bad controller shipped out to me, but again if the controller wouldn't work I would at least expect it to not work out of the box or to lose its life after many hours of gameplay. If you can save enough to buy the pro controller, I would recommend that instead which is what I chose to do after experiencing the rightstick issue.

title: Great idea--flawed product
text: We received the Wii Fit as a present last Christmas. It worked, as far as we could tell, for several weeks. Then the balance board would only work intermittently. We weren't sure if the batteries were at fault, or if there was some flaw with the board. Within 90 days, the board stopped working altogether. The system "looks" for it, but can never connect with it. It's a huge disappointment since the Wii Fit games require the board to work. When we checked with Nintendo about a repair or replacement, we found we were outside of the warranty period. Crazy. It's a great idea, but the implementation is flawed and the company, while willing to sell millions of them, isn't willing to make sure they work. Undoubtedly our last product from Nintendo.

title: This is not the dynasty warriors you are used to and that is a good thing. This is koei tecmo's to mix things ...
text: People need to chill. This is not the dynasty warriors you are used to and that is a good thing. This is koei tecmo's to mix things up into an action rpg hybrid. Once you get used to the slower pace and flow of the open world battles, it gets its hooks into you. This game rules. Reviewers and people crying foul on the internet don't understand the vision. If you like dynasty warriors and rpgs, then this game is for you. I don't understand the hate this game is receiving. This has the best combat controls of any other koei game outside of 'berserk'. You can use points once you level up to grow your character in any direction you see fit. You have the most control of how to punish your enemies and continue your combos into the realm of the absurd. I. Love. This. Game. Must buy. Highly recommend.

title: Great game with good story and nice puzzles
text: If you ever enjoyed one of Layton's adventures for DS or if you were fan of Mystery Case Files - this is definately something of interest to you. It's another very nice sample of how Nintendo DS is good platform for adventure games. Story is interesting and tends to keep you wanting to solve the mystery. I liked the quite unique gameplay (it's mix of adventure mechanic and hidden object style). I absolutely love the graphics! Music could be better, but it fits game well. After beating the main story mode you can run for higscores in minigame mode (and quite a lot of minigames there are) or you can have some quick fun with additional typical hidden object scenes gathered in what they call 'Hidden World' mode. Generally if you are adventure or puzzle fan - it's highly recommended. And for it's price - it's quite a bargain.

title: Not really sure what happened here...
text: So, I have played need for speed for years, and was stuck on the previous NFS:MW from like 2005. So, when i saw this one, i had to preorder it. To give you an idea of how stoked i was, i havnt pre-ordered a game since halo 3. I was way looking forward to it because of the experience i had on the previous version. I still play the original quite often because i enjoyed the gameplay quite a bit. Then the game was released. I have put in a total of like 5 hrs on it and most of that was trying to see if it would get better. I really wanted to give it a chance, after all, i blew quite a bit of money on it. The only problem was, i felt like it took every aspect of the game i loved and threw it out the window. The handling took forever to get used to, and seemed almost like they were going for a more realistic feel(in a game that is obviously not realistic, i wasnt buying gran turismo). It doesnt even feel realistic either, more like a melding of the two that leaves it just a pain to use. I loved the first NFS:MW because there was a great story to it. This one, however, i have yet to see anything that resembles a story. I thought at first that i would be excited about being able to pick up whatever car i came across. And for the first hour it was really cool to see what stuff was out there. Then, of course, I got most of the cars immediately available and suddenly i had no goals. Yes, i could go for the most wanted list, but what incentive was there for that? The upgrades for your cars arent that spectacular. There was no story to move you forward. I felt really no inclination to do anything beyond running away from the cops(tough though it is because of the handling). Im sorry if i seem negative, but the only experience i really was basing it on how it was compared to the previous NFS:MW. If this is supposed to be progress, i will gladly stick with my 2005 version. Wish i could give back the game, but its digital. Got me hooked long enough to get me to buy it, but lets me down an hour later. If you are looking at all for the experience of the first NFS:MW, DO NOT buy this game. You will only end up disappointed.

title: 3 hour install!!!!????!!!!
text: Fondly remembering hundreds of hours playing the old Starcrafts, I foolishly bought SC2.  First, it took half an hour for the cd to load on to my Mac.  Then, 10 minutes for patches to load once online, while being prompted this would take "less than 2 minutes".  Then, before I can play alone offline like an old guy like me wants to, I have to download a "game client".  Even on my cable broadband connection, this is estimated to take 2 HOURS!!!!  Wait now, this is just ridiculous.  Of course, you can't get your money back for unopened software, so I just got screwed.  Tried customer service, not timely or relevant.  If you are not a hard core gamer who thrives on internet play, perpare to be abused and disappointed.  SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!

title: Wanted to keep it....
text: Per the title, I really wanted to keep this baby. It's quiet, looks sharp and the controller led lights look great as well. The ps5 adheres to the stand well, its a sturdy stand and would be a great value for your money if it wasnt for the ps5 flaw ill mention later. All in all, this vertical stand is the best you can buy imo. HOWEVER, there is the reason which I had to return this. Apparently there is a design flaw in the playstation 5 for both the disc and digital editions. That design flaw is that over time as the ps5 stands upright the liquid metal will leak out of its housing and ruin the motherboard of the ps5 as it is conductive to electricity. No matter what upright stand that is purchased, those stands won't save the damage over time to this expensive ps5 hardware. I returned as soon as I found this out and bout a horizontal stand and a separate fan that plugs in via USB port in the back of the console. Sad I had to return this product as convenient as it was but I can't risk my ps5 to break on me in the next couple of years.

title: Highly recommend for all abilities
text: This is an incredibly well made game that gets you hooked the first time you play it.  I started playing guitar years ago but after learning a few bits and pieces of various songs, I would get frustrated put the guitar down for a long time.  This game will allow you to finally learn songs all the way through without getting frustrated at any one particular riff.  Plus, reading tabs is MISERABLE and takes way more effort than it should.  Being able to slow the song down in the riff repeater is an absolute game changer... I'm not sure how anyone can learn guitar without the riff repeater!  Highly recommend for all abilities.  It's giving me the opportunity to learn something new and build a skill rather than wasting my free time getting humiliated by 11 year olds on Call of Duty!

title: Probably the worst video game ever
text: Probably the worst video game ever. The controls are abysmally bad. The game will require you to glide for approximately 100 Yards yet the glide ability will shut down for no reason a all after about 50 Yards. Prepare to repeat easy missions over and over and over and over and over again simply because the game designers failed to dial in the controls in any way. Controlling Batman is frustrating repetitive and downright awful.But that's nothing compared to the sheer awfulness of the constant Batmobile missions. The Batmobile is clunky unwieldy will get stuck on anything at all, every bench every concrete barricade basically everything will snag the Batmobile during timed missions. . The game requires oprecision driving from the Batmobile yet makes driving it about as precise as smashing your hand with a brick. Arkham Knight is unfortunately far less fun than smashing your hand with a brick. If you like getting a headache from a terribly designed game then Batman Arkham Knight is a must purchase. Otherwise just save the money. THIS GAME SUCKS!

title: Wii controller rechargable batteries
text: The batteries only last for two hours.  Regular batteries last for three to four days.  I couldn't recommend these batteries to anyone.  I had much better luck with INSTEN brand.

title: Five Stars
text: Kids love this game and the price was perfect!

title: I thought this was a good headset but mine is mysteriously not working already
text: I thought this was a good headset but mine is mysteriously not working already. Probably used 10 times. Very disappointed.

title: Fallout with friends, Like it or play another game
text: Where to start, I am an old school gamer growing up gaming on the computer with pinball or playing the original command and conquer. Over the years I have played many great games but fallout always has stood out for me. The mechanics of the game are different don't get me wrong but most gamers like that kind of exploration and making the game your own adventure. While playing fallout 4 i had a group chat with 4 people all playing and we would laugh about our deaths or fails when running onto a mine field. Now we have a chance for us to play together. I have to admit I was scared because so many online games just try to hard but after playing the beta I can see this game will grow over the years just as Rainbow six siege. (recommend for CS go players or hardcore battlefield players) All games have their bugs and Bethesda with their system pushes the limits on issues but they are trying something new. We will have bugs that is no shock to long time fans. But if you can look past that and just make your journey you will not be disappointed. The best part is I found a world boss and I only had basic stuff so would be a high risk of death but than multiplayer comes into play, i hit my team up and 2 mins later i had my team of 4 together ready to battle the beast. but 2 mins later we had 2 other people jump in to help us. It was great and actually fault like you were like those raiders you would see randomly in fallout games. In the end we all traded with each other seeing what the beast dropped for everyone. I just want to say go in it open minded. if you like fallout alone or with friends you will enjoy your money spent. If you are here just to complain how its not PUBG or COD than go to the forms we don't need your bad vibes. See you out in the wasteland and good luck to you all.

title: shallow and brief
text: the game has the lowest character roster since super street fighter 2, except that was a much better game. The newest version in the series feels rushed in order to prepare for the evo pro fighting tournament scene and clearly left out modes and features that make up the back bone and overall quality of typical fighting games. Its a very bad sign when this game comes out and is unable to have actual 3 round gameplay, but mortal kombat xl comes out 2 weeks later and utterly destroys the game in terms of character roster, modes, story and ease of play, honestly, dont ever pay more than maybe 20 or 30 for this game. It's very clear capcom just doesnt care anymore about the core fanbase that has been loyal since '92

title: Couch potatoes beware
text: I bought this after reading some of these reviews, and I have to admit I was not disappointed.  My husband and I had just returned from eating too much out at a restaurant, and I was feeling fat.  I came home and hooked it up for the first time, and was moving in no time.  The menuing is a little klunky when you first start, but the secret is to get off the mat and use the wii remote until you become more comfortable with the mat and the menus.  Needless to say after a full meal, I danced for two hours, and guess what - no indigestion.

title: sound adapter
text: works great with my xbox1x

title: Not A Nintendo Product
text: This cord is not made by Nintendo. It is a flimsy, unbranded knockoff. The advertising is very misleading. Avoid this product.

title: Macabre and punishing
text: This game is simply about running and evading.  It lacks the earned and fun power ups of a Metroid franchise game especially on the early levels. Samus on extreme Nerf. As you play it does get a little better however the early level constant restarts will drive most players away.  Learn to love camping AI with invincibility against your character.  Graphics and play are fluid with reasonable cutscenes for a Switch game but the stupid hard difficulty is not for all

title: DOA
text: It was DOA. Blue pulse of death... going to give it one more shot after I get a replacement, otherwise isn't there another next gen console shipping soon?

title: Is not redeemable after purchase, must wait days to redeem, this is inefficient.
text: buy this from in a store with the actual card instead so you can redeem it immediately.  Amazon is horrible with digital services like this.

title: Can't do much offline
text: My husband understandably doesn't want our kids playing online with others yet so there's so much they can't do with this game. I don't understand why you have to pay a monthly membership and go online to be able to do anything. We haven't been able to figure out how to get multiple of our kids to play at once (even our teens who know these systems well). Pretty disappointed in that!

title: Amazing
text: Hours and hours of fun for my girls. Don't want to stop

title: Finally!
text: Finally a dragonball game that brings back memories of the budokai and tenkaichi series. This is by far one of the better entries in recent years. If you were dissatisfied with battle of Z, this game is far better in every single category. The fighting mechanics are great and you'll soon find yourself not wanting to put the controller down. Character customization is an awesome part of this game as you get to create your very own z fighter from a variety of races (i.e. saiyans, nameks, majins, earthlings, Frieza's race). All in all, this game redeems the series for the failed attempts at trying to recreate the success of the ps2 games.

title: Best Game Yet for the DS
text: Too many people are comparing the DS version to the Xbox 360 or PS3 version. You can't do that and be unbiased. There is no way the game can be rendered or played the same way on the DS as it is on the stationary console systems. I own it for both DS and 360 and it's a great game for both. But I think as far as DS games goes it really shines. Beautifully rendered graphics for the DS, excellent sound, and a wonderful storyline. If you're a DS buff like myself and enjoy portable games more than console games this is a must own for your favorite pocket pal.

title: Stopped working after a month
text: After one month my 2DS froze, up to this point I thought it was fine, marred only by the fact the screen in open at all time making it easier to damage and scratch the screen. If that had happened it would have been a fault of mine, instead all of the button and the touch screen stopped working even though I took care to make sure it wasn't scratched and nothing lodged in the buttons. Even at the cheaper price I can't recommend anything that stops working after just little over a month.

title: Xbox is King
text: Awesome build love the quality and compact look of the slim and how it has the built in power brick great product Xbox forever.

Also tried several monitors and hdmi cables. Can't get the system into safe mode either. Guess I won't be part of the launch day crew....

title: Decent Controller
text: Feels good in my hands and everything has been good so far.  Pay couple bucks more and get the more expensive one.  I'm not sure about the cheaper version, but this comes very close to the original shock 3 controller.

title: Nintendo Switch Carry all
text: Love the color and durability. So cute and fashionable. Lots of space for all your games and console. Like the strap for comfort of carrying.

title: Great mouse for the price
text: I ordered this for used as a laptop mouse. I've become accustomed to my razer deathadder and wanted something less expensive but similar. This has the same buttons which is good. My only complaint is that I can't tell what DPI setting im on. The seller was phenomenal in helping me when I had questions about the mouse, for example I thought the  red button next the the left click was a programmable button but its not. its like a quickfire button or something. I am guessing the dpi changes when you press the button but there is no visible way to tell, no software comes with it but windows 7 recognized and installed it right away. I played l4d2 and I am almost just as accurate with this mouse on what I assume is 1200dpi, but like i said i can't tell. supposedly you can change it in the control panel. its definitely worth the price.

title: ... research before buying the game but this is nothing like the Gran Turismo I use to play
text: I guess I should of done research before buying the game but this is nothing like the Gran Turismo I use to play. I like the old set up where you had to race against the Ai for cups and had to have certain cars for races. I see the campaign mode is like the old driving school where you get your licenses and that's it. I don't get why you have to wait for a races online. It makes no sense to me. Wish I didn't buy this game.

title: Great for playing games on AppleTV
text: This works great with the AppleTV 4.  We're mainly using it with the open source Provenance App which work together flawlessly. The instructions aren't extremely clear, for example it looks like the controller supports multi-player, but not sure how that actually works--perhaps it is something within the App that needs to be figured out. The battery life has been great--some have complained that a lightning cable is required for charging, given the AppleTV remote not to mention your iPhone also use the lighting cable, I don't see it as an issue--one less proprietary cable to keep up with.

title: Very good game!
text: Lots of options, puzzles and other play items.  Long playing.  A game that can be played again and again.

title: Very happy
text: Very good. I had a little problem at first; with one of my games, it acted like the stick handle was stuck, and it wouldn't cooperate, but I remember back in the day, that would happen with other controllers too. I just took out the batteries in these and it has worked just fine ever since and I am sure it will. I was glad to find these on Amazon and I am very happy with them.

title: Cool
text: My son loves it for his ps4. It took him a day to get used to it.

title: Poor quality broke with in a week
text: Had issues with the buttons and stick action from the get go. LL button got stuck and stopped working completely by the end of week one. Controller stopped working on a whole just after. Big waste of money, do yourself a favor spend a bit more and get a brand name control.

title: The best affordable NES clone
text: I recently got back into retro gaming after several years.  Since all of my TVs are HD ones, I decided to look into HDMI NES clones.  In my opinion, this one is the best for it's price range.  Many hardcore gamers always talk about how most of these clones are off when it comes to the colors and sounds when compared to the original.  As a less than casual gamer, I haven't really noticed  the differences until recently.  In doing comparisons with other newer HD clones, I believe this system is as close as you're ever going to get (without spending too much money) to the original NES.  It is most noticeable with Mike Tyson's Punch Out.  Glass Joe is not overly pink.  Referee Mario's face is peach colored, unlike most clones that render his face the same color as his shirt...white.  Also, there's very little noticeable lag when playing.  The controllers, while oddly shaped and a bit think, have a similar feel to the originals.  I don't think you can go wrong with this console.

title: It won't let you do the whole experience until December 1st!
text: Don't freak out if it's grayed out or does not let you. I set my switch ahead and it works once it's December 1st. The first game is fun and I won't spoil anything!

title: Life changing game!!! Approved by Trump and Putin.
text: Best game ever made, it will bring your childhood fantasies into reality, you will get appointed a job as the new head of the FBI in Trumps presidency and allow you to see into the future just like his sister Raven. I give this game 12 out of 10 stars. You will also gain the ability to speak Russian.

title: Lackluster
text: Game play is clunky, story is stale, graphics are god-awful for the Switch's capabilities

title: Sony Playstation 2 Dualshock Controller Emerald
text: This controller is very nice and probably the best. It works with big and small hands it feals non greasy(unless you have greasy hands) it has a nice vibration if you notice on some of the other controllers the vibration is too big. Now I own a PlayStation 2 and i have played with a lot of other controllers but they dont last the buttons get pushed in the analog is too sensitive etc. Although with this controler ive had it for 2 years and it has yet to break on me and people this is a sensitive object dont slam it it will work well as long as you take care of it. Also the button reaction on this is the quickest I have seen with those big bulky ones the reaction is very bad and sometimes the analogs dont work properly. You may have also seen this controller in black and teal there all the same price and all have the same durability the only differene is the color. I rate this item 5 stars because its the best controller out there.

title: Relisted to clear bad reviews? Poor QC?
text: I knew this unit was a decent choice but often has lighting issues after extended use. Noticed this looked to be a new listing or model so i took a chance. Out of the box my Multi Function Display on my Throttle does not have backlighting and the Throttle Force Tensioning dial has no discernible effect of the throttle tension, be it at its max or min setting.....  unit are a bit light, it would be nice to have the bases weighted. I will have to DIY some steel plates to the bottom to prevent them from shifting in use.

title: One Star
text: Scalpers ruin it for people that actually want it. Don't buy.

title: Fantastic Game for Umizoomi Fans
text: I purchased this game for my five year old to help him improve his math skills prior to entering Kindergarten next fall.  I was so happy to see that my 3 and 7 year old also clamored to give the game a try.  My 7 year old is veyr skilled at math and isn't really a Umizoomi fan, yet he even said he enjoyed playing the game and thought it was cool (high praise).  The game interweaves the characters talking and the games you play.  I like that the characters talk the children through how to play the game so kids can easily follow the instructions.  If you are purchasing this for a 2 or 3 year old I would say that you should be prepared to help them a bit.  My 3 year old has just turned 3 and some of the sections were a little challenging for him and he'd get frustrated.  One of the things I don't like about the game is that it's not that easy to skip from section to section.  You have to get through the first part of the game before you can move between areas.  I'd like to seem them change this if they make an updated version.  For my five year old I was pleased because the content is a good mix of easy and more challenging.  My goal is to familiarize him with addition and I think this game does this in a nice way.

title: Oh, if only...
text: I LOVE this game.  I loved it for the Xbox, but couldn't afford one of those.  So imagine my joy of finding out it's available for the pc!  I ordered it as fast as I could and tore into it when it arrived.  I was playing along just fine, when all of a sudden, the auto-save stopped working and I couldn't manually save, either.  Exiting the game and trying to reaccess my garden led to me being told that the file was messed up.  Weird.  I uninstalled and reinstalled the game and started playing on a whole new file.  At the same point in the game, it messed up again.  I looked online and found out that apparently some users just have this problem where the game will not save after a while and to this day I haven't found a patch or anything for it.  If I'd known before I bought the game I wouldn't have been as upset because I would have at least been prepared.

title: Great controls - driving is way easier.
text: I use the controllers with FS19. It came preconfigured to work straight out of the box. This has made the game much more realistic and enjoyable. Driving and operating equipment is much smoother. I would definitely recommend this product.

title: Awesome!
text: I purchased the Wii Active More Workouts after a couple of 30 day challenges with the Wii Active.  I must say the More Workouts is awesome!  The repetitions are faster so unlike with the Wii Active, I don't find myself getting bored and frustrated with the speed.  The activities are more fun and fast paced.  Where the inline skating got boring after a while because really its just doing loooooong squats and jumps it has been replaced with a surfboard activity where you are squatting, jumping, and moving your arms.  It requires serious attention and keeps your heart racing.  I did increase the resistance band by replacing it with a pilates heavy resistance band which really helps take the workout to the extreme.  I like this more than the Wii Active initial game which I still liked a lot but the changes in this game just make it more active and fun.  Two thumbs up!

title: I got this as a gift for my grandkids. ...
text: I got this as a gift for my grandkids. My son tells me that it was broken and would not work when he got it.  However, he sent it back and feels confident that he will get a replacement.

title: Perfect for wireless controllers
text: This is the first off brand controller battery system I've bought that actually performs well. After reading the reviews I decided to give it a chance and I'm glad I did. With others I've dealt with short battery life, dead batteries, poor fit, dead chargers, etc. This one, however, is a winner. The batteries fit perfectly into the controllers and the controllers fit perfectly onto the charger. No wiggling or twisting needed, just set them down and they charge. My kids have never played long enough to run the batteries down so I'm really happy about the battery life. Everything just works and that earns 5 stars.

title: So much fun!
text: Working out is fun with zumba...it doesn't even feel like exercise!  I've attended numerous zumba classes and find that this game is just as much fun as a live class (and much more cost effective).  I LOVE it!

title: Crisis Core
text: Since the other review is very lengthy, and covers pretty much everything, I'll keep this short and sweet. If you're a fan of the Final Fantasy series (particularly VII) then you should buy this game. If you don't have a PSP, this game is worth buying one for. I didn't have a PSP, this game came out, I bought a PSP to play it, I am extremely happy with my decision. I do recommend playing through Final Fantasy VII first as you will appreciate the characters, environments, and cameos a little more. If you do happen to play this first, I can almost guarantee you'll be shopping for a copy of VII when you're done.

However, upon testing it myself, I turns out I got a drum set that only works on Rock Band: Beetles and any other game that came after. Meaning, not only was I misinformed, but now I was extremely limited to what games I could actually use it on.

title: Fun and Relaxing . . . an always WIN game!
text: I like this even better than the "traditional" version that I have. I could live without the story, but it adds to the entertainment part of the game.  I like the option to shuffle the tiles when the game is "over" . . . this pretty much  eliminates losing.  My only complaint is that whenever I wish to leave the game, I haven't figured out how to exit the "main menu" without using the "ctrl, alt, delete" command to end the game from the task manager.  I'm sure there is a way, but I just haven't discovered it yet.  It is still one of my favorite "kick back and relax" games!

title: Good case
text: Good price and sturdy

title: Great game, service needs work though
text: I read through hundreds of reviews saying this game is terrible and that people should spend their money elsewhere. I wanted to see what the whole thing was about so I bought it. I do not regret it at all. Very addictive and after an hour or two of frustratingly trying to get the game to run, I played till 4:00 in the morning. I like how you evolve and conquer other creatures but my favorite part is when you first start out as a cell. The only reason why I would not recommend this to EVERYONE is that the online servers don't work, the registration keys might not work either, and getting the game to start up everytime is a hassle. Don't get me wrong, I love this game but EA has to fix these issues.

title: Retro Entertainment System
text: This system is worthless. When I got mine I plugged it in and the game came on. When I tried to play the game it was blocky. The game I used was cleaned before using it in this system. After 1 short game the screen went black. No picture but I could still hear the game. I should have listened to the other negatives and not bothered to get this system. Waste of time. Look for a real Working Nintendo system. Sorry to disappoint but the reality is this is a cheap and worthless wanna be. This is not an Amazon issue, it is a manufacturer issue.  Amazon was very helpful in getting a refund. The only positive for this item. Stay away from this item!!!!!!

But to double check i still plugged it into my Xbox 360 and it still did not work. After i sent the seller an email back he didnt not respond to me, and still has yet to do so, and i have now filed my claim to get reimbursed. DO NOT BUY FROM THIS GUY!!!!!

title: disappointed

The exercises are lame and simply repeat themselves over and over during the time you set for the work out. Watching the screen while exercising - especially during yoga is not always possible. Additionally, not all the selections for site modification are available and the music selections are lame! title: The lighting is basically terrible
text: I purchased this after seeing the unlit pad and this LED lit pad with world map and decided to spend the extra money on the RGB lighting. I was disappointed and returned the pad. It was a waste of my time because first, the lower edge was almost unlit super dim. Then it had strange hot spots in different areas of the map. If I am going to spend the extra money it only makes sense that the pad look evenly lit. Another thing, the picture is deceiving. It does not light in the manner shown. It appears to have to leds so it cannot show the different colors in the different areas the picture portrays. It combines 2 led colors at each of the ends of the switch. There are other options that are better but the pad is not as big.

title: Extremely unhappy
text: This product has a destructive "anti copy" virus like program on it called "secure rom". It was very difficult to get it to install on my sons computer.  Once installed he was able to play it for 20 minutes before his computer crashed due to the secure rom junk on this disc.  The computer ceased being able to boot and required a complete re-installation of the operating system, programs and personal data.  I think the sims games are wonderfully creative but most of the titles and expansions are a royal pain in the rear to install with various incompatablities and problems.  Now we have the company treating it's customers, by default as criminals and putting "secure rom" tech on ALL their products thereby punishing all us honest gullible gamers who legally purchase the games.  It's well past time that these companies started treating us like customers again rather than criminals.

title: Excellent service

Amazon said that I was supposed to receive them 2 weeks later but the seller sent them immediately and even emailed me the tracking number for the package which arrived 3 days later. I tested out all the games and they work flawlessly and look in great condition as promised. Quick and great service. I recommend this guy!

The games seem to play full speed and the graphics are good.  Too bad they didn't make it HDMI.  It is just mono RCA.  This is fun and if it breaks, oh well it was priced the same as 1 modern game.

title: Never recommend it. Worst FPS gaming mouse ever.
text: The worst FPS gaming mouse in the world. First, the design is really awful. What's funny is this mouse is called best design for hand, LOL. There is no where for my little finger and after using it for a long time, my little finger hurts and it's really not good for long time playing. Also, the mouse is pretty big. Second, the most inconvenable thing is the poor quality. After using for about two weeks, the rubber pad on the right side just fall down. And after another week, the left one also fall down.
