title: Fun for both of us
text: My wife and I have played through worlds one and two, and we are both really enjoying the game.  The game is a very good combination of challenge and fun, and we've found ourselves laughing out loud at the fun and intensity of the experience more than once.

title: Fine work and great gaming experience
text: The material feels like real car's wheel (at least, comparing with my Audi S5 but much smaller obviously). Smooth force feedback. Button layout is the best in wheels that I ever found, feeling better than TMs. Fine work, the wheel, shifter, and the pedals. The pedals are reality (also comparing with S5, except the max depth of the break). Works for PCs, and also has a switch for changing between PS3 or PS4 mode. The shift light also works for PC if the game supports it (like PCars). If the game is old but compatible with G27, G29 will also works fine. Just more expensive than expected.

title: WARNING!!!
text: In the middle of the night, the power adapter blew up creating a loud noise and a giant spark of blue light.  At the time of the explosion, the nintendo was not even on or being used!  It was just simply plugged into my power strip where all my pricey electronics are plugged into.  Was not even overloaded with multiple plug ins.  I would take caution when buying products from this seller!  They did refund my money when I told them what happened, but this is some major BS.  This product is not safe for consumers.  Don't want to see anyone else get ripped off.

title: Piece of junk!
text: My ps4 has been very noisy and hot, so I bought this to cool it down and perhaps make it a little quieter. However, the two fans don't run like normal computer fans. They're very noisy, and don't blow much air. My couch is about 15 feet away from my TV and I could still hear this fan over the sound of my game. 30 minutes into my game, I got up and felt my console, and it was still very hot, just slightly cooler. I'm disappointed because I like having a built in charger, but the ineffectiveness of the fans and loud noise is why I'm returning this. Don't waste your money.

title: Console was defective, kept freezing
text: I purchased this last month.  I played briefly (less than an hour) only a few times, intermittently over the course of the month, so not a lot of heavy use.  The console would freeze while trying to install games from disk, as well as freeze during game play.  Sometimes it wouldn't even load the game at all, or would get stuck on the green loading screen for a long time and I would have to hard reboot it.  I spent more time pushing the power button and holding it for 10 seconds than I did playing games.  Returned the refurbed console, and am getting a brand new one with a game bundle instead for a little more money, but will be worth it.

title: Unacceptable mispronunciations! Ridiculous vocabulary!
text: Although this game is fun at first, after a while I started to realize that even though the pronunciations sounded as though done by a native speaker, some of them are so off as to be laughable! For example the word "ratio" is pronounced "ratito" by the speaker! "Utensilios" is pronounced "UNtensilios", and so on.  And why would one wish to learn the word for "sliver" ("astillo") without having first learned the word for "little" ("poco") or other size-oriented words first? Not recommended! The mispronunciations are totally unacceptable for a language program.

title: unacceptable .
text: Capcom you have mess up Big Time. not putting the dlc on disc that is really unacceptable ya'll just plain lazy.

title: Previously opened package.
text: I don't often review things at one star unless I'm genuinely disappointed. This is not advertised as a previous opened or refurbished controller. However, everything indicates this box had been opened previously, per the shoddy sticker barely holding it closed and the uncoiled cable. Maybe the controller will work fine, but as it stands, I'm not happy to get what appears to be a previous opened package, and for all I know a non-new, refurbished controller. That's a violation of trust, bare minimum. Buyer beware.

title: Physical disc.....Yes
text: I really enjoy having a real.copy. It bothers me the industry is trying to make the console experience like a steam box. I will be ordering this game soon.

title: Highly recommend!
text: Great product!  Reccomend to anyone!

title: Here we go again...
text: The Lego series of games have struck yet again, only this time around they've joined up with none other than the Batman license.  Lego Batman for the DS is undoubtedly the best Lego-based video game to hit the DS yet, as you play as The Dark Knight himself along with his trusty sidekick Robin in tow, and take on some familiar faces from Batman's classic rogues gallery.  If you've played any of the other Lego videogames, you'll feel right at home here, and as you'd come to expect, there are hordes of unlockables and bonuses to find that will keep your interest.  The only downsides of Lego Batman are the same flaws that plagued the previous Lego-based games: the game itself is short and quite easy to get through, and gameplay-wise nothing has changed from previous outings.  Still, Lego Batman looks good with larger environments, and Danny Elfman's classic Batman film score is put to good use as well.  Plus, with all the unlockables, you'll be busy for a while.  All in all, if you dug the previous Lego games, Lego Batman is definitely right up your alley.

title: Perfect Switch Case!
text: Perfect Switch case! I wanted something a little smaller for travel and this thing is perfect! The switch fits perfectly and there is room to store several game cards as well as a zipper compartment to store a charging cable. It feels very secure, and is nice and lightweight. The color is very much a rose gold and not as pink as the photos, but still very nice.

title: Amazing!!
text: These headphones sound absolutely great!! My favorite part is that it doesn't take batteries, and it doesn't noticeably drain my controller battery either! Let's not even get into how well it matches the halo 5 Xbox one and controller, because it is awe inspiring. They even come with a cord so you can plug them into anything with a headphone jack and use them as normal headphones!! I highly recommend, 10 out of 10 for sure!!

title: E-sports has ruined Gran Turismo
text: This game is all about online game play.  Gone are the old single player cup days.  This thing is made for e-sports and e-sports training alone.  There is also a whole section of the game dedicated to taking pictures of the cars with about a thousand possible camera adjustments.  I dont remember photography being such a staple of racing.  It feels like they were building the game and stopped after they got finished with all the hard work, forgetting to put in any type of traditional career mode.  Also to get onto a race online you have to wait for them to become available.  Sometimes an hour of waiting.... for a single race.  The game sucks don't buy it.

title: Could have been so much better
text: I bought sm3d all stars for one simple reason. I grew up in the nintendo generation. If you have a switch then I say this is a must have game. However it is very disappointing that nintendo didn't give this trio the justice it deserves. Especially sm64. Such an iconic game. (number 1 selling game of all time on the n64). It deserved a complete remaster. HD graphics, improved controls (the controls were total bs and that came with this addition as well) etc. Woulda, coulda, shoulda been amazing. So on one hand its cool to play it exactly as it was 25 years ago because it's what we had and it was all we knew. On the other hand it totally sucks to play it as it was 25 years ago because what we have now as far as tech is leaps and bounds better. Long story short - the nostalgia trip is cool and its a 3.5 star game overall but the lack of love from nintendo is apparent and disappointing. Do you need this game? Well let's be honest. We don't "need" any game. But if you're a full grown adult nintendo kid with a switch then there's no reason not to have sm3d all stars in your game collection

title: Great RPG!
text: I just finished Magical Starsign and it was really a joy to play. I logged in 36 hours and I haven't played the multiplayer yet either. The last RPG I've played to end was FF7, and while this one didn't come close to its emotional depth, I thought the play was pretty similar and the fights followed the same pattern. It took me a while to really understand the role of the elements, but that might just be me being a dummy. The only detraction I could think of is the cuteness, some guys might feel a little girly playing a game with sugarstars and gummy worms. I thought it was adorable though (but I am a girl, so that might be why). I would recommend this game to anyone and everyone, if you can get past the cute factor it's a really good RPG to get into!

title: Not that great
text: First of all I totally agree with La Coccinelle's review. I have plenty of memory, graphic cards and anything else that this game needs to run and it is terrible, the graphics in my opinion are cheesy, it took forever to load and as my person on Twiiki Island was actually having fun it all crashed on me. I have unloaded the game and now my computer is happily running how it always does, great...honesty I feel these expansion packs are being put together too fast and not tested really well. The more that come out the more I am getting annoyed, there aren't that much things that adds to decorations, as I said the graphics are cheesy and it is not worth the time it takes to load the game for it to just crash... I can't take it back so it will just sit on a shelf collecting dust waiting to see if they come out with a patch or SOMETHING that will get it to work...I would not buy this until it has been out long enough for the glitches to be worked out...

title: Works better as a coaster, throw it in the trash
text: Can you give it a half star? Honestly the worst skate game...wait...worst game I have ever played. The controls are insane. You jump to grind and as soon as you press triangle, it will snap you onto the rail so hard, no matter how high above the rail you were or even if you weren't really aiming to grind. It is almost comical how poorly the controls are. Same goes for the graphics. I could not believe that on my 4K TV and PS4 something could look so PS1. The last complaint I have is that there are no customizble options that make any skate game worth it. Please save you money, I could not believe they are charging as much as they are for this piece of crap. Guaranteed if you bought this you are using it as a coaster, three it down the toilet, or are seriously depressed and made at yourself for owning this junk. Throw it in the trash.

title: My daughter's favorite DS game!
text: We have had this game for about two weeks now and my 6-year-old daughter has played nothing else since we bought it.  It was easy for her to figure out on her own, which isn't always the case with DS games.  She loves to groom the horses and pick out riding outfits for Barbie.  But her favorite thing is taking her horse through the jumping course and winning ribbons.  There are a bunch of other activities and mini-games too. I would highly recommend this game to young girls, especially those who are horse-crazy like mine!

text: Don't buy from scalpers! This is a game very dear to my heart and some scalper that doesn't care about anything but profit is trying to sell it for 3 times the price.

title: Bond, James Bond....Wow it's good to hear that again!
text: James Bond games have been selling sky high ever since the fantastic debut of Goldeneye. They were all so much fun and you couldn't ever get tired of them, but there was one thing that many people requested-a third person mode of agent 007. Now, that option is finally here with enhanced picture and sound that will launch you beyound the games action! Now with the great video performace of video game consoles, the picture is so clear and acute that it litterally makes it much more fun to play or watch! But what is really great about this game, is that it keeps the persona of James Bond. Most games now are just shoot 'em up, blow this and that up, then complete the game within a matter of hours because there isn't any challenge, except this one. It has realistic objectives like those that you would see in a 007 movie, the picture is so0o0o clear its like you're watching movie, the challenge is enticing and fun, and best of all-it has a good plot! But of course James Bond still has some old habits of his: fancy cars (Porsche Cayenne, Aston Martin Vanquish, modified motorcycles, race cars etc.), Q's handy gadgets and gizmo's, beatiful women, worthy adversaries, and of couse: vodka martini; shaken, not stired. This game is so much fun to play you'll absolutely love it! Even if you were dissapointed by Die Another Day (i sure was), this game is one hell of a welcome back! My hat goes off to EA Games on this one!

title: Bastardization of Candyland
text: It's truly awful what they've done to Candyland.  My daughter is turning 3 and I really wanted to buy it for her, but this new version of the game is terrible.  As others noted, the characters are oversexualized candy girls (with lollipop bustiers - really Hasbro? - and platform heels).  This doesn't seem appropriate in the least for preschoolers.  One has to wonder what kind of "Candy" you're going to get in this "Land"!  Also, I have a baby boy and want him to be able to play the game when he gets older too.  This version doesn't seem at all welcoming for boys.  It's quite girly.  Is Candyland for girls only now?  What a shame.  I returned this and found a 1978 version of the game on eBay.  No fairy girls with lollipop bustiers and platform heels.  A good size playing board.  A boy AND a girl, neither one oversexed, shown on the board.  I paid more but it's well worth it.  I recommend you head to eBay and find yourself a good vintage version while you can, because I bet they are going to be in high demand!

title: I'm incredibly pleased with this console
text: The performance of the One X is incredible. Every game I throw at it seems to be running at 60fps without a hitch. No screen tearing. No stuttering. Load times are lightening fast. I'm incredibly pleased with this console.

title: If your thinking about it get it.
text: It works great and I was a little skeptical because it is USB 2. But it works as well as my other USB 3 capture cards, as far as inputting the video signal. The only thing I don't like is the fact that it does not work without proprietary software running in the background. My other capture cards don't need drivers they are plug n play. However that would not stop me from recommending this capture card because if you are doing multi camera with a software switcher this is a good option it works with all the switchers I use for example OBS. Also if you use software switchers you know using 2 devices in the same hardware family can cause problems (if you didn't know, now you do). For example I have 2 other capture cards by the same manufacturer and the software gets confused and locks up because they show up as basically the same thing. Even two USB webcams, different models but same manufacturer causes problems with software switchers. So the thing I don't like helps because it shows up as a completely different device and makes it easier for the switching software to tell witch is witch. Since I got this I haven't had any problems switching between cameras. It worked flawlessly after I installed the software and it solved my problem with devices being too similar for the software. Great device if your thinking about it get it.

title: Better than Links LS 1999
text: I have played all the major computer golf games, and Jack 6 is by far the best. From the witty commentary of Gary McCord to the tremendous graphics. This game is meant for the avid golfer who wants a real life game experience but cannot get away. Why this game hasnt attracted more  attention is really a mystery.

title: One of the worst games I've ever played
text: This is not a review because I'm a new player and the game is too hard. I am a high level player of these NHL games and after a full week of playing and giving it countless chances, I can say that this is one of the worst games of all time. The features are amazing. I love how in depth the game is. But the gameplay itself is beyond pure garbage. The opposing AI will never ever be off your player. They can read exactly where you're going and make turns as you make them. Physics means nothing to the opposing AI while your AI is a joke. Passing feels completely random and don't even bother using stick lift. It doesn't work. The AI has a recovery time of zero while you get held down by unrealistic physics. I can't even begin to explain how frustrating it is. I like things to be difficult. I don't want to easily win every game. Losing games is good because that means the challenge is there. But I cannot deal with feeling cheated because of how unfair the game is. Winning even feels bad because the experience is so frustrating. EA is awful and I cannot stress enough that no one should waste their money on this horrible game.

title: Engaging storyline, great graphics, can be very taxing!
text: If you thought X-Wing vs. TIE was good, you'll love this. You play the role of the son of a family caught up in the Rebellion. You start by flying missions for your family business. Eventually you can join the Rebellion  and fly X-wings, A-wings, B-wings, and you even get the chance to fly the  Millennium Falcon! The range of missions is great, and you can practise  your skills in the simulator, or the pilot proving grounds. My only  criticism is that some of the early missions are very tricky, and the  difficulty does not always seem to increase in logical order.

title: USB Ports are incredibly tight and gutted one of my cords

title: Chill with the hate
text: I don't see what all the hate is about. I'm really pleased with WW2; graphics are beautiful, gameplay is excellent. COD games always come out with a bunch of negative reviews because of course there will be some bugs and glitches. Yes, the MP servers were down a lot the first few days, but now they're fine. There are a few other annoying things, like getting kicked back to the main screen after a match is over, but those will be fixed. The thing to focus on is whether or not you like the gameplay. There's no double jumping or jet packs, no lasers in space - it feels very gritty and real, and not everyone will enjoy that, but I sure do.

title: You cannot live without this game
text: Do you like Age of Empires, but wish it were a little more complex? Do you wish that you could have intense wars at some times, but at other times focus on developing your culture and economy, and keeping your citizens happy? Do you wish that diplomatic relations were more complex than just giving tribute? Then this game is for you! This is easily the best real-time strategy game I have played. I does take a day or so to learn how to play. But it's completely worth it. Runs great on Vista, but remember to update the drivers for your video card for best results. The instruction booklet is on the DVD, but you can print it out. Comes with a cool map of the world that is actually helpful for the game.

title: Soooooo Quiet.... I LOVE THIS
text: I love the value, especially for 2 of them. The design is also very nice.  The thing I love the most is that it is soooooo quiet. You don't even hear the clicks like other mouses.

title: Asian dynasties - A sweet addition
text: Well i dont want to spoil anyone by giving out too many details about China, India and Japan. ill just say that 3 new nations are unique, fun and easy to play with. All have specific only to them cards, wonders, military units.  The artists at Big Huge Games did a great job of capturing the unique building structures for the new factions too. They all share similar economic tree but have elemets that distinct them like Japan can't hunt but has Cherry Orchard, and its houses serve as shrines that attract wild animals and generate  3 different resources one ata time. India cant kill cows from lifestock  but uses them to gather Export, a new resource which you can spend to buy  some units from Consulate where you ally with European nations. Each new side has own strategy it can implement. India relies heavily on Elephants, China on its Banner Army. Its very fun, voice acting of villagers is excellent and amuzing as always so its really a joy to listen villagers speak back on new languages. Graphics are passable, they are a bit oldy compared to some other rts games on the market but the gameplay is what counts.  Its a rare and generous package of new visuals, new gameplay, and absolutely crucial improvements to the core game. If you weren't an Age III fan before Asian Dynasties, get ready to be one now.  A good title for fans, worth buying for those hoping for a reinvigoration of the series.

title: If you like hair trigger games
text: This game is beautiful. The music is soothing. It's a maze or puzzle game, no battling or killing enemies (that I have found so far). I guess some people would say it's challenging, but I consider a challenge to be something that might be difficult to figure out, but do-able once you figure out the sequence or proper procedure, or whatever. But this game has points where your movements have to be correct to less than a millimeter, or you will have to start the section over. It's not challenging, it's frustrating. A switch controller doesn't have the precision that is needed for this game. Your have to time jumps to the most finely tuned timing and exact landing points. I enjoy maze and puzzle style games, and was looking for an enjoyable laid back adventure game, but the frustration that comes with the exact precision needed in this game is frustrating. There is no music or art soothing enough to make up for the frustration level. I'm 43 years old. I can't imagine the tears or tantrums if I have this to one of my kids to play. There is zero forgiveness in this game. So, I guess if you like games where your movements must be refined and timed to a millimeter, and you like the stress of having to get long sequences of movements done using those precision, and if you are ok with starting over every time you make the slightest misstep, then maybe this game is ok for you.

title: A little disappointing
text: After watching all the hype, I eagerly awaited the August 14th release of Madden 08. I bought the game for PC the day it was released and right away I had problems with it. The installation went well, but then '08 would not run ("Security Module could not be activated:7001"). After an hour I finally found a fix by deleting some registry files. Expecting something close to the XBox 360 or PS3 version of '08, I was saddened to see the same menu screen as last year's Madden 07 PC version. I played several games and noticed very few differences from last year's PC version. Like anothre review said, the roster s were updated and there were 1 or 2 new graphical tweaks, but for the most part I felt like was playing Madden 07. Player movements are still slightly awkward and there are some clipping issues. A lot of hyped features like gang-tackling are noticeably absent from Madden 08 PC. I've played Madden 08 on the XBox360 and I gotta say the console version is way smoother and much more entertaining. If you have an option, skip the PC version of Madden 08 and go with the Xbox 360 or PS3 version.

title: A sweet uplifting movie.
text: Chances Are portrays the power of love and understanding in a comedic way. If you love good old sentimental movies with a splash of comedy, as well as a great soundtrack, check out Chances Are! Soundtrack includes Cher and  Peter Cetera singing that popular and beautiful song After All, as well as  Johnny Mathis' Chances Are and Rod Stewart's Forever Young.

I don't live in the US so there was no way for me to exchange my PS3 for a new one, a few weeks later I got my HD tv back and I could play with my PS3 using the HD cable

title: It is actually a very fun game, some dumb humor but we enjoy it
text: My husband has tried to get me to play video games with him for years to no avail. I told him I'd play a Harry Potter game, but was skeptical when he bought the Lego collection. It is actually a very fun game, some dumb humor but we enjoy it. Would be great for kids too!

title: Mic Picks Up Too Much Ambient Noise
text: The sound is great on these. I'm using them with my PS4. My only gripe is the mic picks up too much ambient noise. My friends all hear my air conditioner but if I switch back to my Astro's, they don't hear anything besides my voice. Not sure if I'm doing something wrong but because of that, I have to knock off 3 stars as using these for gaming was the main reason for my purchase and it's not a good experience so far.

title: Five Stars
text: I actually purchased these to use on my sewing machine screen. Works good

title: Awesome game. I enjoyed the old Kings Quest years ...
text: Awesome game. I enjoyed the old Kings Quest years ago. The graphics on this are very nice. And the play is great fun. I'm not much of a gamer, but this is cool. I run it on Windows 10. ---- Added after completing the game. ----- The only problem is needing to install a program named Steam to get and run the Kings Quest game. Steam is a problem. It constantly updates itself and it runs in the background full time. It then does not uninstall and must be manually removed from the system. Very troublesome.

title: Pretty Good
text: If you have played the original Army Men: Sarge's Heroes, you will probably like this one.  Although it is relatively the same, this one seemed somewhat easier than the original.  The levels continue to get harder as they come along, but most don't seem to offer the same challenge.  I have had it for less than a week and am three levels away from beating it.  If you are an experienced player and are looking for a game that will take a long time to beat, this isn't the game for you.

title: Extraordinary design and perfect performance!
text: I was astonished by its extraordinary design when I unwrapped the package. The cool lights on the box and earbuds make the product more high-tech feelings. The earbuds perfectly fit my gaming computer. I am also satisfied with its fast and wireless charging, which eliminates my concern on its power when I play video games.

title: Pretty Awesome Demo
text: I got the demo for FFX the other day and I just keep playing it over and over. The battle system with the ability to be the Aeons is awesome and if you have a hard time against an enemy just switch characters to someone who can deal with it. You can also swim in the water and under it. Blitzball just looks incredibly awesome. And the voices are really darn good. The only thing I didn't like was how much Tidus whined but that's only a minor thing in my case. The graphics are flawless and the music is great. Overall I think this is definately going to be the best final fantasy yet. But I guess you already figured that.

title: My eight year old enjoyed it.
text: I bought this game for my eight year old son and he thoroughly enjoyed it.  The only thing I noticed is that he played through all the levels really quickly.  So the game is pretty short.  He goes back and replay the levels so for him it is okay.

title: PARENT ALERT
text: We bought this game because we enjoy the other Lego games (Star Wars and Indiana Jones). We have now thrown this game away because in order to unlock certain parts of the game you are forced to play a villain. As a villain there are parts where you are attacking and killing police officers. Being a police officer, I was very upset when my husband showed this to me. I am very disappointed in this game.

title: A memorable, substance filled masterpiece.
text: This was probably one of the the top 10 games I have ever played as far as the storytelling and atmosphere go. DO NOT listen to these malicious idiots leaving one star reviews! Exodus, should you choose to play it as it is meant to be played - slowly, taking in everything, rather than like some COD style shooter - will amaze you at moments and terrify you at others. A mix of Fallout, STALKER, and Uncharted, Metro:Exodus spits in the face of those who claim single player games are dead. If you want a game which never ends and is basically a glorified time-waster, this game is not for you. But, if you are looking for a game with a captivating story, an atmosphere that can at times be either comparatively gorgeous or chillingly scary, characters who you can genuinely relate to and care for, and lore to the moon, then Metro: Exodus is your game. Is it perfect? No, as no game is. Is it remarkably fresh and entertaining in a sea of dry, same old-same old games? Absolutely! tl,dr: BUY IT, CYKA!

title: WATCH OUT

title: Leave your dock at home!

Well, not fighting about having to take turns.... I didn't realize that attaching the AC cord was mandatory (thought maybe it could run on the battery), but luckily my phone charger was able to pinch hit. I'm excited that we don't have to mount our dock to use the Switch on the go.

Not a big issue though noticing I tested my old one that I recently cleaned up (Not being renewed) and it also makes the same noise. Other than that, the system is fine and works how I expected it too.

title: Great product, great price
text: I really love my Switch Lite, but I noticed when I played for longer period of time, it got uncomfortable to hold. That is the primary reason that I purchased this particular case. The case makes the Switch much more comfortable to hold, especially when I play for extended periods of time. It fits snugly and was not too difficult to put on. It comes off fairly easily as well. I have not used the screen protectors that were included because I already have one on my Switch, but I thought that was a nice bonus that they were included. Overall, I am completely satisfied with this product.

title: Wow!  A sleeper hit!

In fact, we've been taking turns playing it for two straight days now.  I've called all around trying to get my hands on the full version and everyone in my area is sold out.  The last person I talked to at one of the EB's said the game is being highly sought after by many.  I guess a lot of folks found the demo as much fun as we did.  I can't wait to get my hands on the full version.  Great job jaleco!  Hope to see more good stuff in the future!

title: A great party game...
text: With the increase in music based games (Rockband, Guitar Hero) I didn't really think this would have much to offer, considering it is only singing, but I was wrong. I found the game to be highly entertaining. The song list is pretty decent and at the time of its release there were 151 downloadable songs. I suggest if you do get it buy an additional microphone (Rockband and Guitar Hero mics work) as it will allow you to play against another person, or groups of two against groups of two in duets battle. For people in my family who care less about videogames and having not only played it, but enjoyed it, it tells you the game is pretty entertaining. If you are a fan of karaoke, singing in the shower or while driving, this game will rock your socks off. It's pure simple fun for all ages. I highly recommend it as a party game or solo. Worth every cent.

title: Oh man
text: Let me start by saying that I haven't played a F1 game since 2011 so I don't know much about how much content is missing and all that stuff. What I do know us that thus game is great, the graphics are awesome, AI are a little bit more challenginformation than 2011 and the driving feels nice. The graphics are Way better than what the pictures show even when driving you can notice almost everything like detail on the asphalt, the blades of grass that get stuck to the tires when you drive into a patch of grass, and my favorite parts are the cockpits and pit stops, Oh man do I love the pit stop cinematics when they take off the tires and you can see the detail on the tires of damage and other stuff like that. Anyway I lo e this game I can't stop playing it but the only thing I would like them to add is the option to do a warmup lap before the race starts that would be nice. I felt like writing this review to recommend this game to other people since I cone from a Mexican-American family and there aren't that many F1 fans in these types of families just soccer and NASCAR so anyways get this game it's beautiful nice but the other thing I wasn't to crazy about was the engine sound but I guess thats how the been engines sound this year.

title: Better than expected

It felt light and cheap (probably because it is cheap) but they were not cheap with the performance. I'm used to the feel of the mouse now and it is an amazing mouse for the price, if you want something wireless but don't have enough money for a "high" end mouse this is right for you. I say "high" end because it preforms really well and see little to no difference between them, only cons I see is that the software is weird but I don't mess with it and also their is no way to tell your DPI like I can with my other mouse where each DPI has a different color. You will have to start from the slowest and count to the correct DPI.

title: Changing a review...
text: My apologies, for any confusion my original review, may have caused. This game is fun and does play great. However, for some odd reason my TV cannot go to 1080p when I change the resolution settings. It claims the "mode is not supported". However my monitor works at 1080p. I can only blame the poor coding to the game, as EVERY PC game I play on my TV works perfectly fine at 1080p. It's a known cause, but no support to actually fix the issue has become available. I'm afraid a change in review is in order and I have to take a star. But mainly to fix a complaint towards my poor choice of wording.

title: Don't be fooled by the word Complete
text: Let it be known that I love this game, however my one problem with it is the way it markets itself.  This one problem is enough to get rid of a star.  When I bought this game, I was expecting all the DLC, however you still need to purchase a few packs to get all of the DLC released for this game.  Off the top of my head, you still need the Super Teams Pack, Horns Pack, Ken Block Special Pack and the Colin McRae Charity Pack.  That will set you back around 15 dollars.  So in all, you are paying 55 dollars for a product that leads you into thinking it is 40.  Again, I love this game, its one of my favorite all time PS3 racing games along with Gran Turismo 5, but the misleading title is what makes this a 4 star product.  5 star game, 4 star product

title: OH.....MY......GOD:THIS IS SO COOOOL!
text: This game makes RCT even more enjoyable with new attractions like miniature golf and a ghost train with undergroung sections! You can even build a suspended monorail!  There are 30 new scenarios. you can start  your park that it partially built, futuristic, or long-neglected. Also, you  can paint individual parts of you ride. And, there are about 20 new shops  such as: candy apple stall, hat stall, sea food stall, hot dog stall,  and... you can even build a mall!  And to top it all off, there are new  rides such as, a river ride with large capacity boats, circus tent, side  friction roller coaster, heartline rollercoaster, steel and wooden twister  rollercoaster with giant loops, virginia reel rollercoaster, steel wild  mouse rollercoaster, log flume with turntable, miniature train with covered  cars, a roto-drop and much much more. I higly suggest you buy this game.  You will be crying with overwhelmedness over all the excitment!

title: I have only one complaint
text: I bought a Kinect mostly so I could play the dance games for a little extra exercise to hopefully rid me of my slightly chunky thighs. I ended up buying several games for it along with the three it came with. So far it has worked almost perfectly with each game. I think it's great that it can track my movement so I can be interactive with the games rather than just sitting their pressing buttons on a controller while drooling down the front of my shirt. I also like that I can select options by a swipe of my hand through the air so I don't have to be attached to a controller while playing. I only have one complaint. While playing Just Dance 3 and other games, I noticed that the Kinect seemed to have a mind of its own and was selecting songs and options even when I wasn't moving. I realized after moving out of the screen altogether that it was picking up my cat sleeping on the couch behind me, even though my cat wasn't moving other than breathing. It sometimes counts my sleeping cat as another player and turns what should have been a solo dance into a partner dance, in which, obviously, my cat does not score well. Now, if my cat could get up and dance with me, I would be very happy and have lots of funny videos to post on the internet, but it can't, so I don't like that the Kinect picks it up as a player, especially when it's just sleeping behind me. Why can't its sensors just pick up things that are human-shaped? Now, I try to keep my cats out of the way, but that's not always easy because they have these four little things called legs.  Sometimes I notice when no one (not even my cat) is in the screen with me, the Kinect will still seem to have a mind of its own and select things while I'm not moving. Sometimes it scrolls up and down jerkily through the song selection when I'm standing still or even out of the screen completely.  I discovered it was picking up a  throw blanket that was behind me (moving it out of the way made the Kinect stop scrolling on its own), a foot stool, and another time it picked up the corner of a computer chair.  I don't know why it does this when the items are not moving or even remotely human. This messes up my game play at times and it's very annoying. I think maybe it's too sensitive and acting like a drama queen. That said, I still love my Kinect and I'm happy to have it. It has made playing video games more fun for me. I usually only played Left 4 Dead 2, Halo: Reach, and Borderlands, but now I play more of a variety of games and don't get fat doing it. Sometimes it feels good to take a break from shooting things and stand up and do the Carlton instead.

title: Don't listen to the trolls
text: This is strictly for Google Play games and cloud streaming... And for what's it's built for, it does EXTREMELY WELL! Yes, cloud gaming and streaming isn't perfect 'yet' but it's pretty darn close and this is the best setup I've tried for on the go gaming. As long as you have a decent WiFi connection or a mobile hotspot you can connect to, you're good to go! I cannot recommend this enough. Both me and my wife have one and absolutely love them! What are you reading this for anymore?! If you're that interested, but one already!!!

title: Worked for me!
text: Used this set of tools and a pocket-knife to replace the faulty cd drive in my Wii. I am the type of guy that usually runs into three problems fixing one, it was enjoyable having exactly the tool I needed at hand when I needed it! Operation was a success, Wii once again reads game discs!

title: Let down

title: the PC User-interface remains terrible. While some people defend it
text: Even after the second update, the PC User-interface remains terrible.  While some people defend it, the game's user-interface is significantly worse than the previous two games.  I understand that the content is supposedly superior to the second game, and on par with the first, but I for one cannot overcome how terrible the controls and camera are to actually enjoy those features.  Frankly, it's a joke that this game gets so many awards, since it's a clear step back in progress from other games.

title: Nice
text: Very happy with the purchase and the speedy delivery

title: Not the best.
text: Would like to say the grips felt nice until I put on the knuckle straps. The knuckle straps make you hold the controller unnaturally and i barley can tighten them and i saw decent looking  tearing happening at the bottom loops. Id look elsewhere tbh.

title: Very Disappointing
text: I was having a conversation with a friend of mine recently and mentioned that with the revolutionary gesture control possibilities with the Wii, it should be worth getting a Wii just for Avatar.  Unfortunately, gestures from the show aren't really employed.  Furthermore, I'm a fan of the show and the game doesn't follow anything that makes sense in the show's storyline whatsoever.  I was looking forward to traveling the world mastering the elements as Ang in my living room making the gestures myself, but it just doesn't work out that way.  In my opinion the game would probably have been more fun 10 years ago and for someone that hadn't seen the show.  The Wii is still great, however.

title: Plug and Play
text: Works great! The Wii had been sitting downstairs unused. I was a little worried that it might not work on our TV. We have a 65" OLED LG TV and it looks great!

title: Fun if you can only use one hand
text: This is a fun addition to the rhythm games even if it's a bit awkward and doesn't necessarily sit well on your lap. Only having the parts for the right hand is a little disappointing but, until the new guitars arrive, it's the closest you get to playing a real instrument.

title: Sounds great, feels great, highly recommend!
text: I love these! They go with my RGB Mac setup super well. They're super comfortable and have huge ear cups. Like, huge. I was kind of shocked when I pulled them out of the box because they're so big. The in-line volume adjuster feels a little cheap, but that aside, the headphones feel super great! They have a nice gloss finish.

title: Originally disappointed. Incredibly pleased.
text: When I first received this I was slightly disappointed. It seemed very flimsy. However, once placed on the device it feels amazing. I only ever use my switch in handheld mode. This makes it feel like a true handheld console and takes away the flimsy feeling the joycons had. I hope that someday they come out with more colors for it. Keep in mind, this won't fit in the dock with the case on. However, it's easy to remove the case. Again, I can't stress enough that this is primarily for people like myself who only use the switch in portable mode.

title: Buy OEM
text: Cheap, CHEAP plastic snaps broke while playing.  Dropped headset.  Broke headset.  Lesson learned.

title: Will take a simple modification by cutting the bottom with razor to charge.
text: Bought this because it looked comfortable and said it's dockable. It is NOT dockable. Also it put a lot of tension on your joycons putting the switch in it, with all that said I took a razor and cut the bottom section off so it would seat in the dock and that also would free up the tension putting switch in and out. After I was done with the simple modification to this product it charges just fine in dock so theres no need to take it off unless you wanna clean switch or take joycons off. I still recommend this because the quality of the product is well made but beware you will have to do a simple modification for it to charge and doing so also makes it easier to take switch in and out for whatever reason.

title: They treat it like a free to play game even though we pay ...
text: This game has so much potential but Ubisoft wants to see how much they can pee on their customers by not having dedicated servers and having things cost way too much in game. They treat it like a free to play game even though we pay full price for it. I spent more time sitting at the loading screen than playing and a majority of matches drop halfway through and you get nothing from the match. I really loved the concept but save your money until they get their stuff together and make the game more stable.

title: You'll have to wait for any multiplayer game
text: My old AOM was getting all scratched up and I was interested in getting the expansion.  So, I purchased this package from Valusoft.  After installing it, I kept getting the message "CD Key cannot be validated..."  I thought it might have been some software conflict.  So I uninstalled my old version of AOM with the new one.  No success.  Got the same message.  So I it was a software issue and I followed the instructions by waiting a few minutes before relogging.  No success.  After a few hours, I researched online to learn that Valusoft sent the same product key codes to all its customers.  This makes multiplayer game play impossible.  Not only can I NOT play the Titans, since that key has been long gone, I can NOT play my old game.  Basically, Valusoft just stole one game from me without providing me another.  Unbelieveable.  Avoid purchasing this copy.

title: Super cute
text: Got these as a Christmas gift for my daughter, she loves them, so far no issuessuper cute, also love the fact that the microphone slides into headphones when not in use, rather than just folding up.

title: Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 2011
text: This game is great for the whole family. From my 3 year old Grandson to his 64 year old Grandfather, we all really enjoy it! The gun is great but we are not using the scope.

title: Great fit, feels better for my big hands.
text: Feels great, nice snug fit on the sticks, much better on my thumbs. If you have large hands I would definitely recommend. Will update if I have any problems.

title: Five Stars
text: Brilliant Keyboard with Amazing LED lights. Keys are comfortable as well. The keyboard is very beautiful and works fine. I actually doubt the previous reviews because the keys are pretty easy to see and are visible. The keyboard is fully functional as well.  I prefer this keyboard over a blue tooth one because the blue tooth onse some times are bugged and would disconnect frequently.

title: good buy
text: this is a pretty solid kit for the money, my only gripe with it is the case is not dockable

title: THIS IS NOT 2 GAMES
text: Should have done my research first.  This is not 2 different games.  Super Luigi is the EXACT same as Super Mario, you just cannot play as Mario and you only get 100 seconds to finish each level.  Felt like a VERY misleading description and I would not have paid full price for this had I known this.  Definitely feel lied to.  2 stars because the game is still the usual fun you expect from a 2D Mario game.

title: YEAH A GREAT ORIGINAL PLATFORMER ON THE PSP!
text: Well it is about time.  We finally have a good original title on the PSP.  THis one is in the form of a platformer.  For those confused, a platformer is like just about any mario game (super mario, mario 64 ect)  You basically have an action game that requires you to kill things (in a fun way) and jump from this platform to the next avoiding obstacles and enemies along the way.  These are some of the most creative games in the history of video games.  In my opinion they are also some of the most fun.  Fun creative action games, what more could you ask for.  Tokobot is great!  It is one of those rare platformers that actually uses some of the old standards and puts a new twist on them.  This time you get the bad guys and jump from platform to platform, but you do it with five robots you found on a archeological dig.  The robots have three major functions that help you on your journey.  I will not spoil the fun of discovery, but trust me, it is fun.  the controls are great, the game is light and fun.  Most of all it is creative.  Bottom line:  Get this game for it's fun creative innovation.

title: Fun wheel
text: My son loves this wheel. He loved that it vibrates and makes it feel like he is really racing. It's also sporty looking

title: Works Great
text: We bought an inexpensive, second dock to use the Switch in another room, thinking that any USB brick would work.  After trying several, random chargers, I realized we needed a specific charger to keep the Switch from slowly dying during play.  It hasn't gotten heavy use, but this inexpensive item has worked great.  I highly recommend it.

title: Clarification of John Fowler's preview of Rebecca
text: A 4K restoration is not the same thing as a 4K resolution presentation. 4K restoration only means that the film was scanned at 4K resolution for the digital restoration process. A 4K resolution presentation would require that the discs were released in the 4K  Ultra HD format. The Criterion Collection has never issued discs in that format, hopefully they will do so at some point in the future. So the bottom line is this, I've no doubt that the new Criterion Collection reissue of Rebecca will be the finest version ever released. It will not however be released in 4K at this time, the resolution will only be 1080p as is the case with all Blu Ray discs. A high quality up-scaling 4K player can bring you closer to the look of 4K, but not at actual true 4K resolution.

title: Better Late Than Never - I am on the Wii Sport Bandwagon
text: I was trying to find a new one in the store and the clerk laughed saying how many years ago did we sale the Wii with Wii Sports and Wii Sports Resort.  Anyone I found one on Amazon with all the original packaging, parts etc.  I am having fun getting some exercise with my Wii Sports.  I love the bowling but I am trying the other games. I would say no, if you have the PS3 one don't get this, it doesn't really look or play any better. If you have not played the PS3 collection then this is a good value.

text: I bought this in hopes that it would replace the old xbox I had played on for a while, but once I received it, I was very disappointed because it did not work properly.  It was in good shape, but it would not read discs or open and close after the first time. I was thoroughly disappointed.  I will be returning this product immediately, and I am just saddened that a company would ship a product that doesn't work to a consumer.

title: Verified cheap product with shoddy materials
text: I don't usually take advise from other peoples feedback on Amazon (never know what their experience or expertise is) but this time I should have. The controllers are fine if you don't mind the joystick registering input with out it being touched. The only other review at the time concluded a similar issue and I am verifying it. Don't waste your time (not a waste of money as amazon is giving me a full refund) look up another controller brand and spend a couple bucks more for a better quality replacement as that's what I am doing.

title: Great for the fist 6 months.
text: The controller is great for the first 6 months then it all goes to hell. The grips and bumpers fall off making it pointless to use.

title: Best snowboarding game ever
text: I loved Road Trip, but really didn't think this game was going to be THAT much better. It was BECAUSE I loved Road Trip so much that I didn't think this could do more than measure up, which would have been enough to make the game worth playing. This takes the concept to a whole new level though. Instead of riding around for fun and doing random tricks with the occasional competition, this one is all ABOUT competition on a global scale. Travel all over the world again, but this time compete and gain in ranking as you do so. The levels are amazing and the challenges are plenty. The Balance Board makes this so much fun, adding a sense of realism that you couldn't get with the mote alone. An awesome game in a now awesome series.

title: Had to make a headstrap.
text: Kids love it but we had to design and print a headstrap for them to fully enjoy it. Plus side i guess is it's something new for my Etsy shop....

title: Worth it
text: Definitely worth the buy if you need to repair, (or in my case attempt to repair), your GameCube. Unfortunately I'm probably going to have to order a new laser disc reader. But the screwdriver is fantastic. Definitely worth it for the value and the sturdiness of it!

title: My son went berserk
text: This is a beautiful device! Got it for my son's birthday and he loves it. The color makes it more special. Very pleased.

title: So Glad I Bought An Xbox One
text: This game is awesome. I've described it to people as Jet Set Radio Future meets Left 4 Dead, which I think works pretty well. I beat the storyline a while back, but the replay value is excellent. I'm still completing all the side quests and getting all the collectibles. There are a lot of achievements to get through if you're into that sort of thing and most of all, this game is tons of fun. It's vulgar, gorey, it's got punk rock music and even a cameo from King Buzzo of the Melvins. You can turn off the swearing and set it to low-gore if you're buying this for a kid, but really, this game is meant to be enjoyed by adults.

title: Fun game, but littered with Bugs
text: This game is fun and the story is great, but man this game is filled with bugs. Random bugs for example, all access to shooting, weapons, etc. stops right after a mission or after a cut scene. You're left with running away or using the R3 kick. I had to close the game multiple times and start again. I like the game but the bugs makes it terrible. I should have waited for it to go on sale a few months after its release date.

title: Good for a Laugh
text: Bought the game because I had never played it before but heard how glitchy it was and thought it'd be a good laugh.  I had a great time with some minor frustrations.  The game was in perfect condition witch is the most important thing considering it was used.

title: Love it!
text: I bought this game from a software club on a whim.  My 7 and 8 year old boys were sort of interested in chess, and my husband's name is Fritz. So I thought if I was lucky, the software could help them learn some of the basics of chess.  It has FAR surpassed my expectations.  They love it, and have spent HOURS playing it.  They know how all the pieces move, have learned some of the finer points such as "castling", and still keep playing.  I hear them repeating the little rhymes that the program uses to help them remember different strategies...."a knight on the rim is ugly and dim"...."pawns are afraid of nothing; they move straight ahead", etc.  In just a couple of weeks, they know WAY more than I know about chess.  I would love to have this program in my middle school classroom, as I think my students there would enjoy it, as well.

title: Disappointed
text: There are no catch wires on the deck. None. The game simulates the instant stop of the wires by inputing a super high drag effect on your plane that stops it nearly as fast. Fun to fly the big jets. Would not have bought the title if I knew there was no catch wires to grab me. :(

title: Great sequel and game
text: I am not sure why Monster Hunter Stories didn't get better coverage when the original game came out.  Its a super fun game with tons and tons of content.  I have both the iphone and 3DS version.  I am still playing it today.  I was super excited about MHS2 and bought it on pre-order announcement.  I got my copy today, but I have been playing the free demo.  The story is great so far.  I like that it has connection with the first game.  The graphics are upgraded form 3DS of course and it looks more like the iphone version.  I have not seen any performance issues that reviews have mentioned.  There are some great quality of life enhancements, which I like better than the first one.  Although the touch screen on 3DS is always useful.  If you are an RPG fan or MH fan, buy this game.  For some MH fans, they may be turned off because its not a traditional MH game but its just fun!.  I think people that like Pokemon or Dragon Quest would enjoy this game, as well.  While this game looks like a game for younger audience (and it could very well be an introduction for younger audiences) it still has great content for adult gamers and the challenge does ramp up as you go along.

title: Do not purchase, please wait a few months.

title: Kinect is good concept however....
text: The Kinect is a good product, but it is hard for anybody who lives in a small house to play effectively. You need at least 7 feet of open space to play and at least 9 feet for two people which makes my cousins house a bad place to play.(He lives in an apartment) So we set it up at my house and works great but its difficult to position near my 47" LG LCD tv. The voice commands are awesome but very few like "open tray" and you can't navigate out of menus? I have all three systems and find the kinect to be a "top of the line" tech gadget, but not as well executed as it should have been. It is cheaper than other "motion capture" devices i.e. PS move and Wii but not as fun in my opinion. I hope future updates can iron out the bugs in the kinect.

title: Sweet controller that didn't last
text: This is a sweet controller with good feel and handy programmable buttons on the underside. Unfortunately I started getting right analog stick drift after a month of use and its gotten so bad that its unusable. Maybe I received the one bad one out of the bunch.. Either way I'm probably going back to brand name after this snafu.

title: A great easy listening CD
text: Since engineers perfected the TVs and visual images  became important for songs through video clips, we have suffered a continuous abuse by mediocre but above-average looking singers who rely on visual effects,  semi-naked bodies and performances with sexual tones to promote their silly disharmonious songs.  If you are also unhappy with the above and you love easy listening music, then you will appreciate this CD. Demis Roussos' voice is mellifluous and charismatic. Not many singers have the gift of such an outstanding voice. The musical scores have a happy tone and match perfectly Roussos' voice creating a very enjoyable and pleasing effect. This CD will be a great addition to your collection.

title: Dollar Store quality.
text: Super cheap and i'm afraid its going to bend my cards. I am so discussed by the quality its hard to understand how horrible it feels to hold. The plastic cover wont stay shut and distorts as soon as you bend it to put cards in. The inside is basic thin plastic pockets with cloth separators. Holds four cards in front and four reversed with fourteen sleeves for a total of one hundred and twelve cards it can hold. No personality and cheaply made, my respect in Hori as a maker of products is deeply shaken.

title: Excellent versatile device
text: This is not a phone. At least in the traditional sense. It's a folding little computer that happens to make phone calls if you need it to. After many updates the software experience is good to very good. Still not perfect but no operating system is. It's dual screen capabilities are just unrivaled with anything else out there right now as well as it's versatility. The camera is MUCH better than it was when it debuted then again that was never a selling point. This is a great productivity device and a surprisingly capable media device as well that just works as my everyday driver. Don't think I'm ever going back to a candy bar slab again...

title: DO NOT CONDUCT BUSINESS WITH THIS SELLER. FAKE MERCHANDISE
text: False advertising. This isn't even a legitimate Nintendo Game Boy cartridge, as shown. Trademark name at the top of the cartridge simply says "GAME" compared to a real one which says "Nintendo Game Boy" and the circuit board is an obvious fake. Unbelievable that someone would actually try to pass this off as genuine.

title: This is the bracket your looking for

I slammed the other side of the wall, pulled on the book, wiggled, slammed, every little thing I could think of and it is solid as a rock. With that said I was able to find a stud to stick the bracket into. If I was sticking it into dry wall I would grab a nicer set of drywall screws from your local hardware store. title: Doesn't Get Any Better, In My Opinion
text: I recently purchased an HP all in one and the keyboard was something that was ridiculously small and had an equally ridiculous feel to the touch. The keys were small, with no tactile feeling so I went looking for a better and larger keyboard and stumbled upon this. After reading several of the reviews I stopped looking and ordered this Havic board. Wow, what a wonderful choice. It was hooked up and working within thirty seconds and it is as beautiful to look at as it is to type with. It does have that mechanical feel that lets you know you are typing, and several other features as well, most of which I will never use. The ability to control sound volume from the keyboard is one feature I will use along with one touch mail retrieval. I am not a gamer so I cannot really speak to the mouse, but it is beautiful and well designed and I love it as much as I do the keyboard. I saw other boards that cost less and some that cost more, but I don't think you can go wrong with this one.

title: Buy It Now!

I refuse to return it; it is an oasis of fantasy in a dystopian desert. Blackfog Island is the second in hopefully a long series of silly, fun, and refreshingly unpredictable irreverence.

title: Once again dissapointed by Battlefront
text: Just like the first Battlefront that came out recently (The biggest waste of money ever) I wanted to like this game a lot.. However, EA once again ruins Star Wars again. The campaign, one of the big highlights of the game from the makers, is incredibly short and almost pointless. Almost as bad as not including one. The multiplayer mode is alright, but EA ruined this again with all of the micro transaction that has been plaguing and ruining games the last few years. Also in the damage taken, hit count, etc. is very odd in multiplayer and not consistent at all. How hard is it to get a decent single player story in a universe as diverse and complex as Star Wars? This shouldn't be called Battlefront ll, but what they owed us for the jumble of nothingness that was the first one. EA once again dropped the ball on what should be a very simple game to make.

I think he started worshipping some diety called the Allfather and yells that he is going to bathe in the blood of his enemies. I think he has joined some sort of online cult. title: Extremely Sensitive Microphone
text: Overall I would rate this product as a 4 out of 5. While these gaming headphones do have a sleek visual appeal, a comfortable cushion around the ear, and an easy to adjust microphone, there are some issues. The only reason I have this product a 4-Star rating is because the microphone is very sensitive and picks up all sounds nearby, including footsteps if mobile and on a call. When not mobile, if you are not in a very silent room, communication becomes difficult because of this issue, especially if you have children. These headphones are soft and easily adjustable and the microphone adjuster on the chord is very handy, save being a bit bulky, but the 6 foot padded chord seems to be sturdy and well made. Overall a good product.

title: Sims 4 is a reimagined Sims 1
text: I thought this game would be all of sims 3 and then some. Unfortunately I was mistaken. I find the controls hard to navigate and building is not as easy as it may seem. This game is more reminiscent of Sims 1 than its predecessor Sims 3. The game has no toddlers or babies like the sims 3. It has a crib with a baby inside and when it gets picked up it looks like an alien. I also do not like that the sims are locked into mini neighborhoods within the town and there is a go between screen when travelling to a community lot. Honestly Sims 3 was much better game play wise. The only shining star i have for this game is the ability to manipulate the sims in create a sim.

title: Not going to buy the game
text: I'm glad I read the reviews because I was going to buy the game, but after reading you need an online connection at all times I decided not to buy. What a shame.

Dont believe what these 1 star reviewers are saying, esp since one of them only has given 1 star to everything he reviewed (obvious troll) and the other thinks that tomb raider started with the movies LOL  Trust me, get this game and you will not be disappointed!

title: Iron Not Strong Enough
text: The Iron Man game is yet another movie based video game gone bad, the graphics look like PS2, the voice acting is fair, but nothing you'd remember, the game might make you sick the flying is unnatural as it would be to any normal person, the fighting even on hard is repetivtive and poorly done. the upgrade system is the best part of this game getting new and improved weapons just wish i wanted to use them, don't waste your money, rent it and then return it and keep playing GTA IV

title: Highly recommended for 80s kids!

title: I had to give it 1star

title: Can't read the small text
text: I thought this would be a good and fun game to play with guests when entertaining or to play with signifiant other. I find that the text on the screen is really, really, small.  I was really hoping that the game would speak the questions out loud but that is not the case.  I have a 42-inch plasma tv, and despite the fact that it is a relatively large TV the text for the questions is really small.  There are some fun twists to the game that I like, but the fact that some people are faster readers than others and the fact that the font is so small gives others an unfair advantage when playing multiplayer.  All in all the game is just OK.

title: They work, but maybe not what you want...
text: The PSP AV cables work, yes. But, they might not be what you want. What these AV cables can do are play PSP Movies, music, and display pictures on your TV. What I wanted and possibly you, is to play games on a TV. These AV cables do NOT do that. What you need are component cables for the PSP. If you want to play PSP games on a TV, get those instead.

title: Retro gaming rules, and here's proof
text: A retro-loving gamer's dream come true, Capcom Classic Collection features 22 favorites from the legendary game company, and what a Capcom compilation be without a few Street Fighter games?  This collection's biggest flaw is that the SF games here (Street Fighter 2, SF 2: Champion Edition, and SF 2: Hyper Fighting) have suffered the most because of the annoying loading times between fights.  Not to mention that the Playstation's controler never really suited the SF control scheme, but when you get past all that, you'll find one of the best classic game compilations on the market today.  There's some excellent games here, including 1942, Mercs, Forgotten Worlds, Final Fight, the Ghosts 'N Goblins series, Bionic Commando, and more; and for the most part, they all play as great as you'll remember.  There's a ton of unlockable content and extras as well to keep you busy, but while as great as this compilation is, there are a few glaring omissions.  First of all, where are the Strider games?  The Strider series is one of the most renowned Capcom series alongside Street Fighter and Mega Man, and the fact that there are no Strider games here will leave you scratching your head.  Also, how about the very first Street Fighter game?  Or how about Puzzle Fighter or Darkstalkers?  I would have rather seen any of them than the lackluster Pirate Ship Higemaru.  Oh well, it says "Vol. 1" on the side of the case, so hopefully Capcom will roll out future volumes with the aforementioned games (and if you know Capcom, you know they have no quams about sequels).  In any case, Capcom Classics Collection is still a must own for retro gaming lovers, and at the bargain price this package is all the sweeter.

title: Anime RPG Game with a Twist
text: Forget the standard Final Fantasystory line. In Thousand Arms you play as Mice Triumph a letcherous young man on a quest to regain his kingdom, and woo any young woman in his path. The game features the best voice overs in any game the Playstation has ever made and the graphics are a culmination of Lunar 2 and Final Fantasy VII. For anyone who wants to have a wonderful story in the tradition of anime, and laugh for hours at some of the funniest dialoge yet, then look no farther then Thousand Arms. Warning the game while not anymore violent then any of the Lunar games does contain quite a few sexual innuendos, partly spawning form the unique system of this game where you can go on dates with each girl and try to win her over. This game is suggested for an audience 13 and up.

title: Excellent arcade shoot em up
text: Take control of some of the best combat aircraft in WWII in this excellent arcade-style shoot em up.  This is not a flight simulator, as the aircraft are relatively easy to fly and control.  The trick is to keep your wits about you, fly like crazy, keep manoeuvring at all times, keep your eyes peeled, and keep shooting as enemy aircraft whizz past intent on shooting you down.  With a general scenario that leads you through the war, you can take the sides of the Brits, Germans or Russians, which puts a different spin on things as you master one side and then switch to another.  The odds tend to be stacked against you in the dogfights, but then that was what things were like for the Brits in the Battle of Britain!  All in all, great fun, using the Wii controller to good effect!

title: Not Playable
text: I have only had this product for a few hours, but I thought I'd write up a quick review to warn other people that may consider buying this game.  I'm hopeful that they will have patches and improve the quality, but as it stands right now this game is not playable on my system.  I have a modern system with 4gb of ram and GeForce 8800GT.  The problems are not from performance.  There seem to be a lot of little bugs and some huge.  Indoor areas don't render correctly.  Often the floor or some walls are missing and you could see right through them.  This makes it hard to navigate some maps.  I've also got caught a couple of times where after cut scenes it goes to the loading screen and doesn't ever seem to escape.  I've waited about 10 minutes before killing it.  This is unacceptable and makes the game unplayable.  I tried to check Rockstar's support site, but they don't even mention the PC version of Bully yet.  I find it unlikely that these problems are only with my system.  Hopefully soon as more reviews come in we will have an idea how common these issues are, and hopefully soon after there will be patches to make this playable.  I had a lot of hope for this game, but right now it is a huge disappointment.  I recommend that anyone interested in purchasing this game should wait and see if the issues are widespread before risking purchasing an unplayable game.

title: The Best since Aces of the Pacific
text: First, yes this game is going to be the most demanding on your hardware, however, have no fear if you have an older system.  With a P-II 333 Mhz machine, i have to sacrifice a lot of the details, yet the graphics are still spectacular!  The damage effects are very impressive.  Dogfighting is thrilling and fun, with the realistic graphics and sound effects.  The first time you see a Zero catching on fire behind the sights of a Corsair is going to make a lasting impression on your mind.  I am already starting to like CFS 2 more than Jane's World War II Fighters.  The ocean and islands are breathtaking although you'd be spending much time flying out of sight of any land.. If there's one thing i find below expectation with the graphics, it had to be the gunsights and the general cockpit layout.  I think older games like Microprose's 1942 Pacific Air War did a much better job at that.  The gun sights look very unrealistic in CFS 2.  The documentation came with the game is decent, the 40s-style artwork is fresh, however, its historical review does not compare to Aces of the Pacific.  With only 7 flyable planes, CFS leaves out some of the most interesting fighters of the War.  It's another area that CFS failed to match with Aces of the Pacific.  Although CFS 2 provides favorites like the F4U-1A (my personal favorite radial engine fighter of all time), N1K1 George, it ignored all the Japanese Army aircraft, and players don't have the option to fly dive-bombers and participate in actions like the sinking of Japanese carriers during the battle of Midway.  Don't get me wrong, although it's not perfect, CFS 2 is definitely the best WW 2 simulation game available right now and it is certainly worth your money and upgrades.  definitely a five-star performer!
