title: Do not overlook this game.
text: Risen has got to be one of the best rpg's to hit the 360 this year. The graphics are not the best for the 360 and the voice acting isn't much better, but this game is addicting to play. There are plenty of side missions along with the main story line to keep you busy for hours. When killing enemies you can search them to take some of the animal meat and before you can eat it you need a frying pan and a fire to cook it, you can pick plants and mushrooms to combine and mix into stronger potions, you can learn to be a blacksmith so you can make your own equipment, or learn to be a thief and pickpocket people while you talk to them and if you are caught stealing you get beaten buy the gaurds and whoever you stole from and they stay mad at you until you use a joke spell or joke scroll to make them like you again. From what I've played so far it seems like it is a massive openworld adventure with some oblivion elements but not a copycat ripoff. When you level up I think it picks your upgrades automatically unless there is a way to do it manually that I haven't figured out yet. Some downfalls in the game is the controls take alittle time getting used to, when doing missions you actually have to figure out where you got to go since mission markers don't appear on the map which isn't a big deal once you get used to it, that just means more looking around. Besides the fact that you need a frying pan to cook, you can also get a broom so you can sweep floors, you can get a saw so you can cut trees, you can get a pick axe so you can mine for minerals, I'm sure there is more to do I just haven't made it that far yet. In my opinion this game does what the first fable tried to promise, A massive open world adventure where your choices actaully change the outcome of the game, plant's grow back over time. Get this game, you wont regret it.

title: Really awful. Buggy software
text: My girls ages 5 and 7 begged me for this software. I finally gave in even though the whole concept of creating fake finger nails did not appeal to me.  They enjoyed the music selections that play while you create the nails  which is the main reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1.  The program comes  with some sticker sheets which only contain one set of nails each and  wastes tons and tons of printable space.  I found it completely impossible  to line up the paper so that the little squares would print in the correct  spots! Extremely irritating! Once I got them somewhat lined up, the girls  were very disappointed in the final product. It sparkles on the screen, not  on the paper after all! My five year old will on occasion go in and make up  some nails and listen to music, but she will be bored in about 10 minutes  and on to another game.

title: Great Family Friendly Game
text: This is a great Family friendly game system.  The Games have a wide age range from  preschoolers(A Bugs Life, Mickey Mouse) to Adult like PerfectDark, Goldeneye. There are sports fantasy games, action, roleplaying etc, something for everyone.Also Nintendo is the only company liscensed to sell Pokemon,if your kids are still into that. You can play up to 4 players on most games.(A few are one person only) The cartridge system is easy for young children to handle with out damaging them unlike the CD's a Playstation uses... No freeze ups, or blips that shut your game down in the middle before you can save it. My son had been asking for a Playstation for almost a year, until he played on one at a friends house, he changed his mind after the games kept freezing up in the middle of a race or action scene or they kept shutting down and makking him restart the game. Also most of the games save within the game cartridge itself, no extra memory cards to buy. If you are interested in blood, guts and gore, then go with Playstation. But if you want a versatile system for the whole family then N64 is the one.

title: Finaly single player experience is included
text: I never played the original titanfall because I don't do any online gaming but it seemed like it would be interesting. I was very happy to hear this game would have a single player campaign. I can honestly say it was a blast playing through it. I don't mess with the multiplayer so I can't comment on that aspect, but the single player mode was a lot of fun and had a great story. The graphics are very good for those who dwell on such issues. I prefer to focus on game play itself and this game delivers in that regard. The controls are very fluid and easy to pick up. Their were two or three times where the difficult ramps up significantly for a few moments, but other than that I highly recommend this to first person shooter fans, sci fi shooter fans, or people who like futuristic combat. It's a shame it did not sell that well, but I suspect that was due to being released so closely to Battlefield 1 (also a great game) and Call Of Duty Infinite Warfare (have not played yet, not really interested to be honest). All in all a great game.

title: Great Deal!

This is a good starter pack for a ND newbie before because not only is it very affordable, it includes several of the best games of the series, including my favorite, Treasure in the Royal Tower. Just be sure not to start with Secrets Can Kill (or if you do, don't base your opinion of the series on it). It was the very first one made and the quality is not very good. Happy sleuthing!

title: Haters gonna hate
text: It appears as though my enjoyment of this game puts me in the minority.  Oh well  It isn't a common occurrence these days to find a shooter that's built primarily around the single player experience, and despite the inclusion of some coop multi-player, The Darkness 2 is just that.  A single player game, with a well written story, good to excellent voice acting, and an outstanding visual presentation.  The gun play is solid and the darkness powers were a blast front to back.  The story beats include a number of quiet moments and encourages you to spend time talking to the inhabitants of this world.  When was the last time an FPS actually made you give a damn about the peripheral characters?  Regarding length, it took me about seven hours to make it through the campaign, which is about average for most non-RPG's these days.  I understand others are saying five but I suspect those people are just blasting through the game without spending time exploring the world or talking to the NPC's.  That's their choice of course, but playing that way is missing the point entirely.  And the point is this.  The Darkness 2 tells a compelling story, filled with interesting characters.  Also you can tear dudes in half.  So there's that.

title: A Must Have For Kinect!
text: I just bought this game last night so i havent had extreme amounts of time playing it. But my friend and i played for about 4 hrs last night. I have to say overall this game is very fun. Soccer, volleyball, table tennis seemed to be the most accurate and exciting of the game types. I had trouble with the bowling... mainly getting the sensor had trouble reading exactly where my body was and i also havent figured out how to put any spin on the ball. The only other thing that i would warn against if you buy this game is that if your doing running events like the track stuff in the game, if your floor shakes alot it will throw the sensor off. The vibrations coming through the floor can shake the kinect sensor and give you an error. But other than that this game has been incredibly fun to play. Its really cool to play a game with absolutly no controller!

title: There is a reason they don't make games like this anymore.
text: Its not fun. its a hack and slash rpg, without hack and slash or rp. I like to spend what free time I get relaxing and enjoying a good game. I even play most games on difficult the extend the gaming experience, but if you have been gaming the last 15yrs you know what the old Japanese games that only reward you if your cracking out on it 23hrs a day.  If you like fighting your way through a whole level and getting to a boss (with no checkpoint prior i might add. These are required to replenish health and health potions)and having it kill you in one hit, then making you lose all xp and starting you back at the beginning of the level, with all enemies respawned. Oh but they give you the chance to regain your souls(xp) if you can make it back to where you died, without dying again. if you die on your way back you lose it permanently. example: You get mobbed buy 10 plus guys and they relentlessly attack you forcing you to keep up your guard while others throw firebombs at you. your weapons bounce off the wall leaving a lengthy animation while you recover. and making some weapons completely useless in tight spaces. meanwhile your open to attack from all sides, same with your shield getting knocked back.  they have plenty of time to kill you during these unnecessarily long animations.  If you want to spend hours of wanting to throw your controller through your TV, this is your game. it feels like a old school Nintendo game, rigid, unnecessarily difficult, and harsh penalties for the slightest mistake, basically it feels like playing 9hrs of ninja gaiden(the original)and missing a jump and game over. If you want to enjoy the playing experience instead of feeling like your being punished for buying it, Skip it.

title: Just okay

But I have to say now that I am on the 4th level, this just may be the best lego game for nintendo ds that I have played (and I've played them all - Harry potter 1 and 2, Pirates, Batman 1 and 2, Lotr, Star wars, clone wars)  It's a little more complicated as it goes along, but that is making it more fun.  So if you like lego games on the DS, you will enjoy this one.  I'm wondering if they didn't put more into this game since they knew people werent just going to buy it for the familiarity of the characters - like the other games.

title: Easy to play and TOTALLY addictive
text: SIM City 2000 is one of the easiest games on PC to play and it is great fun too.  Build a city from scratch and watch it grow.  With a loan from the bank you can start your own electronic world and you're in charge BIG-TIME.  As your city gets bigger so do the needs of your blossoming population and let me tell you they aren't always to please.  They want schools, hospitals, police and fire departments, libraries and museums and they are also greedy for entertainment such as stadiums, parks and zoos.  To get the money in you have to make the city pay for itself, so taxes are the order of the day, and cutting costs just part of day-to-day living in a SIM world.  You get totally wrapped up in your city, especially as it evolves with time and eventually looks like something out of Star-Trek.  The instructions are easy to follow, and the graphics are chunky and colorful.  The sound effects are pretty neat too, and you get a choice of disasters to inflict on your city if you are feeling especially nasty.  A great game and at a great affordable price too.

title: Crashes Constantly
text: Crashes constantly after you've established any type of significant railway network. I can't give this anymore than 2 stars because after a few hours on any map that you play, your game will become bogged down and will not be playable, which ruins the very reason to play the game. Zooming out becomes impossible. Clicking on signals to bring up the signal network results in crashes. Building too much track results in lag and crashes. Highly disappointing.

title: A big win for ATVI stockholders, not so much for players
text: A rehash of a 10-year old title with the removal of key features (LAN) and the addition of price gauging.

title: Not worth it.
text: Poor construction.  Screen is small. Software is not user friendly.  In order to switch from one game to another, the machine needs to be turned off and back on.

title: Working on Windows 10
text: Bought this on a whim to try and get running on my new laptop. Installed quick and the cd key still worked with no problems. Some people elsewhere noted having to download a certain patch to get this to run on Windows 10, I have played several hours with no issues without this patch. We will see how it continues to run, but I am very happy as this may be the best Sims game out there!

title: Very Nice Looking Keyboard
text: I really liked the layout, looks, and design of this keyboard.  The keystrokes were too loud for my taste, so I did not hook it  up.  There are rubber O-rings available to buy online, that dampen the sound.  I received a hassle free refund.  I later learned that "mechanical keyboards", are traditionally a bit noisy.  I wish I had plugged it in, so that I could give a better review on its function.

title: Well Worth the Money
text: If you have a 4GB XBox 360 Slim, this is a must buy. When playing games from stored memory, the disc drive stays quiet which is really great and theres plenty of memory space for downloaded games and saved games. I wish I had bought it sooner.

title: Really fun game, perfect for perverts
text: Really fun game, perfect for perverts. I misread and thought it came with a shinobi STYLUS, but it's actual a syllabus (character bio roster)

title: Perfect HOTAS for Star Citizen!
text: Bought this setup to use in Star Citizen.  Replacing my old Thrustmaster T-Flight Hotas X Flight Stick.  The different is night and day!  For the price, this set is amazing.  Highly recommended!

title: Try again Lego (well maybe not)
text: Avoid this game. They did not get it right. First, I could not get it to work on XP. Oh, well. I should have looked more closely at the package. It makes no Windows claims. I did get it to work on Windows 98. But my 9-year old and I had a very slow go at figuring out how to make it work. The graphics are poor. Everything ran slow compared to our other games. (Working with 256MB memory, 32mb video memory, lots of free defragmented disk space.) The help is disfunctional much of the time and extremely slow the rest of the time. Too bad the Harry Potter enterprises did not contract with the Humongous crowd to do this. (Humongous are the makers of Pajama Sam, Freddy Fish, etc.)

title: Pleasantly surprised!  Works perfect in the US!
text: My son wanted this game as a reward for good grades.  I was extremely reluctant to purchase a game at this cost with only foreign reviews.  He said it would work but have Japanese subtitles.  According to my son the game works perfect in the US and he has had no issues with it.  It is the Japanese version so there is no English instructions or English subtitles.  Also the game arrived super fast!  Ordered Friday, received Monday.  Very happy with the purchase.

title: Good for the younger crowd
text: For younger kids, this game is probably fun.  It's linear, simplistic, and basic.  I found the dressage controls annoying, as my DS did not seem to understand that an X is an X and an O is an O half the time.  Moving the character around was irritating as well.  She is slow, so it takes forever to walk back and forth between rooms, doing tasks for your friends.

title: BETTER THAN FINAL MOUSE
text: This mouse is the one to kill final mouse, with a slightly improved sensor, lighter weight, and affordable cost, it is looking to be there best mouse for even a high tier gamers

title: Faulty construction
text: When my adapter arrived it was actually open - the two pieces don't fit together entirely and there's a corner of it that's always slightly ajar, letting air (or anything else) inside the unit. If I had any faith about the construction of this piece I'd get a replacement, but the whole thing seems so cheaply made that I'd rather just find a different product and throw this one in the garbage. On the plus side...it did actually work for the short time I used it.

title: Cool control

title: Dissatisfied

title: This is a game that your kids will play over and over
text: You know how you buy games for your kids and after maybe a few weeks they either beat the game or get bored with it? Well, that will not happen with this game. This is a fun never-ending game. Players get to build levels on their own and play online with their friends as well. New levels are built daily. It's muliplayer, so sometimes I join in to play with my children. Up to four people can play. It is fun for all ages. I heard the theme to "Beverly Hills Cop" in one of the community made levels, which let me know that I am not the only "oldie" around...lol

title: GOOD MOUSE!
text: Overall I really like this mouse. It fits very nicely in my hand and has nice rubber sides that grip well. The mouse lights up and glows different colors, which I really love! I also think that the DPI button is great and I love how when you click it changes the colors of the mouse! The mouse has very nice buttons that all feel good and a scroll wheel that is very nice. One thing that you might want to take in to consideration is that your mouse doesn't really have many other buttons than a normal mouse does, so I don't know if I would call it a gaming mouse. For a hardcore gamer they want a mouse that has fire buttons and other buttons that do other functions that your mouse doesn't have. It says that the buttons are programmable but I was never able to figure out how to do that. Overall great mouse I really loved and have enjoyed it and I think it is very useful. GET THIS MOUSE!

What's not to like? Ultra comfortable, the blue cammo is a nice touch. Hard wired, don't have to worry about charging or changing out batteries. Wire also has plenty of length. You guys knocked this one out of the park! Hands down greatest switch controller of all time. Illl never use a other as long as this one keeps working.

title: Five Stars

title: Junk. Skip this one.
text: I am sick and tired of having to buy crappy headsets. This thing worked for about 3 months then started making an echo and static issues. It is pretty sad how long this product lasted. Do not buy this unless you want to buy another headset in a few months.

title: NO ONE should buy this.
text: NO ONE should buy this. The price is so off of what it should actually be. Do the math on the individual items. Do not purchase.

title: Unmatch at this price point. Feels like a 70 dollar controller
text: Amazing!! For this price point I was expecting a cheap build, not at all. It has weight to it and feels like a 60 to 70 dollar price range controller. It worked without issue on my AX9 android box (many usb controllers have issues with Chinese android boxes). It worked flawlessly out of the box.

title: Best controller on the planet for the price.
text: This is an amazing controller for the price. I am very satisfied with it and for me its exactly what i was wanting, something very similar to the ps3 controller but with a moderate amount of quality. This is not cheap thankfully it feels balanced in between a low cost controller and an actual ps3 controller. The analog sticks are of good quality. It has better response than a sabrent 10 dollar controller and logitech f310 for the same price. Of course its not as accurate as a ps3 but i knew it wouldn't be but was it good enough? Yes for me absolutely i never felt held back by the analog sticks and with other controllers i have noticed huge deadzones. There is a lot more to say about this product it came protected in a nice box and with clear english instructions. It shipped lightning fast and was here in 2 days with free shipping. It does have 2 small flaws that take a star away and make me just like it instead of fully loving it. The l2 and r2 trigger buttons feel a little too big and clunky. They do work fine in general but just feel a bit loose. All the other buttons and very tight and responsive otherwise i probably wouldn't have noticed. Still works fine in game but slightly annoying. The other thing is the led light in the center of the controller is super bright and if you are in the dark its possibly going to annoy you. I put a tiny piece of black tape over it and it doesn't bother me now. Xbox engine also has 2 styles of direct input and instructions explain all of it. What else can i say for me this is the controller i want at the price range i can afford, i would buy again.

title: Shouldn't disappoint
text: I played a short demo of this game at E3, and it's a 3-D action-adventure game with its setting in Hogwarts. You enter different classrooms to learn spells, then put those spells to use to solve puzzles. I didn't see what Quidditch looks like, but it'll be in there, too. One of the developers told me the PS version has about 10 times the content of the PC version, since the latter is intended for a younger audience. The Game boy and GBA versions are also completely different games, so that should be interesting.

title: great controller for the price
text: This is my 3rd PDP controller.  I'm pretty rough with controllers.  I play racing and fighting games.  What I like about this controller is 1.  The price 2. the software to control the aspects of the controller.  On one of my games, I could not turn off the vibration to the rumblers.  I have issues with my hands where intense vibrations causes my hands to hurt.  Since I couldn't turn off the vibration, ie game settings, I avoided playing the game.  Here comes PDP with their software.  I was able to go into the software settings and turn off the vibration.  No more hurting hands while playing the game. I will continue buying this brand.  If you break one during special ops battling or trying to out run the cops on NFS, these beauties are cheap enough to just buy another one.

title: Great product
text: Daughter really likes this. Charges joy-con as expected. Not overly bright at night which allows her to sleep.

title: Recycled Jack, Needs a little work
text: YDKJOL isn't a bad game. It has more questions then the previous games in the durable PC series, The best host in the game-Cookie-is again at the helm making sure that your quest for game dollars is a sarcastic and smart  allecky one, and those phoney commercials at the end of the game as always  are gold.  So why not 5 stars?  Well this game has got some flaws, but they  all mostly fall in the same catagory.  One is that it takes away from game  4, THE RIDE format, which in my opinion was the best.  THE RIDE helped with  the looping question problem as well as the possiblity that anyone can win  near the end, unlike others where it is sometimes pretty obvious.  But  since this game supposed to be best of the netshow game, it was  unavoidable.  The biggest flaw is the extreme re-use fo older jokes, music  and sound bites from previous games, particularly game 3.  Offline was the  frame to hold the new questions on, for those who do not get the netshow,  but I guess the jokes and sound slipped off the side.  Regardless, Offline  is not a bad game, it is YDKJ, it is still a blast, and if you haven't  played any of the games, it's a good place to start, and veterans will more  then likely want it too.  Those veterans however aren't going to find  anything exciting or new, with the exception of the new Pissed About a  Question feature, a slightly new question type in which angry players who  vented to the company with their frustrations get well, vented back.  Over  all, a good game, but it could have been better.

title: Unreal
text: This game is absolutely crazy. Love the new animations and feel of the game. Even joker is going to be in it! What else can we ask for

title: Scrabble is now Exciting?
text: Scrabble 2 makes the first version look prehistoric in comparison.  The  new version has sound effects, selection of jazz tunes, animated Maven  (computer opponent and Judge), optional board styles, a dictionary and  suggestion lists.  I never wanted to play the original board game but now I  do and its a lot of fun.  Great game for kids and adults.  You will  definitely learn some new words.  Scrabble is finally fun!  Definitely get  this one, dont make the mistake of buying the first version, unless you  still have Windows 95.  It is slow and you must change color displays if  you have 98.  If your into word games, you must own this!

title: Give it a chance!
text: I bought this game before there were any reviews. Once I started playing I was like other reviewers and was like WTF it won't go any faster then 6-7mph. But like another reviewer mentioned timing is everything. Now when I bowl I've been scoring anywhere between 140-170. Here is what I have been doing. First make sure the PS3 eye is waist high so not on top of your tv put it below it. Next when I'm ready to bowl I hold the move controller straight up and down so the the glowing ball is on top. Next I hit the trigger button then the bowler starts moving forward. Once the player just about reaches the lane I swing back and forward letting go and adding a carve as needed and I consistently through 17-20.5mph.  Once you get the timing right this game is a lot of fun. I went from throwing a game of 50 to now throwing a 170. So give it a chance and practice.

title: Like it

title: Hidden Staircase a Hidden Ripoff!!!
text: I purchased this game as a gift; the person I gave it to completed the game in 1.5 hours.  The graphics look great in the game, and appeared to have a lot of potential.  But basically, as Nancy Drew, you spend your time getting lists of missing items from 8 different characters, walk around the mapped estate both indoors and outdoors, find the 5 or 6 items on the list to complete that list.  After doing so, you go to the attic of the mansion where the game proceeds to solve itself for you.  This game was a huge disappointment to my 'giftee'; if you are going to purchase a Nancy Drew game for the DS, I recommend either of the following:  The Deadly Secret of Olde World Park or The Mystery of the Clue Bender Society, which give the player the ability to use deductive reasoning and to solve numerous puzzles throughout.

title: Wasted 50 dollars

title: By FAR the best game I've ever played!
text: This game is so amazingly wonderful!  I totally thought I was going to hate it when I first turned it on.  It looked too complicated and I assumed the learning curve would be high.  However, within minutes I was hooked.  And I played it for several months.  This game is a two disc game and the first disc lasts FOREVER!  The second disc is a bit disappointing, length-wise, but the game overall is phenomenal.  Now I have got to get my hands on the original Super Nintendo game.  The story line in Chrono Cross is so intricate and well thought out, I assume a great deal of it connects to Chrono Trigger as well.  I am so blown away by this game there are not even enough words to describe it.  I am sure every game I play from here on out will pale in comparison.  I wish I could play this game forever!  If you are an RPG lover, you have got to play this game.  It can not be missed!  And you will not be disappointed.

title: Conflict: Desert Storm II
text: Desert Storm II is unique due to the fact that you operate a small team of four elite soldiers both in single player mode or in multi-player mode.  One by one, you have to select and move your soldiers into position.  Soldiers have access to a large variety of weapons and can swap items between one another.  What I like most about this game is that the weapons operate as they would in real life.  For example, if you plant a C-4 explosive and then detonate it when you are close, you will kill yourself.  Novices will love the machine gun options.  You can adjust the gun settings for semi-auto, fully auto, and grenade launch (for guns equipped).  Skilled players will love the sniper rifle, which has the capacity to zoom in on an enemy even from great distances.  It seems that anything that is possible in real life, is also possible in this game.  You will never find yourself saying, "Why can't I...I should be able to..." Each mission offers a new style of excitement. You will face off against infantry, tanks, helicopters, and you will defuse or blow-up weapons of mass destruction.  This game offers challenge without the frustration. I recommend playing the "training" sessions before going into war.  The training sessions will teach you how to operate the weapons and all their advanced features.  I would highly recommend this game for a teenager or more mature player due to the level of strategy and realism.  Adult players will be satisfied.  This game is worth every penny.

title: No original packaging???

title: The best NES game of all time on the GBA
text: Regarded by many as the best game to ever grace the original NES, Super Mario Bros. 3 gets shrunk down for the GBA, and it is all the more glorious all these years later, even on the small screen.  Featuring re-vamped graphics and sound effects with the tried but true side-scrolling Mario fun, Super Mario 3 is every bit as fun as it was years ago.  Fans who remember the classic game will remember the innovative power ups introduced here: the raccoon leaf, the frog suit, and plenty more as you take on Bowser's children and the Hammer Bros. as well as the usual cast of Mario villains.  The level design has yet to be beat, and despite a few frustrations that are common place in the Mario series, the game is still a blast to play.  All in all, Super Mario Bros. 3 is a must own for GBA owners and DS owners alike, and it's still one of the best platformers ever made.

title: Over too fast
text: Bought this for my 12-year old daughter.  She played it off and on for 2 days and completed it.  Maybe a grand total of 5 hours.  Not worth the money.  An average 5-year old could complete it in less than a week.

title: We love it... like real bowling alley conditions.
text: If you really bowl or have ever been in leagues then this is the game for you.  It mimics the oil conditions and the gradual change of the lanes.  So no more throwing the bowling ball the exact way and getting a strike each and every time.  We love it... we still love the one that comes with the Wii... but that is a kiddie version.  This one is for when you grow up LOL.  Again... a great game especially if you catch it on sale the way I did when it was pre-ordered.  If you enjoy bowling then you will enjoy this game.

title: Great service
text: This is such a cool affordable, let's call it a toy. I have now been around the world I have been skydiving flying mountain climbing all the things that I cannot do due to physical restrictions and I did it all from the comfort of my living room. Such great graphics and just mind-blowing quality and VR content available. Haven't spent money on games yet but soon to come. I had a problem with the objects being a little blurry and a discoloration on my first set but without question or reservation I made a note of it and I was promptly sent a new Oculus. Can't be happier with the service I received and it's just absolutely mind-blowing fun for a very reasonable price. And the initial intro, they have some silly things to get you acquainted with the controls, I spent almost 5 hours just playing alone in that area.

title: 8Bitd makes quality products

title: Not much new but a solid improvement over 2001.
text: The game is pretty much the same as 2001 except for a few minor changes here and there. The graphics look slightly better, the Ai covers the pass better and is harder to burn, Coaches are now more active in the game and are more individual (Tony Dungy won't be as emotional as other coaches, etc)there's now cheerleaders, The madden card system is a little more advanced with different kinds of packs and new cheats and classic players, you can create teams, etc. About the 3 versions the Gamecube will be inferior due to a smaller memory card (I think I read that in 2003 it will be fixed) while the Xbox and PS2 will be pretty close. Also personally i think madden 2k2 is better then Sega NFL 2k2, but Sega still has that unrealistic arcade feel which some prefer over Madden.

title: Best Basball game of 2005
text: This game is very impressive.  The fielding, pitching, baserunning and hitting are all so smooth.  Turning the double play is a thing of beauty and pitchers actually matter.  The graphics are even amazing, every player has his stance and facial look. The stadiums are also incredible.  Don't believe any bad reviews of this game, you must try it out if you care about a realistic game in any way.  I have played MVP and 2k5 and MLB "06 destroys them in graphics, realism and fun.  This has all the behind the scenes greatness of Madden "05 but for baseball. This is a must have for any old fashioned baseball purist.

title: Best earbuds around and look very unique
text: I have tried the Sony WF-1000XM4, the Momentum TW3, and ended up returning both due to issues I had with sound or microphone quality.  These are great as they have great quality in both, (people both in video games and on the phone remarked on the upgraded sound of my headset after I switched).  These buds really blew the other two out of the water there.  They do need to be aligned correctly in you ear for best results (I know this sounds strange, but true) as they have an oval speaker into your ear, you need to almost "lock" them into your ear.  They will most likely be pointing more down than forward, but this provides a great seal and isolates the sound better.  In addition, these have a wonderful soundstage for TWS buds (I honestly do not know what other reviews are comparing these too, they are obviously not going to beat a pair of 2000 dollar wired headphones, and they aren't trying to).  Now for the ASE mode:  ASE lets you reduce lag and increase quality on devices like your PS5, Nintendo switch, or PC.  This also comes with 3 profiles: gaming, movies, and music.  All 3 profiles are pretty solid, and the Sound quality is markedly better IN ASE mode, and lag is not noticeable.  I love these earbuds and will use them both in the office and for gaming.

title: Brain Spa Delivers
text: I am an older lady who began having memory problems, but I was determined to keep my mind in shape.  Initially, I wasn't sure Brain Spa was what I wanted.  I couldn't visualize the idea of a town being the basis for brain therapy, but since Brain Spa arrived, I have enjoyed it tremendously.  It does NOT make you feel like a 5th grader.  The games are not hokey.  In fact, each "business" is a challenge and I am improving daily.  There are many extras that you earn as you improve.  Scores are kept track of and even plotted on a graph.  Brain Spa is a wonderful therapy tool.  And it works!

title: Very upset!

title: Do Not Buy
text: Check Obsidian's forums and you will discover that almost everyone, particularly if you have an nvidia graphics card, experiences massive frame rate loss and other bugs with this game. The loss in frame rate during combat makes the game unplayable. It doesn't matter how powerful your system is. It is possible that they will be forced to address this and release a patch, but until then, do not support this defective, untested software. In what industry besides the gaming industry is it acceptable to sell a broken product?

title: A Bad, Unfinished, Soulless Game
text: If you are expecting a return to Battlefield roots with this title, you will be disappointed. Most mechanics that have made the series wildly successful have been taken out. The UI has been badly redesigned (again), and the amount of bugs and glitches is truly staggering. You need insane hardware to even run this game and even then your machine will struggle in terms of both CPU and GPU. Technical issues aside, the game is simply not good. I put in about 40 hours this week in the early access and then got a refund. Very sad to see such a good franchise sink so low. EA quite literally ruins everything it touches.

title: MS Sidewinder Force Feedback 2 works good with Windows XP
text: I have seen some of the negative reviews on how the Force feedback 2 works with Windows XP.  My experience has been just the opposite. The joystick works very well with Windows XP. I followed directions and installed the software first. This took about 15 minutes, if you don't include registration. Then, I plugged the joystick into a USB connection, tested the buttons. They all worked, and then I plugged in the power. I am using it with Microsoft flight Simulator 2002, and it works perfectly every time.  KUDOS TO MICROSOFT.

title: 3 hours on hold with customer support
text: I ordered the game from Amazon and downloaded it np. Played for 3 days just fine. It was just starting to get fun. Next thing I know I try to start the game up and it says my activation code has been banned. WTF? I looked on UBISofts forums and there are several people who say that the same thing has happened to them because they downloaded the game from Amazon. They also say that they had to call customer support for UBISoft in order to get it turned back on. I've been on hold for 3 hours when they finally picked up and immediately hung up on me. My left joy-con case came with a little scratch on it, but I'm ok with that. Seems like a decent case so far. I'll update eventually with how it's held up.

title: VERY BAD product for the Wii.  Don't buy it for the gun or wheel.
text: The gun from this kit does not work with the Wii.  It's supposed to trigger the "B" button on the wiimote, but it doesn't move far enough to trigger the "B" button.  I was trying to use it on a few shooting games which fire via the "B" button.  It was disappointing.  Also, the steering wheel needs better engineering.  At least the official wheel from Nintendo has a little space for the wrist strap to go through.  This wheel did not and it was hard to shove the wiimote in and out of the steering wheel as the tiny extra space the wrist strap needed kept getting caught.  I would recommend looking for other wii guns or steering wheels, even if you have to pay a little extra.

title: She said she likes it and it works good. No complaints from her

title: Disappointing
text: For a game that took 10 years to make, this is incredibly disappointing. Even on proud mode, the combat is repetitive and easy. The Frozen world is dull and has nothing interesting to see while exploring. The 100 Acre Wood world is completely unfinished and just a few mini-games (Thank you Chinese Government). The Toy Story world feels like it goes on forever. Yes, the graphics and animation is better and they've managed to retain most of the same voice actors (though some of them sound completely uninterested), but the story goes nowhere and it feels like a Disney game that features Kingdom Hearts characters, as opposed to the other way around.

title: A Fantastic Ship Pack Expansion For A Fantastic Game!
text: Wow!  This Imperial Class Star Destroyer packs a lot of punch into your Star Wars: Armada game.  First of all, the model is just beautiful, and is quite a big bigger and more powerful than the Victory Class Star Destroyer that comes with the base game.  Like that earlier Star Destroyer, this one is powerful up front but weak in the rear, so watch those Rebel ships that manage to get behind you.  That said, there is a hardly a ship that could withstand the full brunt of its forward batteries at close range, throw into it a concentrated fire command and there is no ship more lethal in the game.  Add on top of that more ship cards and upgrades, which brings even more fun to your tabletop.  If you enjoy playing Star Wars: Armada, this expansion ship pack is a must own!

title: Defective
text: The console was defective. Microsoft's service is below mediocre and they expected me to pay for shipping for a replacement with no reimbursement. Luckily, Amazon is reliable.

title: Fun, if familiar, puzzle blast
text: The minute you pop Planet Puzzle League into your DS, you'll automatically feel familiar with the game's overall gameplay aspects.  If you've played games like Columns or even the original Puzzle League, you'll feel right at home here.  Despite it's familiar aspects though, Planet Puzzle League still offers a good amount of fun for your DS.  Using the stylus and touch screen allows you to manuver your blocks around to set up chain reactions, and actually gets old after a while thanks to the fact that there are no real rewards to earn the further you advance in the game.  The real meat of Planet Puzzle League lies in the multiplayer and online options, which are second to none.  Going head to head against another player is oh so much fun, and the Wi-Fi and online capabilities of the DS shines as you play against other players all over the world works surprisingly well, and when using the DS headset, you can even chat with your opponents.  What kills Planet Puzzle League from being something really special is the game's overall gameplay elements, which we've seen before, and seen done better.  That being said though, most of Planet Puzzle League is a great blast to play with the real meat and potatoes being found in the multiplayer options of the game, and for that alone it is worth checking out.

title: Great wireless headset!
text: I teach online ESL classes and have been teaching for almost 2 years with a super cheap headset, so I decided it was time for an upgrade. I have been using these for about 2 weeks now and love them. They have great sound quality and they're comfortable through 4 hours of teaching. Battery life is great too! Haven't had any problems so far with the battery dying and I like that you can still use them plugged in if you forget to charge them. The ear covers go completely around my ears without smooshing them. Usually gaming headsets look comically large on my head, so I like the slim profile of these. Definitely recommend so far!

title: First-rate RPG goodness
text: This inexpensive, simple little Diablo clone is a first-rate time-waster RPG for those who want a simple stress-reliver to while away an hour or two.  It is essentially Diablo 1 with a much deeper dungeon and the shift from a class-based RPG to a skill-based one.  It also adds the rather entertaining feature of having a pet that morphs into a killer monster-companion by feeding it select species of fish.  Graphically, Fate is a slight improvement over the Diablo games with full 3-D scrollability and a more cartoonish look.  But at its heart, it is just Diablo 1 with some nice additions.  If you want solo dungeon crawling fun with no danger of multiplayer exploiters ruining your fun, look no further.

title: Enjoyable update to a wonderful classic
text: Prince of Persia 3D is a great update of Prince of Persia. It offers state-of-the-art graphics, wonderfully atmospheric music, and extensive gameplay, while maintaining the flavour of the original. The way the prince  moves is a delight. There's loads of flexibility in difficulty levels,  making it playable by inexperienced as well as experienced gamers, and you  can adjust the gore level as well. As one who suffers from dizziness when  playing close-up 3D games (such as the Doom-style shooters), I was  delighted to find that the 3D perspective in Prince is not so close up,  making it very comfortable to play. My one complaint is that the game load  times are very long. Despite that, it's well worth buying.

title: Love the keyboard, mouse was a pleasant surprise
text: Love, love LOVE my new clickity clack keyboard. Was not thinking I was in the market for a new mouse (I am a writer, not much of a gamer) but I was happily surprised with the tactile sensation of the heaviness of it. This is my first mechanical keyboard since 'the old days' when they were standard, and after a month of use, I still get a little giddy when I am typing up a frenzy. Love the responsiveness and noise. Husband not terribly impressed with racket it makes, but he didn't like the quieter one either. If you've got a roommate to annoy and you do a lot of typing, this is a gem!

title: G-PAK - Not too bad; but could be better
text: I just received the G-PAK today. After loading my gear into the bag; it just does'nt fit all my gear. It will only hold 2 Nintendo style controllers, other brands were too big to fit. Even the 2 Nintendo controllers were very hard to fit into the tight pocket. So if you have more than two controllers you will need a bigger bag. With the console loaded it will not allow you to change games without undoing the velcro strap that holds it in. This strap is also the only way the console is held into place in the bag. It has room for 16 games without the cases. It stores them in a caselogic style holder built into the bag. Not a bad idea for older kids, but younger kids will get the discs loaded with fingerprints and scratches taking the games in and out of this holder. The flap on bottom that you use to access the hookups is secured by velcro, which will just wear out over time. Overall, it's not a bad bag. But it could have been designed better. I think a bag or case that is bigger with a few more pockets would be a better choice. But for the price it's not a bad buy.

title: AN ABSOLUTE MUST HAVE FOR THE SIMS 3 USER

Mods will not affect the performance of The Sims 4, so mod it up! The packs you get in Origin are good, so add them to The Sims 4!

title: Worked great with Nintendo Switch, easy to connect

I was pleasantly surprised by this controller. Serves it's purpose and I don't have to cringe when I hear it fall off the table by accident!

title: I haven't rage-quite yet!
text: A long time ago I played Shiren the Wanderer which was possibly on the DS.  I was thinking maybe the GBA but I don't see it anywhere.  At any rate, I love these types of rogue like dungeon crawlers, fighting through Izuna, the Unemployed Ninja, and cruising through the Pokemon Dungeon games.  However, with Shiren, it was one of the few games I'd rage-quit on.  I vowed never to play it again.  So what happened?  I suddenly find myself with the new Shiren and I'm actually enjoying it alot.  Here's the difference between the two...the old one was so brutal (as I remember it anyway) that I could never even get out of the dungeon with an upgraded weapon.  I felt I made zero progress time after time.  Izuna was hard, but Shiren was harder.  I watched part of the walkthrough on YouTube for the new Shiren and it convinced me to give it another go.  This time there are so many things to help you.  There is a lot of storage, there's the capability of getting items to revive you every time you start over (from the Points Card guy) and there are things to help you acquire items in the extra Dungeon and Puzzle house.  Plus you start from a good place from the Training house with some items.  You can hire help and bank money to give you an upper hand.  So this version is completely different from the last one I played.  I don't feel so hopeless when I die.  Though you have to be kind of a masochist to play these games anyway, and have great patience, as I've aged (56 now) I feel that I don't have infinite time to play one game.. Shiren really makes you feel like you've accomplished something which encourages one to keep going.  I've made it through the first small dungeon and the three (Past, Present and Future) other preliminary dungeons, I feel really good about the game.  In conclusion, it's a great game with lots of goodies to keep you going and has beautiful graphics.

title: Freaky but Fun
text: This game was probably one of the scarier Nancy Drew games. The graphics are still amazing and the features are new and improved! In this game, Nancy gets to have a PDA (personal digital assistant) that she takes around with her. It's a phone book and notebook. Nancy jotts down important notes and such in it and this time, you don't have to scroll ALL THE WAY DOWN to look at the new stuff she wrote (unlike the previous Nancy Drew game). It's really scary in the beginning and in other sections too. You have to snoop around at night and go to the graveyard! I'd say it is pretty freaky. But it's loads of fun. I only got stuck really bad ONCE during the entire game. That doesn't mean it's super easy but it just means that it's not extremely hard to the point where you can't figure it out yourself. This one was one of the better Nancy Drew games!

title: early reviews
text: It annoys me that people continually write reviews for games that they have never even played or seen. Hhow do you know the game is going to be good? Take a look at the reviews below and you'll find text like "GTA 3 was cool so i ASSUME this will be too. I've never played it or seen any screen shots, but it will be awesome so I am giving it five stars based on nothing other than gta3." You realize that it affects the overall customer review average, and if the game comes out and isn't that great, the review average will be higher than what it should be because of people writing reviews way too early. Wait until the game comes out and you've played it to give your opinion on it. It makes no sense in wasting people's time and possibly money by doing this. I myself believe this game will be great and i will buy it as soon as it comes out, but i am not going to give it a 5 star rating just because i think that...what's the point?

title: Must have for a quest 2
text: I wasn't too sure about how the product would be when I bought it. A Youtuber that goes by GetHip had a long list of recommendations for quest 2 accessories with him regarding Kiwi as a very trusted brand. Boy am I glad I listened. The silicone feels very nice to the touch, helps keep the edge of your face (slightly) cooler when playing, and blocks out that annoying light by the edges of the nose. Never realized how much that light bleed ruined my immersion until now. I also bought the controller grips with handsfree straps, and the pop in back-of-the-head piece for the headstrap. I've had no issues so far and I genuinely enjoy every penny I've spent. The lens covers pop in and out very easily and have had no issues with them. I actually just put velcro on them and the top of my headset for safe storage while I'm playing. All in all, 5 stars guys.

title: Great way to connect the switch to tv without dock
text: I travel a lot with my Nintendo switch and I was looking for a way not to lug around the dock.  This device works for exactly that.  You will need usbc charger, this device, and an HDMI cable.  Connect this device to your switch via the USB port, connect the HDMI to this device and the TV, then connect the usbc power source to the port on the device and it will work automatically.  There is a slight delay and you might need to press the power button a few times to turn the screen on the switch on and off, but it's a really quick process and works as described.  I would recommend this product for anyone that wants to play their switch on the TV without the dock.

Whether you are thinking about your first game in this genre or thinking about expanding to your brain games library, this is a great pick.

title: A truly unforgettable experience.
text: I bought this game because I needed a new game for my DS. And before this, I wasn't a fan of anime, but you can't help yourself but to fall in love with the CITH's plot and characters. I wouldn't hesitate to call it one of the best games on the DS, if not, any Nintendo system. It's sad that there hasn't been an HD remaster confirmed, but I don't doubt it will.

title: Waited 2 years for nothing.
text: I held off re-playing Fallout 4 because I wanted to own all the dlc for my next game. I waited for the GOTY edition so that I could have this. And now I find that owning the GOTY edition is no different than if I had gone ahead and purchased access to servers that contained the dlc two years ago. I waited all this time for nothing. And so now I guess I am done with the game. Well-played Bethesda.

title: 6 year old
text: My husband wanted to buy this for our Grandson's birthday. Well, he absolutely loves it! They have not had 1 problem with it. Right now his big thing is BOWLING! Actually bowling and then playing the game when he's at home.

title: Download Version Non-Refundable
text: I purchased this after my disc stopped working. It downloaded fine, but installation through Origin doesn't work. Help is just a list of trouble-shooting bullet points. I went through EA.com to try to register the product codes there and realized that they are all bogus (4 characters too long for what is required). Origin also requires only 16 characters and the ones I received are 20. When I asked for a refund, I got an email back saying "sorry but it's against the terms you agreed to." No one reads those things, so my loss, but I thought I would warn others about the fake product codes.

title: Addicting Game
text: I am a big fan of the Lego games and this one does not disappoint.  The moves are great and this game really brings them to life in the Lego world.  It has all the silliness of a Lego game and even has the real actor's voices doing the lines from the movie.  Having it for the Wii U was definitely a wise decision as I like there is no split screen due to the Wii U gamepad.  My 10 year old loves it just as much as I do and this is a game we both can play without the worry of content she should not be watching.  That is what I love most about the Lego games.  They are very family friendly and very easy for all ages.  It has all the iconic scenes from the movie and many of the characters have specific attributes they use to help you along on your quest.  I had debated on whether to get it for Xbox 360 or Wii U and I am happy with my decision to get it for the Wii U, especially with some of the problems I have been reading about for the 360.  I can't wait to unlock more stuff and get the dinosaurs I have already unlocked.  This game is epic and well worth the money.

title: Love Civ. IV, hate Civ. V
text: Aside from the whole Steam issue, this game just isn't fun. When I got Civ. IV it was immediately addicting and I stayed up half the night playing it. Civ. 5 is just boring. You can't micromanage your cities. The graphics are worse than Civ. IV's. All of the useful numerical information that you need to make decisions is now hidden or nonexistent. The game runs slow, even with a computer that meets or exceeds all the requirements. It's buggy. The whole thing feels dumbed down. I never write reviews, but felt like I had to for this because it's just so bad. I'm going back to Civ. IV. Very disappointing.

title: Maybe buy them or maybe don't.
text: Great headphones with really good sound quality but after a month of simply just using them the plastic part at the top of the headphones broke and has rendered the headset completely useless. I'd say buy them for the good sound quality but would go against it as you'll never know if just setting them down will break the.

title: This is a digital copy, not the real deal
text: My son was very disappointed to open this and find a cardboard disc with an online code. The seller does not state clearly that this is a digital copy. Very very disappointing.

title: Be careful check your computer first.
text: Would not install. Waste of money. Tryed different ways of installing but nothing will work. Check your PC to make sure it will run the game be for buying it.

title: I can honestly say the base game in VI is way better than the either of those games at launch without ...
text: I've played Civ IV with its expansions for a long time and Civ V with all of its expansions the last few years.  I can honestly say the base game in VI is way better than the either of those games at launch without their expansions.  I haven't noticed any bugs.  AI is AI.  At least it isn't a surprise why they act the way they do in this version of Civ.  Although the AI can appear to have a split personality due to the dual agendas.  Also, they don't seem to easily forgive transgressions.  I'm not sure I like how religion plays in the game.  Convert a major religion center and you effectively wipe that religion out of the game as they will instead produce religious units of the current religion in the city and it appears no way to get the original religion back unless you had an apostle stashed somewhere (and the AI doesn't appear to be that forward thinking).  My biggest complaint is that the Civilopedia appears to have so much less useful information and the UI doesn't seem to give you all the information you need on the breakdown of tourism, amenities, etc.  Seems it is trying to keep a lot of things hidden behind the scenes.  Maybe that is trying to simplify the game or not overburden players with information, but I find it just leaves me playing while making ill informed decisions.  I really hate the fact that it doesn't show the numbers of religious followers in a foreign city all the time if no religion is dominant in the city.  But that may be a bug.  Either way, I imagine there will be some improvement with patches and some polishing with expansions, but as a base game, I've really enjoyed it and I like the twists with the city unstacking and the new options for declaring war.

title: For Shame Bethesda.
text: Add my voice to the growing chorus of unhappy purchasers of this package. The DLC and 1.17 patch equal about 15gb. There's no reason these couldn't have been included on the disc. Shame on you Bethesda.

title: Misleading product picture

title: Meh...
text: This is more of an animated movie than a game. The game play is said to be very fluid and intuitive, but these seem more like code words for haphazard and restricted to quick time event type button pushing. There is a lot more watching the game than playing it. I was very disappointed. I love games that are cinematic, but I want to actually be able to play them, otherwise I'd just rent a movie.

title: Takes Trains Games To An Entirely New Level
text: After getting frustrated with the keyboard controls of the new Rail Simulator I broke down and bought this controller.  It makes all the difference in the world in enjoying the game.  Even better, it come pre-programmed for Train Simulator, Trainz, and Rail Simulator (although you will need to download the update for Rail Simulator).  I've been enjoying it so much I've actually gone back an re-purchased MS Train Simulator just to replay some favorite routes with the controller.  I play all types of games but I've never been this excited about a controller - it creates an incredibly rich experience that's just impossible with a keyboard.

title: Cute - Compact - Holds 10 and is portable.
text: I bought two of these, and can say these are way cuter in person. They hold 10 which is more than enough, are easy to remove and are held together with a small magnet instead of an infuriating clasp. Not pictured is a little area for a wrist strap, two little holes on the corner, a nice plus. Also the shipping was unbelievably fast got it the next day.

title: NFS
text: Very fun game, loved the cars and running from the cops! Glad I bought the game, I encourage everyone to get it. Need for Speed makes the best racing games!

title: Not a Microsoft FS program.
text: Unable to fully install program, kept getting error messages. Using Win10-64 bit, plenty of computing power (Core7 8th gen, 16 gigs of ram, video card with 4 gigs ultra fast memory).Definately NOT Microsoft Flight Simulator.

title: Doing justice to a game long overdue for a release
text: I played this on a ROM some time ago when DeJap released their translation patch. I loved it, just thought it needed some polishing. And, honestly, I couldn't be more impressed. I thought the systems in the second Star Ocean were some of the best I've ever seen in an RPG, despite the learning curve, and this game is basically Star Ocean done in the style of the Second Story. I couldn't be happier. The game is beautiful, the environments look fantastic. I always thought the original was a little cramped, and now the areas are much, much larger.  The storyline isn't the most original, by any means, but it's pretty good for standard RPG fare, and the characters and events have a nostalgic charm that really reminds the player of the classic 16 bit RPGs of yore. The item creation and skill systems, as well as Private Actions, have been updated to the depth of the second game and really add that little something that set The Second Story apart from its contemporaries. All I have left to say is I can't wait for the release of Second Evolution.

title: Spongebob:  There are better Wii titles.
text: Fortunately, we rented this one before we bought it.  The concept behind the game is fine.  Plenty of non-violent puzzle solving activities, but it did not peg our fun meter.  The Wii interface developed for this game is pretty flawed.  For instance, there is a critical task where you have to activate a wench by twirling the Wii-mote in the air.  Spongebob is told to crank hard and fast, which his animated character does.  However, it only works if the player twirls it very slowly.  Driving games feel pretty awkward too.  Animation and graphics are only so-so. As a whole, the game lacks polish. I think most adults would be bored by the game and it won't maintain the attention of a younger audience for long, it certainly did not capture the interest of my kids who are fans of the cartoon.  I considered giving this three-stars, but for the price, I think we should expect more from the game developers.

title: Does the job
text: Does exactly what I want it to. You can keep the back light on all the time or to conserve power you can press the SPACE and SHIFT key to turn the light off. Feels comfortable and is a snug fit on my controller. Highly recommend it for games like Ffxiv.

title: Fell Short of Just Dance
text: So I am a HUGE fan of the just dance games! In fact, I own the Just Dance 2, Just Dance 3, and Just Dance 4. I love how those games combine new and old songs.I decided to try this, even though some of the songs all a little inappropriate for younger kids. From the videos ads this game looked very challenging. I was really exited. Don't be fooled. This game so was easy it was a joke! Sure the songs had beats that made you want to dance, but the dances were horribly sloth-like. Other reviews said stuff like "how am I supposed to know what moves to do next just by the little man in the corner!?" haha please, don't make me laugh. for one thing, all the songs repeat moves, so after a bit , you catch on. after just playing it twice, you get the hang of it. why do people expect it to be so easy on the first try!? Anyway it was a let-down because of how easy it was. Granted, I do get perfect scores on all my other just dance games so i might be a little biased. but most people who are into dancing like a bit of a challenge.

title: Love my new controller!
text: I bought this controller specifically for my Samsung Tab S7 5G to play Fortnite mobile. This controller does everything it's supposed to. Extremely easy setup and pairing with my tablet. Wired mode is cool when using the phone clip, which I've tested out on my Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra. ALL buttons worked perfectly with Fortnite. Programing the back buttons was a breeze. I own the Xbox One controller and this one is more lightweight. I like it better because it doesn't hurt my inner palms like the heavier XB1 controller does. I added my Kontrol Freeks and precision rings and fit perfectly just as it does for XB1. Though the XB1 controller is awesome I bought the Moga for the back buttons and for Fortnite mobile compatibility. So I've made the switch over. Very happy!!

title: Play it on easy for your sake
text: As a fan of the digimon world series since the 1st playstation game I was really excited to see some of the old gameplay features would come back. The game isn't like your traditional turn based rpg, like the recently released cyber sleuth. It feels more like a pet sim like the original playstation game. Unlike the original you are in charge of two digimon this time around. Each digimon has a personality and likes and dislikes, there are in game days and you have to figure out how you spend them. Training your digimon doesn't consist of grinding battles, but taking them into the gym and choosing a stat to raise. The magic of the game is digivolving your digimons, there are multiple digivolution for each digimon to achieve. The challenge is that the required stats for digivolution are hidden. In order to unlock them you have to interact with your digimon when prompted to by the game like after battles or training. This is a the best and worst part of the game, the fact that the stats revealed from the digivolution chart after these interaction are random makes it super tedious on top of the interactions themselves occurring at random intervals after battles and training. It can take a few in game days for the full requirement of a digivolution. This is also another thing that can make the game frustrating seeing as each digimon has a life expectancy of a few days that only increases when you digivolve it. I highly recommend you play the game on easy as it would not change the battle difficulty but the digivolution requirements. Over all the game is great if you're a fan of the series specially an old fan but be warned it can be very frustrating

title: I am speechless!
text: I made the mistake of playing the wii version first and that was so so much fun.  So when this game came out I went and purchased a brand new Xbox 360 along with the Kinect to play this game.  Needless to say, I have kept the Xbox and the Kinect, but this game went right back to the store. The whole time I was playing the game I was waiting for the "Michael Jackson Experience" unfortunately I never got it.  The Que cards are to low on the screen and the games doesn't recognize some of your movements. Thriller is boring, Smooth Criminal was just upsetting, BAD was just plain bad and Beat It was the icing on the cake.  If you have a phobia about looking fat, then this is not the game for you.  If you have played the wii version, keep the memory alive and don't buy this game.  If you are expecting to see cool looking dancers in the back ground and not a feminine looking guy doing aerobic exercises and you standing in the middle going what the "Heck" then this is definitely not the game for you!! My BAD for not reading the reviews before purchasing the game...sorry MJ

title: I have thoroughly enjoyed playing these games on the Xbox One console
text: I have thoroughly enjoyed playing these games on the Xbox One console. The three installments run slightly better than they did on the older consoles and, though the visuals aren't on par with current gen A.C. games (obviously), this is the best these three games have ever looked. Textures have been improved, colors and lighting have seen slight improvements, resolution is now 1080p, and frame rate issues are generally improved. Overall, this is a good, if not excellent, collection of modestly remastered games. Tangentially, I would very much like to see Ubisoft remaster Assassin's Creed III, as i think it would really shine on the current gen consoles.

title: Bottom Line
text: Scalpers are cancer. Capitalist apologists are cancer. Randian society is cancer. The product is fantastic. Don't buy above the MSRP, I don't care if you're a super collector. The longer the scalpers have to hold onto it the lower the prices will go. If Nintendo was done distributing these, it wouldn't still be on their website. I'm getting a new 3ds regardless what it ends up being, I doubt I'll get this, unfortunately, but I could be wrong. Stay strong.

So I did what any sensible dad would do...I bought one for myself! This is a very well designed machine, if you have checked the past PSP history they have a very long life. Perfect for both adults and young ones. Worth every penny.

title: I'm so so so so tired of poorly made headsets
text: I've been through so many headsets in the past two years, I am at the point where I want to make my own company so I can get a product that doesn't break in less than a year.  The piece of the headset that allows the ear peace to move is much too stiff at the joint where it meets the headband, and as such it put way too much force on the joint where the rotator meets the ear peace, and the earpiece snapped off. The simple motion of taking the headset off my head is what caused the device to break. PATHETIC, truly terrible. Honestly though, even though I was trying steel series for the first time I expected this to happen because that's the world we live in. Charge someone almost two hundred dollars for something that doesn't even last a year. So i bought the 4 year protection plan, except I'm realizing the item was 170, the policy maxes out at 175 AND THEY WANT ME TO INCLUDE TAX, so there's a chance it wont even be covered, at which point I'll probably  go on a murderous rampage at steelseries hq over how f'ed this is.

title: Not all that impressed:(
text: I was so excited to get this game, but it fell short of my expectations.  It does not work on the skills of a beginning reader.  I was hoping it would work on sight words and helping my child sound out words, but it has an expectation that you already know how to read.  It has very few games and once they complete them, they are done.  My son has almost conquered the entire game and he just got the game yesterday.  I would not recommend this to anyone.  I feel like I wasted my money.

title: Good product for the cost
text: It does what it is supposed to very well and less expensive than the other ones.  It comes with like 2000 nuts, bolts, screws, and washers, but you only need a few of them, the rest are for other applications that are not shown in the manual. I did nearly bleed out after bumping my knee on the sharp edges, a little bit of black duct tape took care of that issue but it would be nice if they included 4 plastic or rubber pieces to put on the ends.  The brackets where the clamp is appear to have bent slightly after installing, will have to keep an eye on that in case they need to be reinforced or replaced with some angle iron.  The vertical pieces are very long to accomondate taller desks, I ended up cutting off a few inches with a chop saw to keep them out of the way.

title: Xbox 360 case
text: The side walls of this case are week so it will collapse on you if you are not careful. Not enough room in the front pocket and you can't carry everything you will need in this bag you will only get the machine,powercord and maybe hdmi cable to fit. Nice idea but disapointing.

title: An atrocity to my beloved franchise.
text: I have been a huge Halo fan boy ever since I saw screens running on Apple Hard ware in the late 90s. When Halo moved on to the XBOX it was the very thing that prompted to me to go out and purchase said console. The game for me was revolutionary, and gave me years of system link fun. Halo 2 however, is a horrid piece of trash. This does not come from someone who hates Xbox, or the Halo series, but from a fateful fan who feels disinfranchised. First off none of the touted story line of an epic battle on earth even appears in the game, with the exception of a haphazardly thrown together joke of a level in the beginning. Secondly the graphics though noticeable better, glitch in and out distracting, and detracting during the horribly scripted cinema sequences. The story line is pure and utter pedestrine bs, that could have come better prepared by a couple of three year old's let loose with felt tip markers and giant poster boards. The campaign mode is boring, and the highly touted AI is downgraded to such a point now, that is possible to jump past entire levels of enemies without once firing your weapon. Not too mention, now  your teams AI is downgraded, their ability or I should say inability to maneauveur vehicles ruins all aspects of using your troops tacticly. While Halo ones levels could be monotonos they did have an epic feel and provoked exploration, this game however is so linear, that it drives you to just run and gun ignoring the small but at time intriquing environments. Now, some are going to hate me for my next comment, but it must be said, the new weapons are a disaster. While I entriely enjoy the new covenant weapons, as well as a few tweeks to the existing ones, the human weapons have either been removed or downgraded. The new assault rifle is not only underpowered, but the lack of ammunition throughout the campaign (and multiplayer for that matter) voids it entirely useless. The downgraded magnum is left in the game but without a scope and is so powerless now that it is nothing more than a slap in the face for those who were skilled enough to own with it in the first game. Finally the rocket launcher has now become a weapon of little to no skill. One of the things I once prided myself during multiplayer Halo one was my ability to gauge where the enemy would be and kill them half way across the map with it. Gone is this skill, and replaced is the overpowerful, and at times absurd lock on rocket. Because of all these changes the only thing that remains remotely fun about the game is multiplayer ctf with vehicles, as myself as well as friends rarely bother with the crappy aresenal. I urge all who were excited about this game and have not yet been duped into buying it to at least rent it, especially if you do not have XBOX live which appears to be its only real saving grace.

title: Very Happy
text: I have purchased numerous gamepads in the past, and have eventually returned or sold them, as I could never get the buttons programmed to all the key features I needed.  With this pad, I am pleased.  The buttons can be programmed to any keystrike you like, and there is even a shift button, just under the base of the thumb, which essentially doubles all the buttons.  It does take a little while to get the hang of the program software, but once learned, it is seamless.  I have played Half-Life 2:episode one and Darwinia, freed of the key board.  Each game has a different profile which is easily loaded prior to starting the games.  Of note, this keypad only works with the left hand, leaving the right to drive the mouse.  Not a problem for me, but I know some people shop at the Leftorium, and this may not accomodate them.  Also, tho it looks like the distance from the handrest to the keys may be adjusted, they are actually fixed.  The thumb dongle, however, may be tilted and slid in an out.  The silver knob on the side tightens and loosens the bar which lets it slide.

title: Amazing graphics

title: Know Your Role and buy this game
text: I admit, I hated wrestling games at first. They were frustrating because I had to press too many buttons to pull off one simple move, even more for the finisher if I ever got that far. Then along came WWF Smackdown for Playstation, which pretty much took out the difficulty factor concerning controls, making the game much more enjoyable for me, especially when I held four belts with Kane in Season mode. Hearing nothing but good things for Smackdown 2, I just had to buy it and did so. When I popped it into my Playstation, I noticed that the loading times were a lot longer than they were in the first Smackdown. Even though that aspect of the game isn't really easy to overlook, the rest of the game made up for it. When I played the first Smackdown, there were a plethora of matches, and I couldn't think that there were more types. I was wrong. SM2 still has all the types of matches that SM had and then some. Hell in a Cell, IronMan matches (regular and special guest referee), Casket, Table, Ladder, and TLC (regular or title) are among the many types of matches in this game (personally I like Hell in a Cell and the IronMan matches). The season mode is refined and better than in SM. Instead of one match per month, there are five, and you earn some extra things during the season, from parts in Create A Superstar to characters (Stone Cold and Billy Gunn have to be unlocked). The mats even have the Pay-Per-View special logos from No Mercy '99 to Unforgiven 2000 (you can customize the mats in exhibition mode). You can still skip matches including your own, but it takes longer than it did in SM. The storylines are a little better, though still repetitive, but you can interact in some situations, like asking or telling someone to do something. I haven't actually created someone yet but Create A Superstar is much better than it was in SM. There are a lot more options concerning appearance and moves. You can also create things like managers, taunts, teams (known as stables) and PPV specials. The graphics are excellent and add a sense of realism, especially with all 50 or so characters, from the different backstage areas to Undertaker's bike in his entrance. There are many more backstage areas, like a diner, plaza, lobby, locker room, etc. SM2 has an expanded and updated roster of superstars, including the Radicalz, Too Cool and Rikishi, Kurt Angle, Stephanie McMahon, The Kat, and even my man Shawn Michaels. I'd write more but I've written a lot already and it's 2:30 in the morning. All I have to say is Know Your Role and buy this game. By the way, to get out of the Hell in a Cell, bounce off the ropes in the middle of the ring and dive into the panels that are colored lighter than the rest of the cell.

title: 5 stars but still returned -Mic communication limitation on Switch
text: This product does what it is CAPABLE of doing.  I say that because while the switch is docked the audio worked well with my beats headset.  The MICROPHONE on my headset will not work.  This is not the fault of the Gulikit.  It is the limitation of the Nintendo Switch which makes my blood boil.  Basically there is no way currently that an individual wireless headset with a microphone will work while the switch is docked if you are trying to be able to talk into the microphone on the wireless headset you are using.  So bottom line is if you want to talk on games like Overwatch through you beats headset or apple airpods while the switch is docked you will be disappointed.  The blame is all on Nintendo.  Sadly, Im finding more and more that I should have just purchased an xbox or play station.

title: Avoid this garbage
text: There is no question about it.  This is the worst casino video game on the market.  The reason stems from the change in ownership of the Hoyle Franchise from Sierra to Encore.  Anyone who has ever bought an Encore Software casino game can testify to the fact that they are ALWAYS riddled with mathematical errors and unplayable bugs.  This version is no different than anything Encore produced in the past.  It is my understanding that Sierra began development of this game but Encore finished it.  I bought it in the hopes that Sierra had put enough of their programming expertise into the game, but unfortunately, the game is trash.  There are terrible unplayable bugs throughout the game and the game plays out in such poor quality. I tried to remedy the problem with the downloadable patch, but when that didn't work properly I uninstalled the game and threw it in the trash!  Avoid this game and avoid all Encore casino products. Buy the versions of Hoyle under the name "Sierra".

title: Save your money!

It takes too long to move the pieces so that you have an open area.  Second, once you move the pieces, there is very little room on the outside of the assembly area to let you sort the pieces.  Third, almost all of the pictures are of trees and water, with a floral picture thrown in here and there.  Very little variety as far as the pictures.  So...save your money!
