title: Excellent game but same AI and layout problems
text: Let me start by saying I think that the Medal of Honor series are my favorite games for the Playstation, being a huge WWII buff.  I bought Frontline the day it came out, and it is a fantastic game, but I was a bit disappointed overall.  The sound continues to be a great strength of the series, but the graphics are very similar to the last 2 MOH games.  They are definitely better, but with the PS2 I was expecting more fluid movement.  Also, I was hoping for a little more realism out of this one, but it still has the same problems as the last one--Germans stay standing and continue to fire after being shot in the chest or don't notice a bullet whiz by their ears, they catch and hold onto grenades while still firing, and seem to have no military training outside of returning fire (they never try to lay down a base of fire then flank you, they are very predictable in their movements, etc.)  On top of this, the game is fairly easy to beat in a short time, and there is no multi-player, which was half the fun of the other ones.  Don't get me wrong, I love this game and the series (and look forward to the next one), and I'd recommend anyone to get this game.  But be advised that it is basically the same as the first one except it has a better look and sound to it--this is not an ultra-realistic game but well worth the price.  For more WWII info:  ...

title: Great game disregard the bad reviews .
text: If you like 3rd person hack and slash with weapon customization attribute leveling and magical abilitys that you can also upgrade you will love this game. You play as Fury a young attractive woman and one of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. She's hot deadly and fun to play . The boss battles are epic and the game overall is very fun to play  It's not a Dark Souls game at all not sure why that's being thrown around. Combat is based on her whip chain attacks and magic havoc attacks. I could go deeper into this but I think you get the gist . Graphics are very good the controls are tight and the 3rd person camera never gets janky .It's a lot like devil may cry with a female protagonist and better combat .

title: Great Buy!
text: The price on this Xbox One was great. I saw some of the reviews that said the unit that they received was used, and I was a bit worried. However, mine appeared to be new and packaged in the original packing with no sign of it having been used or refurbished. I have only used it for a few days, but so far, it is working perfectly and I couldn't be happier.

title: No Motion Plus

title: The Best Flying Game Ever!!!
text: Combat Flight Simulator 3: Battle for Europe is a great game. Its only fun when you have the joystick. You can pick from German, British and American planes. Its more realistic than Combat Flight Simulator 2. You can even fly bombers and be a gunner. The missions are alot harder than the ones in Combat Flight Simulator 2. Most of the time you get shot down by flack. Now you can crashland. It was anoying when you crash landed and just stayed there forever in Combat Flight Simulator 2. You can get medals. Its easy to get them. Its hard to live through bombing misions because the flack and the blast from the bombs make you crash. If you liked Combat Flight Simulator 2 you will probably like Combat Flight Simulator 3. Its impossible to shoot down planes with the amount of amo they give you but you can go to settings and put unlimited amo on. The fuel is very annoying. You allways get hit in the fuel tank. You allways lose all you fuel. Theres 3 bombers and alot of fighter planes. You can get topedos now. Theres almost no ships so there useless. Theres even multiplayer and campain mode. Theres also alot of locations to fly in. Combat Flight Simulator 3 is the best.

title: Bands Don't Stay Tight
text: I bought these after seeing a good review and hoped they would improve the ergonomics of my Oculus Quest controllers. Installation was a little difficult due to the poor instructions; I had to find a video online to make sure I was installing them correctly. I have medium-size hands, and the extra bulk of these repositions my hand slightly so some of the controller buttons are not as easy to reach. The biggest problem I have with them though is that the bands that wrap around the back of your hand are not securely held in place. They feel good when you first put them on and tighten them up, but over the course of a few minutes they slowly get loose and then you have to fumble around trying to tighten them back up. It's really annoying. If they improved the clamp mechanism so the bands stayed put, I would give this four stars.

title: I loved the controller
text: I loved the controller, but after a little over a month the joystick part quit working.  I just started blinking however; the function keys at the bottom T1 thru T6 continued working but the joystick itself was dead.  I tried different USB ports and even downloaded the Logitech X52 H.O.T.A.S software to program it, nothing seemed to work.  I so wanted to keep this device but I had little to no time in the usage of it and with the little I did use of it, then it breaks.  Had to return it, did not want to, did a little research on the device and found out it has a bad engineering flaw.  The flange were the wire's go up through the Joystick move around and it has a slight edge to it and could possible cut into those wires, thus causing the issue. Not sure this was mine though or if it was a Windows 10 update that happen just prior to my using it.

title: Great game!

title: A gentle "game"
text: I got Flower because I wanted to be able to do something on my sons' new PS4 that wasn't sports (their thing) or violent (none of our thing). This is a beautifully nice game that anyone can play. You start with a flower and go on progressively different and slightly more challenging journeys to activate the blooming of flowers across vast landscapes. You ride the wind, the wind pushes, but it is almost relaxing--only the most competitive will find ways to get upset over this. Lovely. :)

The Graphics are what you would expect from Splinter Cell: The Best the PS2 can offer. I would strongly recommend this game to you if you like the splinter cell series.

title: Not what I expected
text: This is a decent headset if you're using it for PC gaming. There is no noise cancelation. The loudest volume is not that loud to be honest. The LED lights needs the USB to be plugged in which is on the wire next to the plug you would put into your controller. You can use it for Playstation or Xbox but you can't use LED unless you have some sort of attachment on your controller with a USB port. I guess I should have expected this since it wasn't too expensive although for this product I think the price is a lot. This is equivalent to a 15 dollar headset based on sound quality, no noise cancelation and the LED lights not being able to be plugged in especially if you're playing on Playstation.

title: Spectacular, the best original third-party Wii title yet
text: From the makers of Killer 7, No More Heroes is the anxiously awaited bloodbath that mature Wii owners have been praying for.  Playing as eccentric assassin Travis Touchdown, you are armed with your trusty beam katana as you set out to become the best in the business.  There is much more to the story than that though, but without giving too much away regarding the game's surprisingly deep and complex story, let's just say that things don't always go as planned for Travis.  The first thing you'll notice are undoubtedly the excellent, cell-shaded graphics that No More Heroes sports, along with the best use of the Wii motion controls to come from a third-party yet.  The game also features some GTA-inspired free roaming with Travis on a motorcycle, and while it isn't as open-ended as one would hope, the game's serious sense of style and just plain insane story and gameplay elements more than make up for it.  The game also has a somewhat jittery frame-rate that can become quite noticable when the action picks up a lot, but this is only a minor complaint thanks to the stylized, over the top action, along with flawless sound design and elements that really take advantage of what the Wii can do, despite the fact that the console isn't a technical powerhouse.  All in all, No More Heroes is the absolute best, original third-party title to debut on the Wii yet, and is an absolute essential purchase for Wii owners craving a mature-themed game that leaves a lasting impression.

title: the perfect game!
text: When my father bought a new computer Fate happened to be one of the free trial games on it.  Well, i thought it looked interesting enough and i liked the fact you get a faithful pet sidekick (i own a Jack Russell Terrier) and gave it a whirl. SIX HOURS later i still couldn't stop playing!!  The world created within is utterly fascinating and a whole lot of fun.  I don't play computer games often so this is new for me.  The graphics are absolutely beautiful, the movement and action is smooth and fascinating (especially when casting spells!)  Choose your own character and build him or her to be a warrior or magician or BOTH. Gather objects to keep or sell and gain experience points as you complete tasks for the villagers.  The more points you have the more awesome things you can do.  Gain a reputation, earn money and buy armor and spells to be a force to be reckoned with.  This is a simple game to play even if you've never done RPG before.  It's not bloody or graphic like some action games and your pet can't die! (feed him health potions to keep him healthy) Go fishing and catch totally crazy things (like i pulled a sword and helm out of a fish!)  There really isn't anything else to say except this is a game that is completely worth it at any age. Go buy it already!

title: Great way to pass time on a long trip...
text: The Game Boy Color is the best portable gaming system around. It's made all my  plane trips go by a lot faster, and for me, that makes it worth the reasonable price. There are hundreds of games out for the Game Boy Color, and many more to come. There are games in all genres, including Adventure, Arcade, Fighting, Racing, Sports, and RPG-- start your GBC Collection with Super Mario Bros. Deluxe and Tetris DX, the two classics. It's small enough to put in your jacket pocket, and the game cartridges are tiny. The only problem is that you can't play it in the dark because it isn't backlit, so you have to buy an extra light to attach onto it. But cons aside, the Game Boy Color is a great investment for hours of entertainment-- at least until summer 2001, when the Game Boy Advance comes out (which will also play Game Boy Color and Game Boy Games). But until then, I recommend the Game Boy Color to Kids and Adults alike!

title: Great PC Remote
text: I use this remote to control the Snapstream Beyond TV 3 application (great PVR software for live tv and recording TV shows) and the included Beyond Media Basic software (very similar to a Windows Media Center interface for viewing photos, playing music, etc).  The remote works great, the button layout is very intuitive and the RF type- recevier and transmitter provides excellent range (I have tested at 40 feet through walls and it worked perfectly).  On top of the that, the Snapstream website has an excellent support forum.  Highly recommended!

title: Infested with Roaches!
text: ROACH feces fell out of the packaging when I opened it. We didn't know initially, so we put it in our closet. 2 hours later (8pm), we found 12 roaches crawling all over our upstairs. I thought the black stuff from the package was dirt, turned out to be roach feces. We were putting it in our room so it is all over our bed. They were living inside the game consul. After looking at the packaging closer, we found other dead, half eaten roach bodies. We had to package up the linens and put them outside, call an exterminator, and find a place to stay for 2 days. I was having surgery the next day so it has made a huge impact on my family. The amount of work we have to do just for the extermination is crazy plus now pay a huge bill. Amazon contacted the seller and said we needed a returnless refund. The seller responded and said he wants us to package it back up,  have it shipped back and then will refund us the money. It didn't arrive on time, we had no idea it was coming from Venezuela! The unit was dirty, scratched, and there was electrical tape holding the connecting cable together. Do not take a chance with this!! Trust me, it's not worth the amount of work we now have to do. I have a toddler and a special needs child that I do not want to take the chance of getting sick from these.

title: Great for tryharding
text: If you intend on tryharding on your switch games this controller is great. Honestly, if you just play on your switch a lot you should probably get it. I've heard drift on the switch's base joycons is a big problem. I've not had to deal with it personally because I've been using this controller. I bought it April 2021. 2yrs ago pretty much and it hasn't had any drifting issues and can last several hours before needing to be charged. I've played super smash bros, pokemon unite, hyrule warriors - just to name some of the more click intensive games on my list. Comfortable to use too, or at least for me it's comfortable. Felt like a natural transition from using the joycons in that lil weird controller combo that comes with the switch to this controller now.

title: Silicone vs TPU review
text: I went ahead and got both the black silicone and tpu versions so I could compare them. They both fit well and everything lines up great. The insides of the handles on the silicone version has some ribbing so they don't collapse or squish when held. I like that the power and volume buttons are covered as well as the sd card door. The buttons have a better tactile feedback in the silicone case. The stand feature works ok on a hard surface, but the case these ones replaced had a better stand. I'm using the silicone version for now as I like how it feels, but I'm sure with time it will stretch out like all the other silicone cases I've dealt with over the years on phones. Only the tpu case came with a screen protector, both came with the thumbstick covers (though I don't use them).

title: Poor quality

title: Slick, responsive, and royal.
text: It's a beautiful GameCube-style controller with the pallette inspired by Princess Peach, and it feels great with a textured grip in the back to make sure slipping of the hands is a rare occurrence and that gameplay is as optimal as can be. Feels great in the hands and looks great when not in use. HORI really knocked it out of the park with this one - especially with the translucent shell.

title: A parent's perspective
text: The bundle pack contains everything that my daughter wanted to go with her DS; however, the game player case itself seems to be very flimsy.  Although my daughter takes very good care of her things, the zipper on the case broke the first day she got it (Christmas Day).  The player fits too tightly inside the case, making it difficult to close easily.  Obviously, we had to go out and buy a new case so that her DS would not get messed up when she carries it around.

title: Recommended
text: This keyboard is quieter than my old thermaltake meka cherry black keyboard which surprised me.  Key travel is shorter.  The "tactile" feel is subtle, or at least it isn't that noticeable to me.  If anything I would say the actuation resistance has zero travel time from the top of the keystroke then it's smooth all the way to the bottom.  The only thing I don't like is that you can't control light intensity when using the AIMO intelligent lighting setting as I like a more subdued intensity.  This includes when that function is assigned to the "FX"  key using the knob.  All other lighting presets can be customized. Lighting color range and customization is good.  It's not perfection but this is a very good keyboard where it counts.

title: My first 3rd party wireless controller
text: I have had this controller for about 3 days and I must say I am very impressed.  After getting used to my Xbox 360 wireless controllers I decided to go wireless for the rest of my systems.  Naturally I got the wavebird for gamecube and did some research on PS2 controllers.  I have had my ps2 for almost 4 years and have never been a fan of the dual shock 2 controller as compared to xbox controller.  This logitech controller is so much more comfortable than the dual shock controller.  I have experimented with 4 different games with this controller and I must say I have not experienced any lag.  I would take this controller over dual shock 2 controller any day.  the shape of the controller is so comfortable, its hard to believe it is 3rd party.  Sony should have had logitech design the ps3 controller.  This controller does not feel cheap in any way.  It is weighted very well and feels solid and sturdy.  It has helped me become excited about my ps2 again.  Anyone who is in the market for a wireless ps2 controller should pick this up.  I did a ton of research on ps2 controllers before picking this up and found that this got the best reviews of any other wireless controller for ps2.

title: I remember a time when game companies had integrity....
text: ....But sabatoging your own supply quantities to artificially increase demand, just so you, and every other scalper online can charge 2 or even 3 times the price of the product is just wrong. Look, I understand that a business needs to make money, but not at the expense of screwing over your customer base....I will be passing on this until the price is reasonable, and even then I might skip it on principle. Whats more, companies like squaresoft are releasing DLC for PS4 titles like Final Fantasy as PS5 exclusives....When did integrity, decency, and treating customers with respect die out? This is why people are really starting to hate large corporations and their out of control greed.

title: Boring!
text: I love trains, and I thought this game would be a fascinating way to play with trains.  But what I found is that it's tedious, repetivie and boring!  All you do is drive trains back and forth, and sometimes stop to pickup and drop off passengers.  When you're in a low-speed stretch of track, you just sit there for 20 min or so and wait to accelerate.  Some of the scenarios are kind of fun, but overall you put up with 30 min of boredom for 30 seconds of fun.

title: This package is actually good

But actually, if you don't already own the game, it's a really good deal. It's cheaper than how much the game was when it first came out, and the extra content is free with the token, so you really save money. So yes, Capcom wasn't clear about how this package worked, but I still rate it 5 stars because it's still a great game with a good storyline, great graphics, tons of replayability, and now extras that can be downloaded.

title: Fantastic Game. Horrendous Port
text: I have always preferred games like Saints Row over Grand Theft Auto. The arcade-like, sarcastic nature of the characters, gameplay and source material has always captured my attention as a gamer. Saints Row on Nintendo Switch should have been a sure hit. It released back in 2011, so you would expect a game around 8 years old to be able to run well on the switch, right? Well, wrong! Despite more graphically intensive games like LA Noire, Doom or Wolfenstein running on the switch, this game feels like a rushed port job that should have been handed over to Panic Button, but instead, Volution took charge here, and it seems they dropped the ball with this one. Some of their previous games like Red Faction 1, Red Faction Guerrilla and even the ORIGINAL release of Saints Row the Third back in 2011, were made with quality, unlike this current port. Let me start off with the graphics. It looks dated, as expected, although the gamma seems to be completely out of whack with overly dark black levels(which can't be corrected with the in-game brightness toggle) and some horrendous anti-aliasing(moving lines along texture edges). If you're not moving or panning the camera, the game looks serviceable, but the problem mostly lies in the performance. The game targets 30 frames per second, and it doesn't maintain that target very often. In some indoor areas, you'll see frame-rates in the upper 20's and it feels alright, but in some areas out on the main map, the game often chugs below the upper 20's. If you happen to be in a firefight with moderate explosions, expect the game to hit single digits here and there too. Poor frame-rate(and frame time) affects two things: input response from controllers, and audio sync. This game suffers from both symptoms. Input response is incredibly slow when trying to line up a shot or direct a guided missile, and audio even lags and loses sync during some intense battles. When frame-rate is moderately stable, the audio sounds pretty good, and the dialogue is quite funny at times, but the technical problems detract from the fun in more places than I can count. The best experience with this port is to play in handheld mode, since it allows the imperfections in anti-aliasing and resolution to become less obvious, but in docked mode the game looks very blurry on a modern TV, even one with competent up-scaling. If you're one to overlook technical flaws in a game for the sole purpose of handheld capabilities such as with the switch, then you might be able to still have some fun here. The game is a blast to play when the frame rate isn't going insane, and because it contains all past downloadable content, there is well over 20-30 hours to invest in here. The other positive(if you can consider it one) is that, if you get the game physically, it is(currently) one of the few that manages to fit the entire game on the cartridge, so it won't take up any space on your internal storage or memory card. Honestly though, I'n hoping Volution takes a look at this, because it is in definitely in need of a performance patch, because right now, its not as fun to play as it should be because of its current state. It's far from broken, but it's also far from solid too. Id recommend waiting until the game is around 20 bucks.

title: This is like paying a monthly fee to use the FM receiver in your car.
text: Playstation plus is a bad value. You hand over your money, and in exchange Sony.. does what? They don't host game servers (most games are still peer to peer.) They don't provide any updates beyond what non-paying customers get. The free games are almost always worth less to me than the monthly subscription cost. They don't provide any connectivity (I already pay my ISP for that.) What am I getting here? You're letting me play multiplayer? It doesn't cost you anything to do that! The only reason it's even possible for you to offer that is because you so tightly control the available software! Shame on Sony for emulating Microsoft's terrible anti-consumer "service" model (have to put service in quotes because no actual services are provided.)

title: A great game from a good franchise that is finally getting ...
text: A great game from a good franchise that is finally getting back to what it's good at. I was worried after the disaster that was Dragon Age 2, but this hit all the right notes from DA: Origins and added a few more. And I love the new Dragon Keep model, where you can go online and customize your 'starting world' experience based on who you played in the first two games and what decisions you made. It makes it easy for those of us who played it on multiple platforms (PC vs Xbox 360) to still have carry over from all our games, and not have to worry about glitches from conflicting choices. Changing your starting world makes entire sections of the game feel knew each time you play through it, and I love the variety of conversations and cut scenes that occur because of those decisions and the ones you make throughout the game. You can play it has a hack-n-slash and ignore all that if you want, but for me that's where most of the fun is. I've been through the entire game twice, and am about to finish my third run through. And even with those hours upon hours of playtime, I'm considering a fourth time just because of a few alternatives I haven't explored yet in game. I love it!

title: WOW! My kind of game!
text: From the opening sequence till the titilating climax (no pun intended) Bayonetta is a rollercoater ride of sexy, crazy, over-the-top action. I love everything about the game. It screams faintly of Devil May Cry, which it should given the game was created by the same person, but Bayonetta gets my vote for favorite with its ultra sexy heroine, outrageous moves, nonsensical-yet-immersive story, smooth and detailed graphics, and all out fun. Yeah, it's kinda girly at times but throw in buckets of blood and some f-bombs and that evens things out. The game comes complete with it's own anime-styled tunes in the soundtrack conplete with lyrics!!!! It's every Japanese lovin' anime freak fanboys dream come true, which is pretty much myself and everyone I know. At any rate, I know its not gonna be everyone's cup of tea, but action fans should definitely check it out!!!

I haven't gotten through all four books yet and wonder what comes next, but the game is captivating, the added search at the end of each "book" and the decoding is a fun reward and the music is pleasant rather than jarring. If my thumbs weren't busy linking gems, I'd give this one a thumbs up.

title: Sub par
text: I have owned all the call of duty titles, and I feel that this one fell way short.  The single player is entertaining as usual, but the multiplayer, which is why most people get the game is a step in the wrong direction.  The multiplayer maps are very unimaginative, just a bunch of buildings with little creativity compared to other COD titles.  Weapons are basically the same but with more options.  The gameplay is the worst yet.  I have a 35MBPs connection with a 35ms ping to the closest major city yet each game I play is laggy as heck and many games I get booted due to server connectivity.  You would think that they would have servers all over to accomidate all the users across the US!  I still think due to poor online gameplay and lack of map creativity this is near the bottom of COD titles.

title: The Perfect Mouse
text: When most people think of Corsair mice, the first mouse that springs to mind is not the Sabre RGB.  Surprisingly, in my opinion this midrange mouse from the Corsair lineup is actually their strongest offering.  The sensor on this mouse is amazing.  It tracks super well and has a wide range of possible DPIs.  I usually leave it set to 4000.  All of the buttons are tactile and clicky.  In terms of RGB implementation, this is where the mouse shines.  Every single LED on this mouse is fully controllable and the mouse body itself is color-neutral (I'm looking at you Glaive RGB and M65 RGB).  The LEDs on the mousewheel in particular look much better than those of the M65.  Additionally, the mouse glides super smoothly on my mousepad which is the MM800 Polaris RGB hard pad.  The cable on this mouse is also much longer than most people will need.  Overall, this mouse is a super solid offering whose relatively budget friendly price will not disappoint in terms of its super strong feature set.

title: Amazing keyboard!
text: Perfect size for what i want, something portable and easy to handle to play on my Series X. It is plug and play, no issues at all, now i feel more confortable playing online shooters on my Xbox. The material quality and the sensitivity it's great, a little clicky than mechanical and soft as membrane, mouse precision is also good. It has internal battery and can be charge via USB-C. Very recommended, i got mine for less than Fourty. It is a steal for the quality and all that includes.

title: When i received the device it was in a nice black box with the company logo and their motto
text: When i received the device it was in a nice black box with the company logo and their motto. The mouse functioned righrt away and the dpi buttons worked as expected. Unfortunately the software did not come included with the product and I could not find it on the website. I noticed in other reviews people mentioned this. I simply contacted the customer support person via facebook and amazon and he answered me in a timely fashion and gave me the latest version of the english software. The software works great and I have not issues. This is a good mouse and works great. It would be even better if the software came with it or it was provided on the site page or better yet the manufacturers international website.

title: Thank God for Demos
text: The Mac version of the game is seriously flawed.  I was happy to see the addition but when I tried the demo it was worse than what people had described.  Seriously, I am now done with this franchise and am sad to see that EA has let this slide so badly.  No customer service.  No interest in a product well done.

title: All Stars
text: My wife and I are super Mario Cart Fans. We've bought at least 7 or 8 other race games but none hold a candle to Mario Carts. Will now we have one that does. Sonic Sega All-Stars is a ton of fun. It's a big game with lots to do. 24 colorful, detailed tracks that will keep you at the edge of your seat. Lots of power ups that are unique to the game. You can also use your Wii person that you may have made to drive the car. It makes me look fat. If you like Mario Carts, I don't see any way you would be sorry for purchasing this game. I bought mine from Amazon (free shipping) and had it in three or four days.

title: Best Final Fantasy game in a very long time
text: This is the best Final Fantasy game I have played since FFX. The gameplay is extremely fun and engaging and CHALLENGING. So many characters to choose from, and the story is great. Only downside is that the graphics are not so great, but this is a PSP game after all. If you enjoyed games like crisis core then this is recommended.

title: Tons of fun building and playing, even as an adult!
text: I'm a 25 year old male, and I will admit I just bought it for myself.  It was incredibly fun to build everything, and some of the games have some good replay-ability.  The piano is a blast to return to, the motorbike is really fun, and the fishing is nice and relaxing.  There's quite a bit here.  I definitely recommend getting the variety kit for sure,

title: A bit of joy to a couple of Gen X-ers
text: My girlfriend and I are both in our 40's, and neither of us have owned any modern (post 2000) game console. For me it was a Super Nintendo, for her an N64. I borrowed a Nintendo Wii from a friend and loved it, but I never bought one. We just wanted something handheld that you can play the old school games on. I've had my eye on a Switch Lite for a while, and finally purchased one a couple of weeks ago. I don't know the technical ins and outs of modern consoles, so I'm just going to keep my mouth shut there; but after an easy setup, this has been a ton of fun for both of us. I would like to ease my way into newer games, I just became uninterested in video games from my teenage years to recently, so nearly 30 years in this particular realm of technology has largely passed me by. But like I said, my girlfriend and I have been having a lot of fun reliving the 80's and early 90's with this. So if you're looking for the same experience, definitely pick one of these up.

title: These are good
text: Okay so... for a 20 dollar headset these are decent and will get you by... I've been using them for a couple weeks now for gaming and skyping. First off they are aesthetically pleasing.

title: Simply Perfect
text: If you play Karaoke Revolution or American Idol video games, then this mic is for you! You can say goodbye to all the problems with the headset, especially when more than a couple people are playing. You can just pass the mic instead waiting until every player gets adjusted using the headset mic. Plus, it fits everyone! Some players fit the headset perfectly but the ones who don't suffer. They get the mic right but not the earpiece, or the earpiece right and not the mic. It registers your voice accuately. This handheld is perfect!

title: Regarding the "censorship"
text: One single scene is being edited in the US version of the game. That's -edited-, not cut entirely. The edit in question was handled by the original developers themselves, surely to prevent angering American soccer moms, not to protect anyone playing the game. After all, there was nothing to protect anyone from. Every other aspect of the Japanese game will remain intact. Please disregard the reviewer who made it sound as if the game was going to be butchered in the localization process.

title: Compilations aren't what they used to be
text: I am tired of these empty compilations. I remember when Taito had 2 compilation discs back on the PS2. Those were LOADED with games! Now companies put out these empty collections at maximum price. Stay away unless you really like any of the games in this collection.

title: This is lovely for an affordable board.
text: I will note, that you need to be very careful when pulling the keycaps, as the switch pulled right our with it. So, hotswap keyboard it is! I bought this primarily for gaming and trying for switch testing. i'm pretty surprised with how much I like typing on it. The sounds are not very high pitched, which I love. Be aware, the stabilizers are... pingy? I think they will get pulled out and either replaced or at least lubed... or something. The space-bar isn't super pingy, but the enter and backspace are. I pretty much expect that on any new pre-built board, so it doesn't detract from the overall feel of the board. Shipping does take a while, but 2 weeks isn't terrible.

title: Just buy it already
text: Is it like Oblivion? Yes, but better. I've been able to see how the graphics compare to PS3 and Xbox360 , and unsurprisingly, PC is much better. The voice acting is excellent, and there are a lot more unique voices in this iteration, not nearly as many repeat voices like in Oblivion. I have done very little in the main story, but have been playing since just after launch and haven't had a lack of things to do, if anything there's almost too much. Well worth a play.

title: Probably a 7 out of 10
text: Essentially (and not surprisingly), this is Silent Hill: Homecoming.  Controls are the same, graphics are the same, combat is the same.  It's the same game, except for a Saw-twist on things.  The puzzles seem to be a little easier.  My advice is to download the demo of Silent Hill: Homecoming (if there is one) and see if you like it.  If you do, you'll like Saw: The Video Game.  It's not a game you'll show off to your friends, but it's one you can take turns with friends and play through in one night because it's engaging, like the Saw movies are.  In fact, it's really hard to put down.  I kept telling myself I'd quit after one more puzzle, but I kept playing it until it was over.  Short, but a fun game.  Ideally, a good, fun rental.  If fun's the whole purpose of a game, then this is a winner.

title: Not my cup of software.
text: This may be a good program if you grew up with it but after coming from Microsoft flight sim 2004,flightsim x and DCS this program is really not user friendly to get into and fly. Many of the aircraft are not complete and do not handle in a realistic way. I am not a pilot but I have flown ultralights and have flown in many other types of aircraft before and this software is not realistic. The scenery is great to look at in some areas but that does little when the planes do not function properly.  How can the instruments controls be so different between the two sim makers and xplanes way of adjusting them to me is just, well, maybe I shouldn't say it here. The graphics in both of Microsoft's flight Sims are maybe not as good as xplane in appearance but they work well and I have a 64 bit computer with a great graphics card and an older Processor. I can max graphics in Flightsim x but not x plane without glitches. X plane makers talk about how great their graphics are and they do look more realistic than flightsim x but in my area there are large lakes, Summit and Paxson that don't even show up as lakes, that isn't very realistic in my book. With all the frustration I am having with this program just trying to figure it out and I haven't even got into the atc part of it yet I would not have bought it. I cannot understand why anyone would want to write a software this complicated to figure out and use and try to sell it to the public. When I want to fly I want a Sim that is realistic and easy to learn and use not one that you had to be bottle fed on to figure out. Microsoft's programs may not be supported anymore but at least you can use them and enjoy them and figure them out without trying to obtain a software degree while doing it and their planes that come with the software are complete planes with many others to download for free. Some of the x plane models are not complete and do not have functioning gauges and switches. I can't speak for others but I have tried it and I don't like it and I can't recommend it to anyone, especially a newbie to flight Sims. I still say that Flight Sim 2004 is probably the best one built, it works and works well. I do not work for Microsoft I just like software that works, that's my opinion and review, nothing more. Hope it helps you in your decision as to wither to buy it or not.

title: Romance with a bit of culture
text: I liked this movie because it gave a "bird's-eye" view of culture. Few fiction writers give insight into the culture and delves into relationships of the Orthodox Jewish faith, except for the movie "A Stranger Among Us" and Faye Kellerman's fictional characters, Rina Lazurus and Peter Decker. It is rare that storylines deal with the culture (woman with shaved hair, "sheitel" headcovering) This movie mildly mentions a few areas which aroused curiosity as to the reason behind some of the customs. The movie is refreshing, not long, but has a balanced amount of romance and thought-provoking concepts and culture that makes it pleasantly worthwhile viewing.  It is a well-done Hallmark movie.

title: Great for Xbox 360 just OK for PC...
text: This a great wheel for the Xbox 360. It also works for the PC if you have a wireless receiver for the PC. Force Feedback doesn't work if you're running off of batteries. Force Feedback doesn't work for the PC, rumble works and the wheel gives you resistance but the true Force feedback effect only works on the Xbox. I can see hardcore sim fans missing it, it basically means that if you hit a curb while racing on the PC you'll feel the wheel rumble... on the the Xbox you'll feel the wheel rumble and the wheel pulls as if you've hit a real curb. There's also some pull on the tires as you're taking corners, it's a nice feature, but the additional force the wheel gives on the PC also helps out with you're driving without true FFB.

title: A Refreshing Change
text: I absolutely love this game. It has all the loved basics of the Pokemon series and so much more. I have to say after Platinum, Heart Gold, and Soul Silver the games were getting a little stale. Sure, they were excellent remakes, but that's the key word, "Remakes". Pokemon White and Black were a sight for sore eyes. A completely new game with all new Pokemon. Very, VERY refreshing! It feels like I'm taking my first steps in Red and Blue all over again! It's nice to start fresh with a new team, not going into every cave and seeing the repetitive Geodude and Zubat. I actually feel excited every time I enter a new area, not knowing what new Pokemon might pop out at me. These games are also a lot more serious. The Pokemon are sharper and look tougher, and the bad guys aren't just evil for the sake of being evil. They have motives and are actually trying to do good. They have also greatly improved the online capabilities of the games also. Video chat included! I recommend this to any longtime Pokemon fans, or people who are new to the series. It is a wonderful change in pace and a great addition to a DS collection!

title: Doesn't work on my DVD players
text: None of my three DVD players (Sony, Magnavox, Proscan) will read the lens-cleaner disk.  When I try to play it, I get either a "can't read" message (Sony) or a strange sound as if the player is trying, but unsuccessfully, to play the disk. I tried to run a replacement disk. Same result.  A DVD player at Wal-Mart, where I had purchased the disk, played the disk without difficulty. Three different employees professed mystification at the inability of my DVD players to read the disk.  Since the box containing the disk has no Maxell telephone number on it, I can't (as I would like) call Maxell to get their take on the problem. I feel ripped off.

title: Game I'll Remember for a Lifetime
text: I grew up on King's Quest. My parents were playing King's Quest I when I was in the womb, and every time a new King's Quest came out they would play it. When I was very little, it was exciting to watch them play the games. As I got older, I would be very eager to help them solve some of the puzzles. By the time King's Quest VII came out, I could practically play on my own and it was such an amazing experience to explore the lands, meet characters, and solve problems with all of the items in your inventory. I learned a lot about mythology and fairy tale lore. I played through this game multiple times. Fifteen years later, I STILL think about this game. Somewhat often. I remember with nostalgia my favorite levels, favorite characters, favorite scenes. This game was so clever and contained a lot of humor. The graphics were bright and fun. I will always think back fondly on this game.

title: Hits the 6 to 12 age group nicely
text: This is a good choice for a child in 2nd to sixth grade. I think it's actually a bit more suited to girls that game because there is a lot of focus on social interaction that boys might become impatient with. The game is text based and a bit old school in it's layout - this is a hunt and find type of game where Pikachu will be running from one end of PokePark to another looking for pokemon to befriend or battle. The skill level depends on what the player wants from the game. My younger daughter is happy to run through the storyline, my older one wants to collect every single pokemon methodically. Price is a bit high, I think. I wish Nintendo had brought this out at their second price point instead of their established one for longer playing games. That aside, it's been a huge hit in our house since release day. This won't challenge the adult player long, but a child with a bit of patience and a passion for pokemon will love it.

title: Nice hard to find small size LED keyboard.
text: This LED keyboard is working out well as I needed a small footprint keyboard.  Finding an LED keyboard for my small side desk was a challenge because it is a small computer desk and the pull out tray requires a small keyboard.  The lighted keys are easy to see and the three color options is a plus.  The only issue I have typing is the main enter key is a bit smaller and different shape than my old keyboard which causing me to miss it at times.  So why the 5 star rating if it is not perfect?  Well, for me it is because for the money my expectations were lower and met and most important for me my small size needs were spot on.  So it was a good value all around.

title: This is my favorite RPG of all time
text: I've been an avid gamer since I was a very small child (4 to be exact when I first got my hands on an NES in 1988) and RPG's have been my genre since then. I have played and beaten countless RPG's on all different kinds of consoles since then... excluding all those I have played on PC and Mac, and for some reason even among world reowned classics such as FFVII and Chrono Trigger this game has stood profoundly out in my mind. Filled with compelling and mentally stimulating gameplay, if you're a true RPG fan, this is not a title you will soon forget. However, if old-skool RPG gaming to you is the that time last year when you beat FFVIII... forget it.

title: Absolutely Amazing
text: This game is so awesome. The Player customization is crazy good and very deep and detailed. I like to have the ability to choose from 3 or 4 faces...cool! The career mode is really deep and the commentary hardly ever repeats itself! I love when my guy does the sprinkler after he knocks in that 2 foot par...sweet! The ranked matches run flawlessly, although I have been dropped to the dash maybe 100 times. I like that you can't play the masters, makes Grand Slamming a lot easier. It's also nice to be able to tie for majors without the game having a playoff hole. I enjoy that they don't acknowledge a tie at any point in any game mode...I could lose on the next hole so I think it's cool just to win without acknowledging that someone else has the same score as me. I can't wait until my created golfer reaches level 100 then I bet the game gets wayyyyy better, I'm sure a ton more features will pop up after I finish my career. I like that there is around 8 professional golfers you can use, oh, and the 8 courses that the game has is more than enough. On Tiger Woods there was a feature where you could create your team and play with your friends, I'm glad they did away with that because playing with the same people can get repetitive. I think EA out did themselves with this game, this will be the bar at which golf games are made going forward. If Rory McIlroy is playing this during his off time I bet he's having a ton of fun! I love this game

title: Surprisingly good
text: With Justice League Heroes hitting the home consoles, this GBA game got churned out as well, which takes the focus away from Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, and Green Lantern, and instead focuses on the fastest man alive, the Flash.  And guess what?  It's surprisingly good superhero fun.  Yeah, it looks like the standard Final Fight style beat 'em up, but the Flash's super speed is used so good here that it sets the game apart from the pack.  You can use a quick burst of speed to knock around your enemies, or you can slow down time and move ultra fast so your foes don't stand a chance, and in heavy situations, you can call for help from Superman, Wonder Woman, and Martian Manhunter.  The graphics are solid enough, using small character sprites that look good, and voice effects for the characters that work well too.  The bosses include such Flash rogue favorites like Gorilla Grood and Professor Zoom as you trek through Keystone City, Gotham City, and more to take on Brainiac, which shouldn't take you too long because sadly the game is a little on the short side.  Not to mention that some other Flash rogues would have been welcome, like fan favorites like Captain Cold, Captain Boomerang, Trickster, or Mirror Master; which would have fit better here than Killer Frost.  Despite that though, Justice League Heroes: The Flash is a surprisingly good superhero beat 'em up that nicely captures the spirit of the Flash, and it's definitely worth checking out for Flash fans.

title: She loved playing the role of tank or damage
text: I played this game 2 years ago at Blizzcon with my daughter.  She loved playing the role of tank or damage, while I healed her with my character.  The way the game is designed, it really is exciting for people to support one another, really make it a team effort.  We had so much fun and we could not wait until it came out.  Until I found out there is no way for my daughter and I to play together.  At Blizzcon we were able to play on the same team.  But unless I have 2 PCs, 2 Xbox ones, or 2 playstation 4s, we can't play together.  Blizzard has said no to even crossing platforms.  We have a pc and an Xbox One so if they green-lighted this we would be thrilled.  But they won't.  Why make a game that is so much fun to play together as a family and make it one player?  So ridiculous.  They are just catering to hard-core gamers.  And hard-core gamers probably will not like the game from what I hear, the only people overly impressed are people like me, casual gamers, who want to play with their family in the same room.  I have no idea what Blizzard was thinking on this one.....

title: Fake PS3 Controller
text: Don't buy a PS3 controller from NorAm International Partners, Inc.  They are selling fake controllers.  You can tell it's fake if the buttons seem a little off, the home button and the LED lights at the top are a little recessed, and if you have difficulty syncing the controller to your PS3.  By difficulty, I mean that it takes 30 seconds or more to sync and flashes all four lights for this time.  Also, if your controller is plugged in when you shut your ps3 down, your controller will continue to blink and will actually restart your ps3, meaning you have you manually turn it off or unplug the controller.  Finally, the sticker on the back of the controller is missing most of the specs other controllers have on them.  Wish I would have read their feedback profile before I bought it, as this is not the first time someone noticed it was fake.  Don't buy from them, you'll regret it

title: Civ still rocks, even on the small screen!
text: As a long time Civ player (all the way back to Civ I), I can say that this title is indeed the true Civ experience.  Everything you loved about the original seems to be here and it is greatly simplified.  It has to be simplified really as the DS system is not as capable as a full blown PC is.  The maps seem a tad small to me, meaning you bump into other civilizations faster than you might otherwise, but overall the look and feel of Civ is in there.  This will be great for people who love Civ4 and travel a lot, or simply just want to relax in the back yard and test their empire building skills.  Well done Sid Meier!

title: one of the best on the NES
text: Super Mario Bros 2 is my favorite game of the series and the original SMB is a legend.  So where does this leave Super Mario Bros 3?  This was the last Super Mario game on the old NES and while I might like some of the other games more, this might be the class of the series on the NES.  With the strange direction that SMB2 went, this was a trip back to the roots of Mario.  This is a true side scrolling game and features many of the same enemies from the original.  You still jump, stomp and throw fire to make your way through the game.  But there are new features now.  First, there is now a world map and you can select which level you want to enter next.  Some levels are avoidable, some are not, but you can also do special areas (several mini-games and an area where you get bonus items).  You are able to get items throughout the game, and you can use them before levels to be stronger.  There are also several different suits that augment your abilities.  The most common is the Racoon suit which allows you to kill the enemies by flicking your tail at them, and also giving you the ability to fly for short periods of time. There is also a frog suit (allowing swimming to be easier), a Tanooki suit (much like the raccoon suit, but you can briefly turn to stone to avoid enemies...rare), and I believe there is a Hammer Brothers Suit (but I could be wrong about this one....my memory is a little hazy).  This is one of the best games released for the NES and is essential gaming for a Mario fan.

The graphics won't go any higher. They have very little options for items but rather have different bland color schemes. This game looks like it is a prequel to sims 2. To round this review up. The graphics are horrible, the price is too high, the sims are as stupid as slugs, build mode is the most difficult thing to navigate, the interface for playing forces you to click all over the screen to tiny confusing buttons with some hot keys that don't work. Don't buy this game please. I have never been so disapointed with a new video game in my life. Sad sad day for me and sims

title: A mockery of the beautiful game
text: Player ball control has been slowed to a crawl and makes a mockery of reflexive movements that are supposed to belong to world class soccer players.  If you see a defender coming your way, then it is already too late to evade him as any moves fail to register with the player in time.  Even receiving the ball in stride and maneuvering ahead of time is too slow.  That being said, the game is reduced to crosses from the wing and rebound shooting.  AI is simply a joke as computer players refuse to make even the most basic of soccer plays towards the ball unless they are told to.  I understand they are probably trying to put more control in the players hands, but at a certain point, you shouldn't have to tell players to chase after a loose ball in front of the opponents net. Finally, possibly the biggest problem, is the dysfunction of online play.  Ultimately, the problem lies on EA's hands.  If they are ready to take the consumers money on this game, they should have the game ready especially online play.

title: Defective by design, beware
text: This game is infected with Ubisoft's new DRM system that forces you to remain online even if you're playing single player.  If your network goes down, so will the game.  If you want to play on a laptop while not connected, too bad, you can't.  If Ubisoft's DRM server goes down (as it has already) you can't play, either.  You are paying for the privilege of being a casualty in Ubisoft's war against piracy.  The pirated version does not have these problems, ironically.  I simply can't recommend this game to anyone in its current state and am honestly appalled that they have decided to abuse their own customers like this.

title: Solid Choice
text: I ordered this controller specifically to use with my Steam gaming account. Initially I spent many frustrated hours trying to get my wired PS3 controller to work with the use of several different free software programs without any success. I finally decided to break down and get a 360 style controller, and it worked perfectly on the first try. Now I can lay in bed and game from my desktop. My only wish is the cord was longer and the cord length was listed in the product description, other than that I haven't had any issues with any of the buttons. They have a smooth action. The controller is a comfortable weight for long game play and the vibration on it is definitely noticeable but not overly powerful. I am really happy with the product and might get a second one so friends can also play on cooperative games.

title: Completely unacceptable
text: My girlfriend is the main person who plays this game, I'm not a fan of the gameplay but she loves it so that's perfectly fine with me. But the freezing that this game is doing is honestly starting to annoy me alot. I am on my 2nd PS3, my first one (the 40gb old model) eventually got the YLOD so I replaced it with the slim. It seems like the game eventually freezes up every time she plays, requiring us to manually walk up to the console and turn it off. Now I really hope that this freezing issue isn't damaging my PS3, but even if it isn't this is a completely unacceptable issue.  I think they've been releasing patches but I don't know if its helping since it's been freezing more than ever. This game may be fun for a lot of people but the glitches and freezing have made it a steaming pile of garbage. It makes me even more angry because the PS3 is the only gaming console we own so I wish the solution could be as simple as getting it for another console.

title: Problems linking the guitars
text: This bundle does include the game. Not sure why one of the other reviews says otherwise. This game is very different from the original guitar hero games. Also none of your old guitars will work as this game uses redesigned guitars. This didn't bother me since although I have played them, I've never owned the previous versions.  With this bundle you will learn quickly that the process to link the guitars to your PS4 system isn't user friendly. It took me about 40 minutes of trial and error and researching online to figure it out. This is the only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars. Once you successfully link them, this game is awesome. My daughter and I played it all night and had a blast the day we bought it.

title: She loved it, and had no difficulties finishing it on ...

Product works great, its basically the same one that originally comes with the 360's.  No hiccups as of yet and I've had it for a couple of days.  If you need a new power supply, I recommend this one for sure.

title: LOVE the game...HATE orgins
text: Had I known that I would have to download through Origins, I would have bought from a different site. Origins, at least for a Mac, requires a different processor than the game itself. Meaning, even though I BOUGHT my game that was able to be used on my processor, Origins won't let me DOWNLOAD it to be able to PLAY it. Makes sense? It makes more sense to be able to download directly from Amazon rather than go to another website that has different requirements. Never going to buy any game from amazon if it has be to downloaded from Origins again. And if I were able to return the game itself, I would. Sadly, I can not.

Playing online etc this game will last you for a long time. The story mode was surprisingly amazing, I mean a great story in a FIGHTING game? hell yeah somehow they pulled that off. Get this.

title: Real Planes, Real Physics, Real Fun
text: I have played a lot a flight sims... it's part of my job.  I do work for this little company called Laminar Research which just happens to market a little game called X-Plane.  I can't say much for Young's Modulous (yet) but as far as X-Plane goes, I can tell you that it is the very best flight simulator available and here's why: It wasn't designed for Joe who wants to play a flight simulator game- it was designed for people who actually fly airplanes- for people who like real physics- for people who want to fly in REAL TIME weather and take off from their home airport.  Austin Meyer, the designer of this game, is a genious- a one man team (plus myself, the puny graphics guy) who single handedly programs the amount of stress of every single section of the airplane.  Amazing programing.  What gripes could you have?  Graphics slightly less than par?... All versions include FREE upgrades and patches and thousands of other planes have been modeled by various fans.  Give X-Plane a shot!  Trust me.  Amazing company, ladies and gentlemen.  He gives his very own technical support.) Real Planes, Real Physics, Real Fun.  X-Plane.  Go for it.

title: Read the reviews.. There's a "pending" issue.
text: Purchased this for my brother..It was Stuck in Pending Purgatory.. for several hours. I didn't receive any kind of confirmation , and it didn't show up in my orders..So after an hour I tried it again.. same situation..This time when checking orders the item did not show up until I set the filter to last 30 days. Of course the previous two gift card orders showed up so I now have four gift cards when I only meant to get two. I finally called customer service they deleted the orders asked me to re-upload my credit card. It was complete hassle... so I re-ordered it at 9 p.m. and it didn't come out of pending until 3 a.m. the following day. I don't know what the issue is but it's obviously something that occurs to a lot of people so next time I need to get gift cards I'll just go to a brick and mortar store since take about the same amount of time to retrieve it.

title: Incomplete and Boring
text: I bought halo the day that it came out thinking that it was going to be great because it was the first halo to be made for the xbox one. Instead what I and many other players received was an incomplete game that is missing many features that would have made it a fun game. It seems that 343 believed that it would be smart to remove split screen from halo because it was not necessary and fun. They failed to deliver and instead they force us to play a game that is not fun because there is no split screen and it is missing so many game modes such as doubles and snipers. The game is no fun and it is difficult to play when the servers are always disconnecting me from the game. Many people have complained to them about the servers and they refuse to listen and fix the issue. I would not recommend this game and instead I would recommend for someone to find another game to play.

title: Snap, Crackle, Pop! A40!!! (from a very angry customer)
text: The sound pops and crackles every couple seconds. My controllers and console are fully updated, so they are not causing the issue. If it wasn't for that annoying thing, the sound quality is excellent. I did a ton of research on this, as it is extremely annoying, and I found that it is most likely due to a defective adapter (m80). Therefore, since it would be ridiculous to spend even more money on a new m80, since they sent me a defective one, I will only change my review upon receiving a new mixamp m80, or once my issue gets resolved. I spent 200 dollars on this thing because I heard nothing but fantastic reviews about this product, but now that there's a huge hole in my bank account, I immediately regret this decision.

Have yet to find a defect in this- and I HATE buying batteries so this is perfect for us.  The only down side is the charging time which is only normal.

text: I bought this set for my 9-yr old daughter, who believes the world should exist in every shade of pink, imaginable! She originally wanted a sleeve for her 3DS, but as we were scrolling around the site, we came across this set . It had everything she could possible need! They arrived quickly, and she was well on her way to protecting, and amplifying, and cleaning, and plugging-in, and doing all kinds of groovy things with her 3DS. I think for the money, it was way well worth it, and she seems totally happy, so that's the best bottom line, right?

title: I don't know about you guys, but I got everything as promised. Great product!
text: I was looking for a Wii console that is new enough to work well and connect to wifi, but not the newest model (read: more expensive) so I did a little research before purchasing. I know other people have reported the Wii Sports game as missing from the box and that the plug was not compatible with U.S. outlets, but I ordered this package in April and everything was included and works well. Maybe the seller is doing better quality control to make sure everything is in the box that is supposed to be in it, but I have had absolutely no problem with this product. I had read the reviews before ordering and considered the number of reviews posted (people are more apt to write a review when there is something bad to report... plus there were only 7 reviews whereas some other products have hundreds so you get more of an idea of the consistency of the seller in that case) and more or less took my chances figuring I could return it if I was dissatisfied. However, everything is great and was in the original packaging! Also, as a novice in the area of gaming consoles, I was able to hook everything up and get it going very easily. Very happy with my purchase.

title: Singstar and Queen -- no way you can go wrong
text: Let me first start by saying that I am a singstar addict. I have all the games released so far in the US for the PS3, I imported the wireless mics from Europe, and I am considering buying other titles that have been released in Europe, but not here. With that said here is my review. The Singstar format is still the same: Online Store, Online Community, and Game play. Why fix it if it isn't broke? Queen is one of the greatest rock bands of all time with so many recognizable hits, so Singstar really has a winner with a title that has so many memorable songs. You can play alone, in a duet, or even as a group... it's tons of fun. There are of course other titles with different artists, but if you are a Queen fan, this is a must have. So, get it, and sing, sing, sing... become a SingStar!

title: Great machine, wish it actually worked
text: Love my PS3 and I was really looking forward to spending all weekend playing my new PS4.  Got it delivered after work Friday evening and hooked it up.  Started playing Killzone multiplayer and voice-chatting with my brother, made it about 10 minutes and the PS4 shut off with no warning.  Now its totally bricked.  Doesn't output anything, won't boot into safe mode, and just pulsates a blue light.  Spent 2.5 hours waiting to talk to someone at Sony customer support.  They were very polite, but the only option to get a new one is to send it to them for service and wait 2 weeks.  Judging by how long I was waiting I'm betting this problem is a lot more widespread than originally reported.  The ten minutes I spent with it were fantastic, it's an awesome machine.  But that doesn't really do much good if its just a brick until after thanksgiving most likely.  Really put a damper on what I thought would be a fun launch weekend.  So disappointed in this.

title: Best video game to date.
text: I am a LoD addict...I even have it on my ipad...This is truly my favorite game EVER made. It is such a great turn based battle game. I love that the characters don't just do one slash attack. You have to time the additions up to 7 times to complete your attack and if you miss, some bosses will counterattack and knock you on your ass. You get a whole different set of moves and attacks when you charge up your Dragoon gauge. I would pay to see this game remade during my lifetime.

title: Awesome headset for gaming and chat!
text: This product produces excellent sound quality in game- and also in team chat. I noticed a difference in voice quality both when I heard people through the headset and when my friends heard me, stating I sounded clearer. It helped with locating footsteps of enemies in games too with clear sounds. The colors, when the headset is plugged in, are vibrant and produces great atmosphere. I would recommend to anyone looking for a gaming headset

title: Great Game

title: THE FUTURE OF GAMING
text: This is the most amazing thing I've ever experienced! I am completely amazed! VR is most definitely the future of gaming! First game I fired up was Eve Valkerie. Wow! I was in the game! In the ship! When I was about to take off, my adrenaline kicked in and next thing I know, I'm shooting drones, flying through ship debris and having massive space dogfights! I never was so into a game in my life! After that, I was checking the view on a beach near Mt. Fuji! The way the VR completely puts in the game is astonishing! I see a very bright future for PSVR, and just VR in general. Heck, Skyrim? In VR? Very bright indeed.

title: One of the worst games I've ever played
text: This is not a review because I'm a new player and the game is too hard. I am a high level player of these NHL games and after a full week of playing and giving it countless chances, I can say that this is one of the worst games of all time. The features are amazing. I love how in depth the game is. But the gameplay itself is beyond pure garbage. The opposing AI will never ever be off your player. They can read exactly where you're going and make turns as you make them. Physics means nothing to the opposing AI while your AI is a joke. Passing feels completely random and don't even bother using stick lift. It doesn't work. The AI has a recovery time of zero while you get held down by unrealistic physics. I can't even begin to explain how frustrating it is. I like things to be difficult. I don't want to easily win every game. Losing games is good because that means the challenge is there. But I cannot deal with feeling cheated because of how unfair the game is. Winning even feels bad because the experience is so frustrating. EA is awful and I cannot stress enough that no one should waste their money on this horrible game.

title: DLC is worth the extra cost-major expansion
text: I would first say that people need to ignore the reviewer who said it didn't install from steam.  That was a misunderstanding of the delay for steam updating the game.  It is now on steam and downloads and works fine.  The expansion does what it advertises, and that is a bit more than previous expansions.  Like the Sword of Islam and Republic expansions, it adds playable groups, this time the Pagans (Including norse, baltic, african, and mongol strains of pagans), as well as Zoroastrians.  It also adds an earlier start date, something not done in previous expansion DLC.  If you ever wanted to play as vikings, as Lithuanians, as mongols (including the great Genghis Khan and his descendants), or start at the beginning of some of the great dynasties in Europe, this is a well worthwhile DLC to get.

title: Here's a solution to those who say this game is hard...
text: This game is FUN and it's a must-have for those who love Sonic the Hedgehog (like me). As I've read in negative reviews, many people think this game is just too difficult to play. One thing that helps for those who agree, is if you go to options and change the WII remote position to VERTICAL MODE rather than it's default HORIZANTAL MODE. Seriously, it's WAAAAAAAY easier to play the game that way! It'll still take some time to get used to, but once you have it, it'll be EASY and a total blast! I highly recommend this game and changing the WII remote settings to VERTICAL MODE. Enjoy!

title: Does Work!
text: This controller does work with your PS4 and very much feels like a ps controller. I like  this a lot. the battery life doesn't seem as good as a ps controller but that doesn't bother me. I really just wanted a ps4 controller that wouldn't be 40 or more dollars. This very much fit the bill.

title: Perfect replacement parts!
text: Everything worked great! The new analog thumb sticks work perfectly and no more drift! I'm happy it came with 4 metal locks since 3 of my Joycons were loose.  The two screwdrivers are the perfect size. No striping the screws!

title: Lots of fun, but you'd better have a fast computer.
text: I adore SimCity 3000, but I have to admit it can be a frustrating  experience on a slower machine.  I have a Pentium 233MMX, which admittedly  is old, but still well within the System Requirements stated by Electronic  Arts.  Unfortunately, even with all the animations and processor-hogging  options turned off, the game still runs slowly as the city expands.  I'm  sure it's great on a PII or faster, but sadly the old Pentiums just don't  cut it.  If you've got a faster machine you'll love it, but people with  older machines might want to stick with older versions of SimCity until  they upgrade.

title: It should remain a fun, carefree time for girls
text: Short. Puzzle driven. The whole purpose of the game was to solve puzzle after puzzle after puzzle. ND is about solving mysteries and following clues. The game included a woman who was married to another woman (see photo); this is not true to the ND theme and concept. Since the games are targeted toward girls aged 10 and up, parents should have been warned ahead of time so they could choose whether or not to expose their daughters to this.  All political platforms should be kept out of ND games. It should remain a fun, carefree time for girls.

title: One Star
text: It wasn't like the pictures

title: Exciting and good looking single player game.
text: After reading the great reviews of this game I went out and bought a Gamecube just to play it and I'm glad I did.  After finishing Ninja Gaiden on the Xbox, I have been searching for the next great game.  I tried Doom 3 on my PC, but was unsatisfied.  I also tried various Xbox games, but none were as good as Ninja Gaiden.  Well I can honestly say that this game is as much fun, if not more, than Ninja Gaiden.  The graphics are not quite as good as Ninja Gaiden on my 94" diagonal projection system, but I am trying to get the Gamecube component cables to improve the picture quality.  Gameplay is good.  The contols are well designed and the game is not too hard and not too easy.  Save points seem fairly spaced.  One caveat is that you can buy guns, health, but not ammunition.  This forces you to choose your weapon to match your opponent and use it wisely to conserve ammo.  I highly recommend this game.

title: Quite simply the BOMB!
text: I love this game!  Okay so I am a Magic addict, not only that but I am female which I have found out is a rare creature in the realm of Magic, and it's many mysteries.  This game is great fun, especially if you don't get  to play the card game very often.  There are two ways of playing, you can  make up your own deck and then play against the computer or you can use the  interactive part of the game and go into the land of Shandalar and try and  defeat the five Wizards, each Wizard representing a different land type.  This works in a similar way to playing the computer but in this way you can  collect rare and unique card along the way to boost the basic set you are  allocated with.  There are four levels, Apprentice, Magician, Sorcerer and  Wizard.  I would recommend that if you are a beginner go as an apprentice  because it is easier.  Playing on the Wizard level is like playing in a  real tournament, and can be exceedingly frustrating! Apprentices play with  a one-colour deck rather than mixed colours, which makes an easier game all  round.  Like in the card game, the computer version gives its cards the  same strength and weaknesses.  Blue being based on spells and magic, green  being earthy and fast etc.  The graphics are good, as are the sound effects  and you feel you are actually getting a prize when you win cards off the  creatures you challenge.  You can go around Shandalar picking up extra  cards by trading amulets that you are allocated at the start of the game,  or buy buying them with gold that you win, steal, or are given.  It's a fun  game, that is totally addictive.  I have been told there is an expansion  pack available but I have yet to find it.  All the same it is a great  computer game and well worth having if you love Magic and want to play the  game on your own.

title: Pretty good EA
text: Well, to start off this review I have to say I have never played a FIFA videogame on the Wii before so I gave this a try. The players look somewhat cartoonish and the fans are still pixelated. The game is not Gamecube controller compatible, but the controls are easy to learn especially with the nunchuck. The game starts out with you naming your city and team. From there you can go to Intercity Mode where you can make your team a world class team. Other modes are your usual tournament mode, streets to stadiums mode, and a street mode. Streets to Stadiums mode is where you can create a player and make him a star. It's basically Be A Pro mode. Streets mode is my favorite as of now. It's a basic street futsal 4v4 match. It's fun because you can do tricks off the wall and use power ups too. The Wii FIFA is made more of a fun to play with friends type of game as to where Xbox or PS3 FIFA's are meant to be more competitive. FIFA 15 for the Wii is a game to play if you want arcade style play. If you want more realistic play stick to Xbox or PS3.

title: Visual Masterpiece but.  not everyone's cup of tea
text: Make no mistake. This game is not a shooter or an action adventure. The developers were going for only thing. Providing a cinematic experience. And that they have delivered in spades. This game is hands down best looking console title. It tells an interesting story with excellent characters and  rich lore. If you are not ready for a cut scene heavy linear experience where  story and dialogues take precedence over plain shooting then you might want to rent or borrow the game. But if you like me are tired with open world nonsense where most of time is spent on fetch quests and collecting parts (DAI) this is a welcome relief. Looking forward to a sequel where they can improve on many aspects namely improved gameplay and reduced QTE.

title: Wait for bargain bin, if that.
text: I have the exact same issues as "Jake", so I am glad to know I am not crazy. My kids (7 and 5) don't want to play this game anymore, so I gave it a try. The targeting function with Buzz's laser, a necessity, is ridiculous. The camera has to be adjusted almost non-stop with the directional buttons in order to see where you are going, forcing you to stop and move it every few seconds. I don't own many games but I thought that Disney in 2010 would release a fun, high quality game for their biggest franchise ever. This game, with its graphics, the horrible control responsiveness, and the ridiculous amount of loading screens, feels like a PC game from 10 years ago. And holy moly they play that "You've Got a Friend in Me" song on an endless loop (If you like this song, you won't after 30 minutes of this game). The first good review and the expensive looking "commercial" on the page led me to give this game a try. I am writing this to ask you to play it somewhere first before you buy it. It burns my biscuits that they released this poor game and are marketing it as if it is worth fifty dollars. Lesson learned.

title: Fun but Too Short
text: At first glance, this game has some very positive features, including a variety of minigames and a fun storyline that adds to the entertainment.  The minigames themselves work well as they are quite varied and include activities such as putting out fires by moving the Wii wand back and forth or racing away from authorities that are attempting to apprehend an alien companion.  Where this game seems to fall short is on length as even if played casually this game can probably be finished in a few hours.  After that, you will find yourself competing in the same minigames, which may be fun if played in a group but may not be very satisfying from a single-player perspective.  Additionally, unlike the original Cars game for Wii, there really is a limited focus on true racing, and there is no real open-ended racing where one can select differing characters and tracks in which to compete.  Overall, this game might be a good option provided one is looking for a group game that is easy to pick up and play in a group setting but for the price tag I would have hoped for more options.
