title: Great game for kids
text: This game has just the right amount of complexity for kids. My kids are 9 and 12 and they love this game. The graphics are fantastic (and demanding). The game did freeze once but since I've installed the update, I've not had any problems. If you are looking for complex adult entertainment that comes with a steep learning curve, this is not the game for you. The city simulation is pretty basic but this allows you to try different city scenarios without getting wrapped up in the complexity of a myriad of simulation details. You can for example have two areas in your city plot. Have happy sims on one half and make real angry sims on the other. Then, create jails and swat teams on the good side to try to stave off the invading irked sims looking for a better life. I would have like to see some deeper dimension of city life simulation, but the game is fun as it is so I don't mind. If you tend to stop playing games because they get too complicated or hard, you'll like this game.

title: Nice wireless switch controller for a reasonable cost.

I believe this controller is the perfect happy medium. He has had it for a few weeks now and it is in perfect working condition. And he plays with it daily for a few hours. It was easy to connect and play with.

The click of the strike pack is nice and easy to get used to, adapt your playing style to this thing and you'll never want to play without it.

title: I highly recommend this game.
text: In my opinion this is the best game on PlayStation VR! I was nervous about this at first because I didn't think it was a good idea to be playing a game in VR for as many hours as Skyrim requires. But I don't get sick or headaches while playing this for a extended time, I do make sure I take breaks every 10 minutes tho. This game feels completely different in VR! Fighting a dragon as it circles over you just can't be described! But on the downside this is a old game! The animations do break up and glitches galore! I really wish this wasn't a full price game since it's the same game that's been rereleased almost every year! But I'm happy with the immersion and was complete worth the price!

title: DVD games are NOT the way to go.
text: Sometimes I wonder if anybody has ever bought a game released on DVD. The truth is, DVD isn't any better quality for games, it's just slower. If you have a CD-ROM drive, buy the CD-ROM version. If you only have a DVD drive  on your comp, get a CD-ROM drive. DVD drives are slower than a good 40-50x  cd-rom drive, no matter what anyone tries to tell you.

title: My 8- and 10-year-olds love it
text: My kids are huge Lego game fans and are near-completionists of Lego Star Wars, Batman, Indiana Jones, Harry Potter, etc. (come to think of it I need to take them out fishing more often).  Anyway, they were not disappointed when they started this up.  The voice acting is well done, the gameplay is inventive and endlessly cooperative, and replay value is huge as with all Lego games.  Their rating: as good as Lego Star Wars I and II (their most favorite games), better than Harry Potter and Indiana Jones.  In 4 hours of gameplay we have had one lock-up so far requiring power cycling of the Wii and two situations where a character or vehicle wass hopelessly trapped requiring restart of the level.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: Arrived on time, well packaged and works perfect.  A refurbished console it looks and performs like brand new.  Couldn't be happier.

title: pretty but not working
text: Bought this product together with a new Wii.  Thought that I can save on battery.  Well, couldn't be more wrong.  Asides being somewhat pretty, this product is no good.  I believe the main thing is that the two included batteries do not work.  One never worked, and the other can only hold a small amount of power (left in charge over night and more), which would support about 30 minutes play time.  Because I don't have other similar batteries, so I have to say I don't know if it is the charging station or the batteries.  Not worth the trouble for me to send it back.  Switch back to AA rechargeables.

title: Exactly what we needed, great seller with excellent customer service
text: Good value for the money, I needed another charger for my son's Nintendo Switch; the one I initially received was defective; I was ready to order another one just because we needed it and knew it would be a hassle to return it during this time. The seller had reached out to me just to ask about my experience; I explained the situation and was sent a new one immediately. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE which saved me some trouble and money. The charger itself is a very good one, inexpensive but not cheap.

title: Exceeded my expectations
text: I wouldn't consider myself a handy man, but I didn't want to pay anybody to mount my Xbox on the wall. Command strips we're out the question so I headed to Amazon to see what was available. After reading the reviews on numerous products, I decided to go with this one.  It was very easy to set up using just a leveler and screwdriver.  The price was very appealing also the fact that all I have to do to change out my Xbox one to another console is undo the straps and reattac them to them to the new console (no drilling, screwing, etc)  I highly recommend!

title: Horrible
text: Headset wouldn't turn on

title: Nice, sleek design
text: I really like this case. I am a 29-year-old, female gamer. I don't care for the cases that have cartoons and characters on them. This case protects my Switch while not looking like a 12-year-old boy's case. It fits the whole system and up to 5 games. It's not a heavy-duty case, but will protect it from scratching up against other items in my bag. I would not recommend this case for a child or someone who needs the additional protection. For me, this keeps the system from being scratched up while keeping all the parts together.

title: I LIKED IT BUT.......
text: I just got my eclipse II one month ago and the letters are wearing off.  So far the E, A, N,S, U ARE WORN.  When the letters wear off it is clear , so  the black is wearing off.  I thought they were lazer etched from underneath?  Well this is horrible cause the light shines up through and you can not see the letter.  I am the only one who uses the keyboard and do not abuse or over use it.  strange, because it seems well built otherwise.  The leg keeps falling off too. Personlly I would like the light to be stronger on high, but others may not care.

title: Waste of money
text: Got it on March 8th, last week the right stick started drifting. Return window ended on the 9th, so I'm out 79.99 on a controller. Never had this issue before and never ever had an issue with a remote after less than 2 months. Completely bummed. Amazon is usually really good with returns, but it is a 3rd party seller. Just goes to show that often the quality of 3rd party seller items is sub par.

title: My first Karaoke game - Disapointed
text: I asked "Santa" for this for Christmas. I'm sorry to say I'm very disappointed.  I receive this version for the Wii game. For the price for this product I'm shocked that song selection is sad. ON the Wii version of this, there is no way to upload new songs, which means there is no way to improve the song choices...EVER! The graphics are cool, venues and clothes choices and fun and entertaining, but I would have been happier with more song choices and a crappier Mii. I'm thinking about looking for another Karaoke program to console myself.

title: Game is a waste of time. Trash Game
text: i dont really writing negative reviews or any reviews in general. But after playing this game for several hours, i feel obligated to let would be buyers to do your own research before buying. Im a fan of previous fall out games but this one is a a big dissapointment. I would say the worst fallout game. First, the game has lots of bugs and glitches. second, its very hard to play the game solo as it really encourages cooperative play. And the world is very bland. Looks like bethesda is just in for money grabs. If i can make zero star I would and even the game is free you still lose because the actual game really is a waste of time. Fallout 76 falls miles and miles below the great games this year such as god of war, detroit, spiderman and tomb raider. Bethesda developers need to step up your game

title: Listen to these babys!
text: This headset is amazing. The price is affordable, and I got it in 2 days with my prime membership. There is an easy plug in with adapters(great for any set up) volume controls great quality sound. I really liked that i couldnt accidentally bump the buttons. Mouth piece was crystal clear. Nothing distorted or fuzzy. Soft on my ears and  my head so I can play for a while.  There are even 4 colors to choose. This is a nice gift for any gamer. I would recommend  this for any game.

title: Would you kindly purchase this collection?
text: BioShock: Infinite is my favorite game of all time. That being said, I also loved the original BioShock (I never finished BioShock 2, so I can't say how I feel about that one). Unfortunately I had these games on my old PS3 and XBox360 respectively. To have them all on one system (PS4) and remastered in 1080p, especially with the Prime discount, there was no way I could pass this up. I decided to go ahead and play through the games in order and I am certainly not disappointed so far. Even though I did play BioShock through to completion, there's a lot I've forgotten about the story. It's so well done and beautiful. I'm so glad this was released and I recommend it to everyone. The storyline on these games is fantastic.

title: My kids love these!
text: We have these for a few weeks now and my girls love these for their school laptops and no problem with the plugs, very sturdy and the cord length is great. Of course they love the color changes!!

title: As a 43-year old woman, I'm not too proud to admit that I still have my old Gameboy Advance SP.
text: I'm not too proud to admit that I still have my old Gameboy Advance SP along with a few games for it. After returning to the US after living overseas for a while, I pulled my boxes out of storage and found my Gameboy amongst other items I'd long since forgotten about. To my surprise, when I flipped the switch, it actually powered on which I find amazing because the game had been in storage for at least three years. What I wasn't able to find, however, was a charging cable for it. I ordered this charger cable with relatively low expectations and was pleased to see that it came with a headphone adaptor so that anyone in close proximity isn't subjected to my Mario Brothers escapades. My package arrived sooner than I'd expected and everything works perfectly.

title: One Star

title: Love this mouse
text: I read the reviews on this and I was hesitant to get it because a lot of them said they didn't get the mouse from the picture.  The one I received was exactly like the picture.  The lights on it change color every few seconds and there are a lot more colors then the picture shows.  The mouse is so comfortable to use my hand fits perfectly on it, and I don't get the hand cramps I did with my old mouse.  This was a great deal.  I would suggest it to anyone.  My only issue was the packaging, it came in a envelop wrapped in a thin layer of bubble wrap,  I was afraid it may have been damaged, but no it works great.  Oh and I love the cord... it looks and feels like a really thin rope, so it doesn't bunch like the normal black cords do.  I love it.

title: Couldn't get it to work!
text: If I could give this product zero stars I would.  I got this for my son for his birthday.  "Best birthday present EVER!" he said after opening it.  Then...it didn't work.  We tried to "calibrate the board" for about 45 minutes...still not working.  Got online and saw that it is a huge problem with the board.  I am not willing to move all of my furniture (as others have) just to get the game to work (and many times that doesn't work either!).  I will be returning it and will never buy another Tony Hawk product.  My son is really bummed, he never even got a chance to play the game.  I have told all of my friends that bought this for Christmas - return it now before your kid goes through what mine did!!!

title: Majesty, a Fantastic  Game
text: This is an amazing game. You are the king of Ardania and you must set your land right. You have the power to destroy your enemies or let them destroy you. There are many quests in which you have to accomplish goals. The  object of the game is to complete all of the quests. You can build a major  economy or relax as your heroes wipe out your enemies and die. You can  choose to have one of three types of no-human races in your kingdom. They  are the Dwarves, Elves and Gnomes. Each of them have their own abilities  and weaknesses. You control a palace and anything that you make to go with  it. You can't control your heroes. They fight whoever they want but you can  persuade them to fight who you want with bounties. You can make different  temples too. Certain temples have religous problems with others so you can  only make three at a time. If you choose the Barbarian temple you will omly  be able to have one temple. Each temple has their own spells they can cast  if in range. Besides beefing up your kingdom you can beautify it too. You  can create Royal Gardens, Statues and some buildings that appear are  Gazebos and Fountains. In addition to the area around your palace you can  build far away too. You can create Inns and Trading Posts far away which  gain money for your kingdom. Inns are also helpful because they give your  heros a place to rest. Also, inside the kingdom you can create blacksmiths  to upgrade your heroes' armor. Overall this is a fabulous game and you  should buy it.

title: I have a shotty internet connection
text: I loved the original SimCity game.  I played it for hours on end.  The graphics in this new game are great.  Now if only I could play the game at my house.  But unfortunately, I have a really shotty internet connection at home.  Maybe one day EA will create a version of this game that I can play.

title: we revived the PS 2.

title: No problems with skins.
text: You guys need to understand that the adhesive coating damage from the joy-cons are from a third-party seller with no idea what kind of material Nintendo used for their console. I have tested this with my console. After a few hours, I took out the skins from the joy-cons and left no coating damage whatsoever. It does take a bit pressure in getting the skins out since there left on the joy-cons after a while, but again... it didn't ruin the joy-cons. Only thing you'll see is some dust. Just wipe it down. PDPgaming is known for their strong relationship with Nintendo and tested out the skins for Nintendo's approval. If you look at their twitter or facebook accounts, they have acknowledged it. Now... as for the skins, it is beautifully done and am enjoying the detail of my customized console. As long as you buy the skins from PDPgaming and not from a third-party, then there will be no problems at all.

title: Beware!  Cannot transfer VC and WiiWare games!
text: Nintendo's policy is that they WILL NOT transfer games from one system to another.  If you are buying this to replace an older model just know that you will NOT be able to transfer your downloaded content (Virtual Console, WiiWare games) to this system.  You will have to start all over and pay for the same content you've already bought for a second time.

title: AMAZING CONTROLLER REPLACEMENT
text: This is an amazing controller replacement if you don't want to spend the hefty price for a brand new controller. This controller is wired but it also works flawlessly. The response is speedy fast and I can play different games on my ps4 flawlessly. The only thing about this controller is the touchpad. I don't expect much from the touchpad since the price is already fairly cheap. You just need to press a little harder than a regular dpad from the original ps4 controller. Amazing controller and I will definitely be using this more often even during fast-paced game play.

title: Great Entertainment Value
text: This game is so much better than Brain Age, which I got tired of within the first couple of weeks.  This game continues to keep me entertained with a great number and variety of games, as well as the ability to keep unlocking new ones to add to the  mix.  I also like the different categories of Stress Testing vs. Brain Testing, it just doubles the amount of games that there are to play.  This game is really fun, I have a hard time putting it down!

title: Give it a week. Disable the sniper button at first.
text: So I loved the Logitech G9. When it died I went with a wireless G602. The 602 was okay but not the greatest for my grip. I guess I'm a claw grip to finger grip type mouse user. So I looked up what was the best, the M65 seemed to be that mouse. I get it and hook it up and instantly hated the shit out of this thing. Why would they put this stupid button on the side. Eh God why. I go into the software which makes very little sense and disable the button, setup my colors and adjusted my DPIs. The first day playing with this thing I was pretty sure I was sending it back, the button screwed up everything. But I kept on, it was 40 bucks...I'll give it a few days. By the second day I got use to putting my thumb between the sniper button and the thumb buttons. Then by the third day I was completely use to the mouse and rarely smacked the sniper button. So now I've had it 2 weeks and turned the sniper button back on. It's really useful to be honest. My big problem with the G602 was I would hit the thumb buttons on accident all the time. This one I rarely do, if ever. And I have the DPI on the sniper button to be just slightly lower anyway, plus it's push to use, not toggle. My only complaint is that the middle mouse button is a bit heavy to hold down. I play Siege and when using someone who requires a constant press for the ability it can get heavy, but I guess I could re-assign it. Besides that I love the mouse.

title: Beware of major technical problem with Wii U
text: My review is based on the fact I have not been able to play the game due to a faulty console.  I purchased a Wii U for my kids and gave it to them as an early Christmas present.  Took it out, spent a lot of time setting up, took down the old Wii, just to have it not work.  Tried 2 brand new Wii U games, Super Mario and Madden.  Kept getting invalid disk error.  I googled the problem to see if others were experiencing the same problem so I could figure out what i did wrong in set up. What I found is a LONG thread of people of experienced the same problem and that it is problem with the console - many of the consoles being sold by Nintendo have a bad optical reader and Nintendo's solution is to have you package it up and send it back for repair.  I am shocked that Nintendo would continue to put units out for sale KNOWING this is a common problem with the unit.  God forbid they cut down their inventory during the Christmas season and hurt sales.  Better to have a lot of frustrated parents and disappointed kids.  Shame on you Nintendo!

title: Perfect addition to our Wii

title: Horrible game - don't buy.
text: Bought this on a whim, big mistake.  The game play is extremely limited, and made me feel like I was playing a game out of the 90's.  You really can only go one way through the game, so if you just keep clicking you'll make it through.  But the reasons I'm writing the review and returning the game are two-fold... The text comes out of order - characters refer to other characters that you've supposedly already met when you haven't, and, the entire game finally crashed on me.  It got into a loop while questioning a character and it would keep cycling and finally locking up.  Definitely a bad experience all around.

Only complaint is that I am currently on my sixth in game year and it's starting to get a little monotonous after having collected all the artifacts, married several the in villages, conquered the mines, popped out 2 kids, made millions off of melons and have barns full of  fat and happy animals. That being said, each one of these things was an amazing challenge I prided myself in completing.

title: Drool... So good, buy quickly
text: I have waited for this game for years. Although Red and Blue were the same in most aspects and Yellow was just a minor upgrade, Gold and Silver are in  a whole new level of Pokemon. With the internal clock that tells the real  time and date means that you just might have to drop some activites on  Tuesday to make it in time for the tornament (Yes, in the game) You may now  have to balance out your life between Pokemon and real life bothersome  activities (Like eating,sleeping, breathing and buying batteries) The 251  pokemon give me the same feeling of wonder when I was first playing  Blue.(Wow! What's this, a sandshrew. Oh cool, a new town) The new types of  pokemon include steel and dark pokemon (Yes rejoice all you evil  Mewtwo-Gyrados loving fans)To ease the pain of waiting that you have  endured, here's some thing's to do while you are waiting: 1. Make the  decision between Gold or Silver 2. Choose if you want Totodile, Chorita, or  Cynaquil 3. Map out which pokemon you think you should trade to Gold (I  wonder if what that trader with the electrode on Cinnabar Island said will  make any sense... 4. Choose your 2nd in Command pokemon (not your starting  pokemon) 5. Select breeding pairs of pokemon  6. Take big deep breaths

title: Amazing
text: Hands down the most realistic boxing game ever made. The online play is smooth and not laggy like Fight Night Round 4. The campaign mode is brilliant and the amount of great boxers that they have is impressive. I have been a fan of Fight Night since it was known as knockout kings and this is the best boxing game I ever played. I highly recommend it.

title: It's a flying sim - not a game
text: If you run out and get this program thinking your getting a game your wrong. This is a flight Simulator and that is what you get. If your a pilot or an aspiring pilot and want to get some practice flying or try out what it takes to fly an aircraft this is a good way to find out. I've run this program on my PIII 1.1 GHZ WIN-XP laptop with 512 MB ram and 32 MB graphics card as well as a Celeron 1.2 GHz 256 MB ram and integrated 11 MB graphics and it has performed well on both systems. Have even flown between the two systems over my home lan with great ease. This program is much better with a flight stick and is rather difficult to attempt with a keyboard. I use a MS Sidewinder force feedback 2 stick and it works great. Program is a hard drive hog on full install though using up 1.7 Gig per system. Thankfully Microsoft does not make you have a CD in the computer to run the program so you don't need to have the software handy after install. Overall I think it's the best SIM out there. If your looking for a game look at Combat Flight Simulator 2 or some other shoot-em up game.

title: Horrible DRM scheme

title: RE7 is a must buy!
text: This game is amazing. Not like any other Resident Evil, yet it goes back to their roots at the same time. It's different but in a good way, not different in a bad way like 5 and 6. I've already ran through the campaign 10 times and love it every time. I play on xbox so I'll have to wait another week or so for the DLC, which is already out on PS4. But for anyone on the fence about buying RE7 I highly recommend you give it a chance. I think Resident Evil fans will be pleasantly surprised. This game is exactly what this franchise needed. I usually hate sequels but if they keep this up with RE8 I would be just fine with that.

title: Do not buy if your are planning game only in portable mode

title: The other reviews with images lack a brain or basic reading knowledge.
text: I'm going to say this with peer honesty. This fits perfect. The other reviews just didn't read the description. My headset with elite strap fits perfectly. It has room to fit an external battery inside, and a little bag to store my money in. Most the images you see are after market straps which are quite bulky. If you get an official elite strap it will fit in this bag. Only questionable thing is. Why a micro USB female input? The headset is usb c. That's about it. That can honestly be ignored and not be a big deal at all.

title: Cool vertical stand for PS4!
text: I love this vertical stand and the fact that it not only holds the PS4 in a vertical position very securely, but it will also charge two controllers, and has a fan to keep the PS4 from overheating.  I didn't have a problem with that to begin with, but I like having the extra fans just in case that ever does become an issue.  The stand is made well and looks cool!  I like the blue lights that come on when the whole system is powered up.  My only issue is that I can't see the lights from the controller when they're plugged in confirming that they are charging, but I know that they are charged because the battery indicator when I use them shows to be fully charged.  All in all a cool stand, and a good price.  I would recommend.

title: I use this every day!
text: I love this mouse so much. I was a little nervous when a lot of reviews said it was crap but for me, it has been amazing! The battery lasts probably almost a week and the silent click is so awesome that I now have problems using them because of how loud they seem in comparison. The wireless is so undescribably convenient! There are two buttons on the side and I have no idea what the front one does but the back one is auto run in World of Warcraft. There is also a weird button on the top behind the scroll that is a bit hard to push. No idea what that is. But for me, this mouse has been really awesome. Just some tips, sometimes one of the clicks gets stuck up, just (carefully, mind you) push it back down. Also, at first I thought the plug-in piece was missing but just look in the bottom at that kind of bar thing near the palm of the hand.

title: A must have
text: The hype behind this game is well worth it.  This is a must have collection for any basketball fan.  The graphic in the game is outstanding and the AI and game play is unbelievable.  The players grunt when they take a difficult shot or take a charge.  You have to be careful with your passes because the computer is playing for real and picking off lazy passes.  Yes, they hyped the game with the return of Jordan, but it is not only Jordan that is in the game.  Malone, Stockton, Pipen, Rodman etc. are all in the game.  There are players in the game that we all forgot i.e. Bill Wellington with the Bulls.  The commentators does a great job with the play-by-play calling and it is bring back memories listening to them talk during the game about when Jordan had the flu.  They got all the drama surrounding that correct.  I did find a bug in the game.  Near the end of the game while, shooting free throws my coach Phil Jackson walked on the floor and stood in the lane. It does take time getting use to play of the game because the defense is much tougher as in previous games.  The Jordan challenges is not easy.

title: Eh
text: Doesn't beat skyrim

title: Solitary Wargamer's Delight
text: Not so long ago, hex-based wargamers faced daunting challenges including set-up time, playing space and quality opponents.  These challenges forced most of us as adults to shelve our passion, content with the memories of high school and college "gamer clubs."  Fortunately, thanks to the dedication of tireless developers, we can now trade our cardboard counters for the lure of a glowing screen.  Korsun Pocket takes full advantage of today's robust software and architecture to create a hobbyist's dream: a robust, on demand, historically accurate gaming experience.  If you have a wargaming background, Korsun Pocket's intuitive gameplay allows you to learn as you go.  As you improve, the game offers a full range of options to help adjust for historical odds, player ability and "what if" scenarios.  Korsun Pocket includes a campaign game; a handful of shorter, related scenarios and a bonus campaign centering on Hitler's desperate campaign in the Ardennes.  Whether you choose to play as the Axis, Russians or Americans, this delightful PC wargame presents an elegant gift to the faithful among us.

title: Great game, but new players may need extra help
text: I am really enjoying Disgaea 1. I am new to the series and I was worried I was not going to like the combat. However, I found that it was fast and enjoyable. If you are not new to JRPG but, new to the Disgaea like I am I think you will enjoy it. But, if you never played a JRPG but, you are still interested in Disgaea 1 I recommend finding a good walkthrough online, to help you navigate the different systems in the game because it can be a little overwhelming. But, if you are willing to learn and okay with the grinding in JRPGs, and a story and characters that don't take themselves too seriously then Disgaea 1 could be the game for you.

title: The best Vita
text: I wanted this Vita because I don't like the plain black ones America has. This Japanese import DOES play American games and the color is beautiful. You can change the language and set up the content manager very easily. I like how light-weight this second gen Vita is after using it for awhile and the feel of the rounded buttons is very nice. I love this Vita and I plan on playing it very often.

title: Best case hands down for switch games!
text: This case is seriously amazing!  So glad that I bought it, the only down side is that it is one sided. Wish there was an option to purchase with the inserts on both sides. Either way WELL worth my money!!!  I ended up ordering 2, one for home and one for the road. Best and easiest decision I ever made. It is about the size of a comic book (bigger than the switch game boxes and a hard DVD case). Must have for any gamer saving on space while protecting your games!

title: Many of the games on here are awesome, I would recommend starting with Banjo Kazooie
text: Many of the games on here are awesome, I would recommend starting with Banjo Kazooie, Banjo Tooie, and Conker's Bad Fur Day. This collection is worth it for those games alone, not to mention the 27 many of which are also fantastic. Also if you're in the mood to throw a controller at a wall I would strongly recommend Battletoads.

title: Sometime cheap is good but, not in this case!
text: Super cheap so I thought I'd give them a try. They looked ok and that was about all they had going for them. Sound quality was terrible no matter what adjustments I made, according to gaming buddies the mic sounded muffled and they had to turn me up to max in teamspeak to even hear me at all, the ear covers were plastic and didn't breathe., so after about 20 minutes my ears were sweating and behind my ears started getting irritated. I didn't even bother to put them away in case i should need a backup, I just threw them out.

title: Not as fun as I expected....
text: After reading all the other reviews, I expected a great game.  I have to admit, the last Sonic game I played was the Genesis one.  Maybe the franchise has gone other places, but I personally just didn't like playing this game.  Specifically, my biggest problem was not being able to see the levels very well.  The colors are very muted and often have little contrast.  One of the things I love about most other DS games (the new Super Mario Brothers, for example) is how vibrant and easy on the eyes the levels are.  With this game, Sonic (or Blaze), along with the path you are running on, seems to blend into the background.  That might be fine for some games, but when a game's emphasis is on speed and rapidly moving through the levels, there needs to be better visual cues.  Just my 2 cents.

title: An Collector's Edition Worthy of An Saiyan!
text: Amazing game and Collector's Edition! First off it does NOT come with the season pass! It was pointed out in the comments it does not include the season pass, it NEVER said it included the season pass in the item description section. But I feel the need to inform folks it doesn't include it. You can purchase the season pass separately at your local video game store (like I did). Anyway, the game Dragonball Xenoverse 2 is amazing! It's the best DBZ game to date! The combos are wild and brutal! The controls are excellent and responsive. The graphics are improved! I'm loving everything about the game! The steelbook is made up of high quality metal. I haven't gotten around to listening to the soundtrack yet, or the guide it comes with. Last but not least the amazing Super Saiyan Goku figure! It's over 13 inches tall and made with high quality material! The attention to detail is flawless! This figure is an must have for DBZ collectors! It's an all around nice purchase!

title: Right click doesn't hold. Keeps double clicking
text: Purchased this mouse on July 2nd and as of the day of this review the mouse went from being a 5 to a 1. I really expected so much more out of Logitech and incredibly upset that in less then a month the mouse is already giving me issues. I purchased this mouse to replace my old razer deathadder which lasted me for approximately 3 years. I figured since I already owned the G402 that it would make sense to upgrade to a G502 and give it a shot with the weights feature. The weights were pretty nice and helped in a way, but what makes me give this mouse a 1 rating is the right click problem that so many people complained about. So when I play Overwatch I play A LOT of widow and recently the right click would always double click as I'm sitting there scoped in. It happened so frequently that I can't even play the game properly. So if you're looking for a game that you need to scope STAY AWAY. The double clicking is truly a problem and I decided to risk purchasing this mouse even after seeing so many complain about it in the reviews. So again, if you need to hold your clicks, keep searching for another mouse.  Shame on you Logitech :(

title: Tracking is crap.  Game is good.
text: The calibration is pathetic for Nintendo in 2019.  It's far too frustrating to use.  The content in the game is great, but it's an exercise in patience more than a physical workout.  You can reset position and try different controllers all day, but it still doesn't know which way is up for more than a few moments.  There's no gyro calibration in the menu despite Nintendo's help documentation.

title: Amazingly fun
text: I remember back in the day when a little game called "Stunts" occupied hours of me and my friends' time.  This game captures all the pure fun of that game and adds an slick, modern-day presentation on top of it (graphics are wonderful).  The driving model is absolutely perfect for this type of game.  You can steer, brake, and even accelerate while airborne, which makes executing precision jumps a sight to behold (and a joy to perform).  In a day were most of the fifty dollar games I buy end up gathering dust before I feel I've obtained half of what I invested, it is a great joy to pickup a value priced game like TrackMania that just keeps me coming back for more.  This is the ultimate game to have on your computer when you simply don't feel like investing hours on your favorite MMO, or the precision required to play Gran Turismo.  Download the demo, and then I'll see you back here when you are posting how much fun this game is :)

title: Almost like the Real Thing!!!
text: I had a Mad Catz Wheel with my PS1 and only a child would have thought it was like driving a real car. BUT with PS2 it's a whole differnt story. Just plug in the electrical cord for the Logitech Force Feedback Wheel (YES, it's electrified) connect it to your PS2 and get ready for the closest thing to a real car without leaving your couch. This wheel doesn't just SHAKE it actually RESPONDS to the imaginary road and many a time you will have to fight the wheel and the laws of inertia to maintain control of your car, especially at high speeds (talk about realistic). On Rallye courses you can feel the gravel beneath the tyres and the slight jolt of a wheel bounce. Super Speedways have a tendency to pull your car to the outside (due to your high speed) and you'll be fightin' the wheel alot. With F1 2000 you can calibrate the Wheel for precise handling of the G.P. Circuits (you'll feel like Michael Schumacher winding your way around the course). I liked this wheel so much I bought a 2nd one!

title: Glad to have it, but you MAY want to wait.
text: As someone who likes to have the "New Shiny" as early as possible, I was very pleased that my PS5 arrived on release day! I have had a blast with it so far! Demon's Souls is a brilliant launch title, recapturing and improving upon the 2009 PS3 title. Miles Morales continues the magic from 2018's Spider-Man, in a shorter, but more focused campaign. But shockingly, the bundled-in Astro's Playroom is probably the most fun I have had with my new console! It oozes fun and charm and is simultaneously a love letter to all thing Playstation and also a thorough showcase of what the DualSense controller is capable of! For me, this purchase hit all the right notes, but I could definitely say that a large portion of gamers can probably wait to get one until there are a few more exlusives!

title: The Greatest RE Of Them All!!!!!!!!!!!
text: What can I say this is without question the greatest RE in the series!!!!! The graphics, gameplay, everything is right on "Q" for what a PS2 game should be. I will be honest and say that the Gamecube version is graphically superior to the PS2 version but who the hell cares?!!!!! The only thing that really truly matters is the fact that this gem has finally been released to the PS2. Those of us who hung tight with sony and didn't jump ship just for this game after it was announced for the GC can finally rejoice in the glory that is the first definitive sequel since the Code Veronica release almost seven years ago. a rather lenghty dry spell from capcom. Not with standing the disaster that was OutBreak. The weapons are awesome in this game with very nice updates to the sniper rifle, mine thrower, and rocket launcher. The game is in a way a slight turn by capcom in terms of there are'nt as many puzzles to solve. Which is something this franchise has always had a considerable emphasis on. This is just pure adrenaline, Lay the smackdown on their candy asses jaw dropping fun!!!! I in a way kind of felt by my first impression that this was kind of castlevanyia meets RE in a way. You know being in that dark far away land surrounded by hostile locals. The only thing I really have to gripe about is the loss of the auto aim feature. But other than that this game is flawless for a PS2 RE game. Replay value is awesome consiering that there is an exclusive side adventure only available to the PS2. In addition to the Assignment ada minigame there is a lenghtier mini game called Separate ways where you get to cover more or less the same ground as leon, but through ada's perspective. You also have the option of starting a new game after you clear it the first time, and when you replay you can start the new game with everything you had in the end of the last game. Bottom line is if you already played this for the gamecube then you ain't missing a whole lot.  The premium edition is definitley a must have for the die hard RE fan.  For only 10 dollars more you get a limited edition laser cell artwork of Ada Wong Limited to only 60,000, and each has a certificate of authenticity and is individually serialized.  You also get a exclusive prologue booklet that kind of chronicles the stories and gives a little synopsys of each RE going back to the first one that kind of adds to the story a little, and finally you get a making of RE 4 DVD with the package as well.  Bottom line is: if you are a die hard PS2 fan that hasn't had the opportunity to play this game until just now all I can say is get it get it get it get it NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You will not be disapointed!

title: Game review
text: This game is just about as fun as the original Pokemon Stadium.  It has the four cups: Pika, Petit, Poke, and Prime from the first Pokemon Stadium as well as four new ones.  The cups each contain a variety of Pokemon trainers you have to defeat.  You can upload your own Pokemon from Red, Blue, Yellow, Gold, or Silver and pit them against the other trainers in the Stadium Cups Mode.  Some cups have one full tournament of eight trainers total.  Each time you beat a trainer, you get a badge.  The badges don't pertain to their Gym type though.  Other cups have four Ball tournaments: Poke Ball, Great Ball, Ultra Ball, and Master Ball.  Each Ball tournament has eight trainers making the total number of trainers in that Cup 32 trainers.  This mode is single player.  There is also a mode called Gym Leader Castle where you can face the Gym Leaders from the Game Boy games.  You first face the eight Johto Gym Leaders from Gold and Silver. Then you face the Elite Four and Lance.  Then you move on to facing the eight Kanto trainers from Gold and Silver.  The Kanto Gym Leaders are the leaders featured in Pokemon Red, Blue, and Yellow but in GS, they are stronger trainers.  After that, you move on to facing the strongest trainer from Gold and Silver: Red who was Ash and the player you controlled in the Red, Blue, and Yellow versions.  This mode is also single player.  Don't have Pokemon from your Game Boy game?  Pokemon Stadium 2 has Pokemon that you can rent and a whole lot more stuff.  Have fun!

title: Who Knew That Oblivion Could be Fun
text: This game is amazing. It delivers on all levels for me and is a leap ahead from Morrowind. I could go into detail about the graphics or A.I. but by now most of us have seen videos exemplifying these things, the real beauty in Oblivion comes with behind the scenes improvements. The biggest of these for me is real time physics. Now when I crush somebody sideways with my mace they lift off the ground and follow the arc of my blow, and proceed to land in the appropriate way a real body would. Any item that is equipped in their hand does not drop with the body and becomes its own item following the force of the blow as well but on its own. The first time I hurled a fireball past its intended target it slammed into a table cluttered with stuff and everything flew. As for the problems alluded to by others about button mapping issues there are plenty of hotkeys and quick menu buttons so it is really a non-issue. Also I want to say that I love the collector's edition if for nothing more than the pocket guide to the empire. However I love flavor text and was one of those guys who spent more time reading his magic cards than playing with them. All in all great game by my count and I would encourage others to give it a try.

title: good

He said it felt really good. the grips worked and it worked with his pc. overall this is a good controller to get for a present or just to use. I would recommend this product.

title: Republics? Oh yeah!!!
text: I bought Republics DLC, and I love it!!!! As a very rich republic of Italian wiseguys, I made a nice indent into history. By attacking local rulers, I was able to establish trading ports in many regions, competed with rival Republics for the almighty dollar, and whacked a few cousins to get some money from them. I really love this expansion!! While it isn't a completely new game, the neat money focused experiance is pretty cool. You have to finance a family business, so you gotta be rolling in dough to compete with the other Doges. If you are to buy any expansion and expect a different focal point, get this expansion. It doesn't open half the world up to you like the Sword of Islam did, but it's a good deal. Bottom line, it's a great buy and will keep you occupied for a while. Original game required to play. Steam required as well. If you didn't enjoy the original game, you'll most likely not be throwing a party over this, but for everyone else, go for it!!

title: Not a true couch co-op game

All the 2nd player can do is control a corset that can collect things and stun enemies but even that functionality does not work very well.  Controls are extremely sensitive for 2nd player and anytime the camera moves they have to try and compensate but that doesn't work well.  Very disappointing!!

title: Fun game with tonsa new innovations
text: This game, to put it bluntly, is a combination of Mario, Animal Crossing, and a coloring book.  This is the coloring book part.  It is really fun because you get to draw your own hero and a lot of times in your adventure draw like a cloud to get across a gap.  you get to draw with pixel-by-pixel drawing if you want and if you do you can just use a template or make your own which is quite hard in the scope of things.  This is wher the Mario part comes in.  You have to go in to 4 separate gates which represent 4 different realms.  You go through side scrolling adventures which are excruciatingly long.  You run, jump and ground pound just like in mario.  Fun sidecrolling with boss battles at the end of every realm. This is the animal crossing part.  You also can monitor the population of your town.  You have to draw certain things like a nice sign for a restaurant and the town crop.  Every time you complete a level you will have rescued 3 people, which will get added to your population.  Overall this is one AWESOME game.  I recommend it to anyone that likes mario and stuff like that.

text: Dont Buy! For some reason I'm having to write another review because the original one I posted seemed to some how dissapeare. The microSD simply did not work. I continously got an error telling me to restart my switch and reinsert the SD card but it didn't work. I then used a a different microSD card I had laying around which worked perfectly with my switch. When I instered this microSD into my computer it wouldn't even detect it! The most frustrating part was the 10-15 minutes speaking to a SanDisk representative. After using the technical support rep with amazon, they were able to patch me through to a tech with SanDisk. After going over a some trouble shooting steals the rep determined the microSD card was defective. She asked for my email and number so she could email me instructions on how to send this one back and get a new replacement. I know got an email or any further instructions on how to replace the defective product I got from SanDisk. Ultimately I decided it was not worth the hassle and returned the item to Amazon for a full refund.

title: PEACE AND QUIET AT LAST!
text: Our son would walk around the house playing his Nintendo Switch all the time with the volume all the way up and when you have to work from home it drives you insane.  I finally decided to find a bluetooth adapter that he could attach to his Switch and use his headphone.  I am so happy, my wife is so happy, even the dog is wagging his tail again.  I tested the product and did not find any lag on the sound.  I can go pretty far and still have connection.  After about an hour of playing with it I did not find any interruptions with this adapter.  It works great.  I would greatly recommend this bluetooth adapter.  I tested it with the USB adapter it came with on my grandmothers pc and it works great as well.

title: No class system. COD controls. No voip. Sucks
text: If you are expecting a good BF experience in this title, you won't get it. No traditional classes, meaning everyone has any item they want. So everyone uses medic items, but don't bother healing you. Some games you have 50 snipers on your team. No voip is dumb. Sliding around like call of duty just adds to the feeling of not being battlefield. I tried for 100 hours. This game sucks. Get a copy of battlefield 4. It is really cheap and is a lot better experience.

title: Warning: Does not work with new system update

This will be completely useless then, and even worse, any save data or profiles copied to it will be totally inaccessible.  Microsoft's memory prices for the 360 are completely ludicrous, but unfortunately, now there's no other option.

title: Take it from me, this keyboard is a winner
text: This keyboard is the most amazing thing you have ever used.  I have used mechanical keyboards continuously since the 80s for my software engineering.  Even when the mechanical keyboard was no longer in style, there was only one keyboard company making a mechanical keyboard in the USA during the 90s and 2000's.  That keyboard is the Avant Stellar, a clone of the original Northgate keyboard, a design that IBM used.  Yes, I have used mechanical keyboards more than just about anyone on the planet.  That said, the Corsair keyboards are my current go-to choice for most things.  I own many of them.  however, this keyboard from HAVIT is probably the best mechanical keyboard I have felt since the Northgate.  It is absolutely wonderful and makes me consider switching from the Corsair.  You can't go wrong with this one.

title: Easy to use program that offers a lot of features ...
text: Easy to use program that offers a lot of features to help make your writing project organized and enjoyable.  I like it most because it can house many aspects of your writing project such as miscellaneous notes, character information, outlining, pictures, etc.  In addition, it offers formats to assist in structuring a story or building a character profile. I am very pleased with WriteWay...it works for me.

title: It plays the games
text: This renewed game unit plays all my games like a new one would. The video output is sharp and the game play is steady. I recommend this game unit for anyone who is a PS2 fan.

title: Fun but obviously released broken
text: Bethesda released what is arguably the funnest piece of broken and unplayable game software in recent memory. Do yourself a favor and purchase this for PC or XBOX is you have those options available. Sure, they may fix it but for those that do not connect online to the Playstation network this game will become completely unplayable due to a very big bug. The problem is that as you play and solve quests your save file grows in size until the PS3's memory cache can no longer keep up. The framerate will then slow down the the speed of a high tech flip book. Bethesda should have known better but released it anyway. What a shameful cash in.

title: This is Bad

title: Almost like the original 360 controller
text: Everything about this controller is great. It's very tight and crisp and even has very sensitive movement through the joysticks (unlike other cheap copies that are either on or off). The joysticks are even shielded with a cover when shipped to prevent potential damage to the calibration. Only complaint about it is you can only turn the Xbox off with this controller. It has to be turned on by pressing the main power button on the console. No biggie

title: More like a dream than a game
text: Beautiful graphics, evocative period music, hidden items that are at least plausible for the time period and sometimes part of the story, strong voice acting and narrative straight from the book--all these add up to an emotional adventure, more like dreaming the book than playing a game. For me, it was a more visceral experience than watching a movie. If you love reading The Great Gatsby, I think you will like this. If you want mysteries, adventure, challenging puzzles and won't be happy with anything else, don't buy it.

title: Overall review of the keyboard. 4.3
text: Overall I would say that the keyboard is a solid 4.3 stars out of 5. The multimedia buttons are really helpful especially when I'm trying to pause my music in the middle of a game. The keyboard lights are really nice and I love the multiple different options (my favorite is the flowing rainbow one). The keys are well spaced out and that's perfect for me because I used to fat finger a lot. The last compliment for the good the good things the hand rest is really comfortable and lets me play for multiple hours perfectly fine. One thing that I didn't like about the keyboard was that the C and V keys are hard to click and since C is my crouch button and V is my voice chat button it makes some scenarios difficult. The last bad thing was that the keys were kind of annoying at first, but I have gotten used to it and I am starting to like it. It's just that the people around me find it annoying.

title: Excellent quality sound
text: The sound is very good and high quality. It cancels out minor background noise very well, although you can still partially hear people close to you. I enjoy that I can take off the cat ears whenever I want. Makes going out in public with them on a lot less embarrassing. The two plugins for audio and microphone work very well with my computer, although you have the option for Bluetooth AND single plugin for something like an older phone's headphone port. The headphones are cushioned and very comfortable. My only concern is the quality of the microphone. You can hear buzzing in the background and it took a good hour of testing and changing around the input on my computer to minimize the buzzing. I can not get rid of the Bluetooth microphones buzzing sadly.

title: Please Read- NOT HOT SWAP
text: First, this is a great keyboard. I really liked it. I got it as a beginner to mechanical keyboards. I'm giving 1 star because when I went to hot swap the switches I broke one. After opening the board I realized that they were soldered on.  Please make sure you know what you're buying. I'm not sure why the description says nothing about the board being soldered, especially as the box specifies that it is hot-swappable. You CAN NOT change the switches on this board.

text: This white controller is, in my opinion, the best controller to have if you play super smash brothers melee for the Nintendo gamecube.  The controller is very durable (will last for a long time through button mashing), stylish, and you can perform all the technical skills such as L-Cancelling and wavedashing with it.  Anyone who is looking to replace their nintendo gamecube controller to play Melee, i strongly recommend getting this one.

title: Bummer.
text: Item was not described correctly. Minor scratches and regular wear was acceptable and described correctly. However in the description it stated the item was tested and working correctly. Upon receiving the item and doing the initial set up, I had to pay to unlock the parental controls since I had no idea what the current password was. After going through all that hassle and unlocking the device I was super disappointed to find out the wireless was not working at all. Cannot connect to any wi-fi. Even had my home wi-fi settings changed to accommodate the devices requirements and nothing. Once the wireless button is turned on 2 seconds later I get an error message. Cannot use any features that require the wireless to be on. I have purchased used games before and this one was definitely a bummer.

title: Great Game!
text: I have always been fascinated with cooking so I thought I'd try one of these games out and I have to say it was a lot of fun. The game has many recipes for you try out and you may even learn how to make them yourself after playing it enough. The game makes perfect use of the Wii's motion controls and the controls function very well for most of the motions with the exception of a few that require you to get a feel for them. The game is also packed with mini-games that are amusing and also has a practice option that allows you to practice any part of a single recipe so if you are having problems with a certain part you can practice them until you get them down perfect. The game only opens a few recipes at first but you will earn more as you complete the ones you have, if you enjoy cooking then you will enjoy this game as it makes it fun and without the mess.

title: A stylish blast right out of the gate
text: I received this game right on the release day and have been having a blast. The art direction is top notch from Platinum Games, as the cyberpunk aesthetic starts off right from the intro sequence. The game is pure eye-candy. The combat is fun, and easy to get the hang of. The astral chain game mechanic is fun, a bit challenge at first, but the game forces you through training that gives it a very low learning curve. Unlike a lot of action, fighting games, this one is forgiving if you want it to be.  The story is getting pretty interesting, there's a good mix of puzzles, fighting, and story.  A very good start to the first few hours of gameplay.

title: One of the unlucky few

I was truly excited to play Assassin's Creed after skipping over the last gen versions. Now I guess I'll either pick up the last gen version or return the PS4 version and pick it up with Xbox One. This sucks.

title: cluncky
text: been playing games for over 35 years, if you cant beat the first mission and have to redo it 25 times (jumping from roof to roof) it's probably best to put it down and let someone else waste their time....hate clunky games and clunky game charachters who run into walls, hang off ledges etc when your just trying to hop straight ahead...a mess of a game....I believe the reviewers of these games on Amazon are paid by the developers...they got to be...this game is garbage.

title: Awesome, but learn the controls
text: The only reason people are giving this game low ratings is because they don't like the controls. It's a new game, the controls are different, they take time getting used to, but you can learn them no problem. Another thing people complain about is the motion controls, but those are pretty much optional. Don't use them if you don't like them. This game is a lot of fun and the controls are smooth once you learn them. It's pretty similar to StarFox64 (it's like a remake with a slightly different story and different stages) but with StarFox Assult mixed in. It's a lot of fun and a bit challenging. It's a shame people are still putting this game down over the graphics. Bad graphics don't make a good game bad, and vise versa, though I think the graphics look nice. I think if this game is given a chance, people could really enjoy it.

title: Shattered Greatness
text: When I first saw a preview of this game I  couldn't wait to get it, after I played it. I'm happy I got it, this game is very satisfying to play this is a good step-up from Web of Shadows which was nice too.  I gotta point out what makes this game good, you're not just 1 or 2 Spideys you get to play as 4, each with their own unique moveset and purpose.  The Spideys are: 2099 Spidey he's from a hopeful future, seems to have a lot of  aerial levels,  then Noir Spidey  a 1930 version of Spidey who's all about stealthy and sneak attacks, then there's Amazing Spidey good old classic self-explanatory and of course the Black Suit Spidey with the awesome speed, strength and agility.  Each one of these Spideys have their own unique world, purpose and bosses they fight to find the shattered pieces of  the Tablet of Order and Chaos hence the name Shattered Dimensions.  A new feature in this I really like is the 1st person fights, when  you get to certain points in a Boss battle you switch to 1st person for a short period, that was a great idea.  Now for my review STORYLINE definitely better than past Spidey games 5Stars, GAMEPLAY 4 unique Spideys to play as 5Stars, BOSSES 4Stars, GRAPHICS 5Stars. Spider-Man: Shattered Dimensions 4STARS

Much better then the older Nintendogs games. It's so cute taking my Shiba Inu pup for a walk and watching him roll around in the grass or chasing birds. It's just a beautiful game to look at. I love that, instend of having 3 different colors, they have (using the shiba for ex.) 3 different black and tans, 3 different reds, and a tanish cream, all with different markings, some pups are even smaller then the others. The only downside is you can only keep 3 pets at home and 3 at the hotel (less then the older Nintendogs games). But other then that, it's a beautiful game with amazing 3D effects, super cute, and very fun.

title: Huge improvement over Classic Creep Capers
text: You always fear a licensed console game these days.  For an example, rent Classic Creep Capers.  If you were over 5 years old, you probably didn't enjoy it all that much.  So I was a bit fearful when renting this one.  Much to my surprise, it was very enjoyable.  There are obvious technical problems to it.  There is marked slowdown throughout when Shaggy or Scooby is running.  The enemies do get to be redundant.  It actually reminds me of a lower quality Crash Bandicoot game.  Still, as far as licensed platformers go, it is fun.  For Scooby fans out there, it's well worth checking out and probably even worth shelling out the 30 clams for.  There is enough to it to have some decent replay value.  If it is for somebody 8-10 years old, I'd bet they love it.

Drive your hover tank through the rocketing explosions of missiles and pulse lasers, then leap out and attack armies of battle droids with your lightsaber as Mace Windu (c'mon, you know you want to be the slickest Jedi ever), then climb into the Assault Gunship and take down Separatist spaceships as they try to take off while dodging laser fire from fighters. title: The best Madden on the DS yet
text: Another year, another Madden game on the DS.  This time around though, Madden NFL 08 ends up being the best installment of the long running series to hit the DS yet, with EA making some vast improvements over previous incarnations of the series.  The first thing you'll notice is that the 3-D player models on the bottom screen of the DS are much improved this time around.  That being said, they still might not be a whole lot to look at, but the game does look better in the graphics department this year overall.  The control scheme has also seen some tweaks, as has the overall gameplay and various play modes as well.  Not to mention that the Wi-Fi capability also ends up being one of the best features of Madden NFL 08, and is every bit as fun as it should be.  What really hurts Madden NFL 08 though ends up being the small amount of glitches that plague the overall game.  These glitches appear in the form of the game's graphics engine as well as the opponent AI (which is also quite forgiving at times, but then again, this is Madden after all) and are quite noticable as well.  Not to mention that the play by play commentary is hardly as prolific as what it could be, so don't expect to hear a whole lot from the man himself while you play.  Negatives aside, Madden NFL 08 ends up being the best Madden game to hit the DS yet, and for football fans that own a DS and are craving a more than solid NFL game (like you have any other choice), then look no further.

title: Great Real Time Strategy game for Xbox owners
text: At first I thought this was a second-rate Warcraft clone, and to a large extent it is, but I have to admit that I am having a ton of fun with this game, drawbacks and all.  Xbox owners are freakin' starving for strategy games and this one delivers.  Warcraft fans should enjoy this game as it is basically a dumbed-down version of that game with a few new quirks and great graphics.  One of the fresh ideas is the titans which you control and can use to stomp down many a foe.  One of these is a giant ogre that can eat enemies (or allies) to regain health as he swings his club in wide arcs, sending bodies flying.  There is also a giant slime that dissolves and absorbs enemy units to increase it's mass and power, a giant boar that launches flaming projectiles and rocks from a catapult on it's back, a lightning elemental, and a giant spiked ball that simply crushes the opposition.  Controlling these guys is superfun, but only a small part of combat.  As the game progreeses, you take over different goblin clans with various abilities and individualized units.  You only get 10 active goblins to a clan at once so choose your units wisely.  Each clan (you usually control 2 or 3 at a time) is assigned a button so you can leave one to defend basecamp, one to search for resources (gold for destruction and souls which are earned through battle or at soul fountains), and one to attack the enemies base along with a titan; or you can send all you've got at the enemies at once, or use any other strategy you can think up.  These features are what make this game original and fun to play even if you've played Warcraft to death.  Sure, the game lacks that game's depth, but it's still a lot of fun and you can't beat the price.  Besides, there isn't much RTS competition on the Xbox besides the also excellent Alien vs. Predator: Extinction.  The only major drawback to the game besides the aforementioned lack of depth is the lengthy cutscenes spoken in goblin language and subtitled.  They are actually quite awesome to look at and the story is cool (if pointless) but they take a ridiculous amount of time because of the subtitles which stay on the screen and hault the conversation so that there is a maddening 5-10 second pause between each line of dialogue, presumably to give you time to read the subtitles.  Apparently they think we all read at a 2nd grade level.  A single-player, customisable skirmish mode would have done wonders for this game, but there is only a multi-player version which I haven't played yet so I can't review that aspect, though I imagine it's sweet.  If you are a RTS fan and an Xbox owner who doesn't play PC games, your prayers are answered (in part) by this game and AVP:Extinction.  There are dozens of better RTS's out there on PC. But if that's not an option than this game is highly recommended.

title: Errors and disconnections within hours...
text: I plugged this into my M1 Mac Mini and transferred some data over.  Started getting errors and disconnections within the first few hours of use.  Returned to Amazon.

title: Lost in translation...
text: Ironically, I had preordered the console version of Call of Duty long before I had played the PC version. Yet with the release date oh so far away, I decided to take advantage of the recent price drop of the Call of Duty PC game hoping that it would tide me over. However, after playing countless hours of the game on my PC, I'd have to say that Call of Duty: Finest Hour is a bit of a disappointment. I understand that a console has nowhere near the processing power of a PC, yet I couldn't help but feel underwhelmed by FH's graphics which were simple and bland at best. However, I was mostly disappointed in the lack of save points throughout a level. That meant after spending ten minutes or so blasting your way through a difficult level, you would have to start the campaign all over again from start to finish if your player is killed. I always appreciate a challenge, yet not when the odds are overwhelmingly stacked against me. The one aspect that the console version did translate well was the "war is hell" theme. The beginning level featuring you as a Russian soldier taking back Stalingrad from the "steeking Germans" was intense with gunfire raining all around you and enemy soldiers around every corner. The death animations are overly exaggerated which made in difficult to distinguish whether or not an enemy was either wounded or dead only to have them shoot you in the back. I played this game for only an hour before I filed it away with my other games. I imagine that I will someday go back, but in the meantime, I'm having too much fun with the PC version.

title: Do not give up on this, totally worth it!
text: So so so happy with this purchase and service! I got the adapter  and it initially would not work and kept showing no signal. I read some reviews and saw other reviews stating the same issue but decided not to give up on it after 1 failed attempt. I emailed the seller, let them know the issue I was having. They quickly got back to me within a day of how to troubleshoot by using a small cotton ball with a ljttle alcohol on the connecting piece to the adapter and suggested as the n64 probably had not been used in some time it would need to be cleaned to make sure no dust settled. Well sure enough thats all it took. Turned my n64 back on and it worked right away! Pictute quality is what I expected being this console is from the 90s and technology has just exploded since. So so happy with this purchase all around and definitely recommend!

title: Tiny Heads Only
text: When I received the glasses the lenses were partially popped out of the frame from shipping so do not expect any durability. The lenses themselves work great. I was impressed with how much longer I could play video games on my PC, or just use my PC, without little to no strain on my eyes. A huge downside, and why I am going to return them, is that the frames are designed for people with smaller heads. After not even 2 minutes of wearing these glasses the arms near my ears were hurting the sides of my head. There are others that cost more but after this experience I believe that the higher cost is justified.

title: In 1997, this game would have been, well bad...
text: OK.  I was looking forward to this game.  Giant robots, with guns, blowing up stuff.  Nuff said!  Well, no.  From the moment you insert this game in to your Wii (on the disc start screen) you begin to see the home made production values that "shine" throughout the game. From the menu with no options (why have a menu).  To given 15 seconds to select your character, in a single player game, where the characters have different stats.  Then to the absolute lackluster game play.  Hint, to beat the boss without getting hint hold left.  When you're all the way left, hold right.  Apparently the boss has no clue how to lead a target moving in a straight line at a steady pace.  Not to mention that you have to shoot at like a billion things, and have NO autofire.  Save the life of your wiimote and don't even bother renting this one.  Too many good games out there to waste your time.  Or pull out a Saturn or Dreamcast and relive some quality games.  Hell they looked and sounded better ten years ago as well.

title: Cool concept ruined by Activision's greed
text: Being able to create your own custom Skylander sounded like a really cool idea when the Creation Crystals were announced. You can chose from 1 of 10 different battle classes for your Skylander from brawler, to ninja, archer and other choices. There are all kinds of different ways to customize the Skylander and as you play through the game, you can unlock new parts. The thing that ruins the crystals is that there is no way to completely reset them. In past games every figure has fully been resettable back to level 1 and you can chose an upgrade path again. With these crystals, once you select a battle class the decision is final is there is no way to change the battle class. You can't even try the class in the game to see how it plays before making your decision. Yes there is a warning in the game saying the decision is final but most kids aren't going to realize what it means considering past games said the same thing about the figures and could be reset and there is no indication on the packaging that these crystals can't be reset. If a kid just picks the first class choice given and realizes they made a mistake, they are stuck with that choice forever. There was an option to reset the crystals in early versions of the game so it's obvious Activision changed the ability to reset the crystals just to get people to purchase more crystals.

title: Very interesting hybrid
text: Chronicles of Mystery is a spinoff of a PC version of this game. Although the PC version is a classic adventure game, DS version has a different approach. The game is a mix of a hidden object game, adventure puzzles and most importantly, a lot of cool minigames, all this together makes a hybrid that surprisingly works really well. The graphics are great, story is not mind blowing but it fits the climax perfectly and the amount of additional content consisting of hidden object games and minigames is impressive. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone that likes adventure and puzzle games.

title: Should have called this Groundhog Day....
text: If I could give it zero stars right now, I would.  I was so looking forward to this game.  Keeping in mind that I am not an adolescent with an endless supply of mountain dew and doritos (no offense, kids), I do enjoy gaming and have been since the very first Zelda game ever released.  That being said, I do not like this version so far.  The 3 day clock is one of the most frustrating things I have ever experienced!  You lose EVERYTHING if you go back to day one.  The tedious task of having retrace your steps and do it all AGAIN and AGAIN and AGAIN  is deflating and annoying. They could have at least thrown us a few bones and let you keep accrued items. At this point, I am going to try and return it.  So very disappointed...  And to all of the trolls who have nothing better to do than insult and attack people for having an opinion, please do not bother commenting as I will ask Amazon to delete any rude or offensive commentary.  Actually, I may just leave the comments so others can see how ridiculous you all are.

title: CFS 3 Best sim ever?
text: I'm a big sim fan I have all the combat flight sims so far and a few of the flight sims (combatfs 1,2 fs2000,2002) from what i have seen and read about this game its every cobat fligt simulators dream. 34 flyable aircraft bombers fighters torpedeo bombers and jet fighters! it has 3D sencery and alot of special features. Tail Gunner 2 if you have combatfs 1 you'll know what im talking about. Tail gunner 2 was a programe for cfs1 which let you use the rear,waist,tailand frontal guns on a bomber but it stopped you from using rockets. so what steveiy did (the guy who made tg2) was ask microsft to include tailgunner in the latest version of combat fs and there is a virtual gunner cockpit for it. Take it from me it looks stunning.Forget of the panel as we know it today because evrything is a virtual cockpit. No more 2D panels. You heard me mention fighter jets thats right they've been so knid to include fighter jets they are: Me262 A, Gloster Meteor, P-80 and the De Halivand Vampire they also included a little thing called role playing which i think is fun. You create a pilot give him a name a background and how he got into the aviation industry. He can be killed. Thats about all i can tell you for im running out of sapce and i could go on forever.But if you enjoyed 1and2 you will love 3. buy it!!!!

This kick ... ninja can slice through enermys with his katana (sword), run up and across walls like the Matrics, and use ninjyutsu (ninja magic) to obliterate any enemy in his path. This will be an extremely high-speed combat game with very challanging enemys, such as thirty foot tall demons, demons that can turn invisible and even military tanks. title: I have been super excited to receive this as I have been waiting ...
text: I have been super excited to receive this as I have been waiting a long time to get an xbox one because I wanted the Halo special edition one that I hoped they would and finally did come out with. I was ecstatic going through the box looking at every little thing and then I unpackaged the actual xbox itself and I noticed a small little scuff on the top of it. I know it might seem stupid to some people but when I buy something this expensive brand new I expect it to be in pristine condition. The xbox one halo edition looks like a piece of art so that little flaw really does bother me. Not sure if it can be returned over that but also it shouldn't happen in the first place. Also the thing wouldn't start at first. It would make the noise of starting but then not actually start. At first the button was unresponsive and nothing wold happen. Unplugged the HDMI and put it in the HDMI in which got the sound effect to work then put it back into the HDMI out and then it would start. Also I had to hold it through the whole sound effect for it to start if I didn't it would only play half the sound effect and stop.
