title: Refurbished Nintendo Switch!
text: When I received my bundle, nothing was wrapped in the original plastic packaging. When I inspected the screen of the Nintendo switch, there is a white particle in the lower right, in between the touch screen and LCD.. Very distracting while the system is on because it appears to be dead pixels... I will update with pictures later. Also it looks like someone attempted to clean the screen with glass cleaner or something that damaged the bezels. I want a new switch.. This is unacceptable.

title: A great collection, better than anything Namco or Midway did
text: For the past few years, Midway and Namco have been rereleasing old games in their collections.  They would throw 6 to 8 early 80's games on a cd with nothing extra and charge an insane amount of money.  Then along came Activision.  Activision obviously learned from Midway and Namco's mistakes.  Instead of 6 to 8, you get 45 Atari 2600 games.  Want extra features?  Ok, how about TV comercials from the 80s and those patches you could earn for their games.  But they did not stop there.  They added a truely impressive 80's soundtrack to keep you going.  There are also added ways of playing the game.  For example, one method overlays clouds over the game.  Another has a large rotating cube with the game on each side.  These extra ways of playing the game are interesting, but you will mostly just play the games the way they were.  Overall, this is what a collection should be like.  If you want to relive the classics or are interested in where the video game industry first got its start, you should check this out.

title: What a mess...
text: I was looking foward to this, mainly because I like the Rugrats show. At the time this game was released (about June 1999) the Rugrats TV show had pretty much become a show for kids only with nothing redeeming for older audiences. With that in mind, the Rugrats license didn't need a game like this. This game tries to cash in on the success of Mario Party, but it fails to do that. Why? This is just a normal board game, which is all fine and dandy, but there's absolutely nothing to make you want to play this again. It has no mini-games like Mario Party. It has only one, count it, one play mode, and because of that, the replay value is really low. Even the four-player mode can't reedem it. But that's not all. The graphics are so bad for N64. I've seen PS1 games that look better then this, and those games came out years before this one! Why THQ didn't support the Expansion Pak is beyond me. I think it would have helped. The biggest problem (that I also stated above) is that the game is literaly over before it begins, and being priced at almost any dollar amount, this game is a rip-off. It may have been worth it if it was priced at a low dollar amount, but I wouldn't bet on it. There is some good though: The sounds and voices are nice, the controls are very simple, and the Rumble Pak feature is nice. But since it's so short and boring, it destroys all the fun. I know THQ was trying to aim this at young kids who aren't good at video games, but they failed even on that level. Games like Tigger's Honey Hunt (also on N64), are made for young kids in mind, but are also enjoyable for older audiences (and games like that usually have more replay value). Even for its target audience, there is no fun to be had here. Skip this and let your kids try Tigger's Honey Hunt instead. But if you really need a Rugrats game, get Search For Reptar on PS1. It's the best Rugrats game out there (though that's not saying much) and it has much more replay value then this.

For example, you have a number of cards in your hand, you and whoever you are fighting play a card at the same time. Who ever has the higher card attacks as much damage as shown on the card. Donald and Goofy are not with you in this game but you can summon cards with them on it and they will help you for a brief time. You can also use other cards such as Genie, Bambie, and all the others. Although the screenshots may seem like their from the first game they are not. Sora is on the path where the first game left off. A hodded mad comes and tells him up head is a mansion with someone inside that is very dear to Sora. But to get to that person Sora must loose something very important. As Sora wanders throughout the mansion memories come back to him. Such as Neverland, Wonderlan and Halloween Town. But he finds at the end is up to you to find out. So play the game! It is going to be truely awesome!!!

title: I like this case!
text: Ok, so I just got a PSP3000 and needed some good protection. I am an adult with medium size men's hands, and, although I like that the PSP is small, I find it's almost too small for playing pleasure. In fact, when I first got the PSP3000, I was jammin' to God of War, side-steppin' and slashin' baddies with Kratos' blades when the PSP almost flipped out of my hands! Because the PSP Slim (2000 or 3000) has such a small form factor, if you have medium to large hands, you should definitely consider getting the Logitech case. The  case is a clam shell design that fully protects the PSP from front to back and allows access for you to play the PSP while it rests within the case, therefore giving it a little more bulk for those of us adult PSP users. The upper part of the clam shell also folds back and doubles as a stand if you want to set your PSP on a table to play. Also, the case includes a template that you can use to cut out pictures, illustrations or just about anything you want and use as "wallpaper" inside the case. I'm a grown man and I didn't think I'd ever avail myself of this little feature, but lo and behold I've now got a nice little human skull illustration on my Logitech case that I downloaded for free from the Playgear Pocket Skins website. Lastly, the Logitech case is also very, very reasonably priced. That's my two cents. . .

title: A great option from KontrolFreeks
text: I am a big fan of the lower directional joystick and the higher aiming joystick. The Vortex are a good option for this because you can get both styles in one purchase rather than having to buy two sets. They snap on easily enough. The directional cap is concave and easy for your thumb to sit against for long periods. The convex aiming stick is ideal because it allows you to roll your thumb over it while aiming, while a convex stick could potentially cause slight slippage when you're trying to aim precise at awkward angles. I have no complaints about the vortex design, it allows for some good grip. The color choice is not my favorite, but it's not terrible either. Overall, I am very satisfied. I do recommend KontrolFreeks and have them on all my PS4 and Xbox One controllers.

title: Typing is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!  TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! RUN!!!!

Numbers don't type; numbers type in duplicates; numbers type in triplicates; letters don't type; letters type in duplicates; letters type in triplicates. I have to either bang on the keys to get them to work or touch them V-E-R-Y  S-L-O-W-L-Y to make sure what I've typed is correct. Takes twice as long to type something than it would on a "normal" keyboard. If you want something that looks pretty, this is it. title: Just finished playing
text: This is the first of the ND series that I've played without having to look up cheats a hundred times. Unlike the previous adventures, there were several places (not just one) where Nancy was caught in a "second chance" situation - I think that makes it more exciting. I played the Senior Detective and only got really stuck twice - otherwise the hints were pretty helpful. This probably isn't the game for the very experienced gamer, but if you have played and enjoyed any previous ND games, you will not be disappointed here. It's low on violence and high on creative thinking. I wish there were more female oriented adventure games like this series. Have fun with it!

title: The next big game?
text: Aside from Halo 2 on Xbox, one of the most talked about games thats going to be released this fall is Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas. Many new features have been added from previous games in the series. Its going to be a much larger game. You're not just stuck in some small cities, you've got a much bigger area to explore. The graphics look improved from what I've seen in screen shots, and I doubt they're will be any pop in, because for a next generation game, pop in would be pathetic this far into PS2's lifespan. You can steal new vehicles, including trackters, and my friend told me he saw a screen shot of a guy mowing a lawn. You have to eat in this game to keep up, but, like in real life, if you eat too many fatty foods like donuts and you dont exercise it off, then you're charecter, Carl, will become a fat guy. This game will be set in a ghetto type area in California. Early rumors said that the next Grand Theft Auto would be set in Las Vegas, but those were false... its set in California (that would have been cool, though). In the past four Grand Theft Auto titles, it was annoying how you couldent swim. You could rob a store, you can steal a car, but you couldent swim. Well, this time, like in the recently released (and dumbly titled) "Driv3r", you can now swim. Woo hoo! If Rockstar North (previously DMA (Doesent Mean Anything) Design Games) can add exciting missions and enough new gameplay to keep this fresh and fans happy, then it'll have yet another hit on its hands. This is not a final review.

The USB cable is too short to comfortably put the PSP on the desk while transferring files. The cable is only about 2 feet long so its only long enough to sit on top of the PC which isn't too safe because it could fall. The car charger is cheap because earlier today the thing burned out and when I noticed it the thing was very hot to touch. I had to pull it out of the dc outlet with a napkin! I'm starting to question Pelicans accessories especially since the recall of the power brick now this. On to other things the case holds 4 UMD's with the jackets on, but the two that go in the flap part of the case puts pressure on the PSP screen which over time probably could damage it.

Plus, the Master Chief was MIA in his own game and Blue Team was woefully underdeveloped. There's no chance at all that I'll preorder another game from 343. What a letdown.

title: Incredible for ALL ages!
text: This hamilton soundtrack was the first soundtrack I bought off of Amazon, so I was skeptical. I was curious to see what I would get after seeing reviews that the CD was not Hamilton. Surely enough this was not the case with mine. My family and I have played the soundtrack in the car daily and can't seem to get enough of it. It is perfect for all ages. My husband ( a history teacher loves it) and my kids can't get enough of the raps ( especially lafayette) . The CD arrived sooner than expected in one day. It came with two CD's ( Act 1 and Act 2) , and two small books that had all of the lyrics.  As far as soundtrack prices go this was fairly inexpensive. The two only downside to this soundtrack is that you can not download the music onto a phone or a laptop and you can't get enough of it! My family has to take a long road trip coming up and we can't wait to take it with us.

title: All new all better
text: I really thought I'd play this game a week and go back to my old Sims. I loved making houses and neighborhoods so much, and I had so much stuff from Sims Resource and Well Dressed Sims. I just knew there was no way this game could satisfy my building urge. I was very wrong. I have been sucked into a world of stories and intrigue. My best friend and I discuss daily the differences our stories and Sims lives are taking. Who they are marrying, who they are sleeping with, who was born, and who died. When my first Sim died of old age, I actually felt a sense of loss. It's a lot of fun, but be prepared for addiction. Don't get this game unless you have a lot of free time. I'm pretty busy right now and it's driving me nuts. I highly highly recommend this game.

title: Awesome game if you like the movie!
text: I had never even heard of Deadpool before the movie, but I loved it so much that I had to try this game. It feels a little bit like an old Sega Genesis game with updated graphics and I mean that in the best way! There is a good combination of shooting and fighting and the story is entertaining. There is a lot of the same Deadpool humor that is in the movie so if you enjoy old school video games and liked the Deadpool movie, you should love this game!

title: Great device,  poor software,  great 3rd party software
text: I use ds4 Windows with my Asus 4.0 Bluetooth to use my ds4 for pc gaming and emulation games before and was great until I moved into apartment with tons of wifi interferance.  The Bluetooth dongle  still worked but the latency crippled the wireless function.  I hoped that the ds4 adapter would not be hindered by proprietary software and found out that ds4 windows added support for it.  The dongles wireless connectivity is fantastic with ds4 windows.  Works great with pc games,  remote play and emulations.  It's a shame that the dongle only supports 1 controller at a time.

title: No Words
text: Honestly I thought while reading this book that I was going to have so much to say about it. I highlighted comments in yellow, inspirations in blue, shocked moments in Orange and with all that this book has left me speechless. If I were to say anything it would be that you truly have no idea what a person goes through unless your that person, even if you walked the same path you still have no idea about a person. Do not judge things you know nothing about, do not condemn a person for things you don't have the ability to understand, do not hate just to hate, do not take sides in a debate of political and social standards as everyone is different and right in their own way. Live your life the way you choose to live, believe in what you do and who you are. Support your friends and family and spend your time helping others rather than judging and becoming upset over things in this world you either do not understand or can not change. Life is precious, see it for what it is and what you can make it by being open, understanding and loving to all those around you that do not wish you harm. Make life worth living for everyone that you can. Not Speechless after all!!!!

title: Madden 21 is EA's worst attempt at Madden since Madden 06 on XBOX 360
text: Madden 21 is a glitch filled, buggy mess. The Face of The Franchise mode is bare bones. The story is mediocre and laughable. The Yard mode is clearly made just for EA to push more micro-transactions on top what they already have. Superstar KO mode is literally just copied and pasted from last year. If you enjoyed that move just play Madden 20. Franchise mode is the same as it was in Madden 20, 19, 18, 17, 16, 15, 25, and 13. MUT mode was also untouched showing that the only work they did in this game was the new mode The Yard, except that the yard isn't even polished and is just as buggy as the rest of the game. Stay away from this buggy, broken mess that EA has the audacity to call a game. I am advising you, DO NOT BUY MADDEN 21!

title: Rugged and stylish

You can fit more, but that is all I have, and it all fits comfortably.  The case itself is a little on the heavy side, but all of that protection and beauty must come at a price.

title: If You Love Jigsaw Puzzles...
text: I have always loved jigsaw puzzles. But this is the first time I have ever put one together on a computer. Puzz 3D Orient Express has 4 difficulty levels, from easy to super-challenging. I started off on the third level  which is the challenging level. That level is just as challenging as the  1000-peice puzzles you buy in the store. The only difference is this: once  you put the puzzle together, the fun doesn't stop. The difficulty level you  choose determines how much of the Orient Express you can explore. You get  to meet all kinds of different people as well as learn about the history of  the train. Plus, during the exploration phase, there are other games along  the way as well as clues to a mystery guest who is supposed to board the  train. I haven't finished the exploration portion yet, but I am already  thinking about going back to rebuild the train at the super-challenging  level. This way, I will have unlimited access to the entire train. This  Puzzle is very addictive and fun.

title: Headset Great . . . Microphone Not
text: I like this headset's looks, I like its sound quality, but there's one problem. When I first plugged this thing in, it didn't even register that there was a microphone on it. I tried to go to the control panel and set up a microphone setting - still didn't work. For some reason, when I plugged it back in for like the eighth time, it decided to register and my friends could finally hear me. However, they said, I sounded really awful, distant, and dull. I messed with the settings, and it didn't help at all. I'm going to be returning this headset.

title: HATE IT!
text: Just received the game today after waiting a month for it's release only to be extemely disappointed. I thought this would be great to play on a 52" screen. There is sooooo many graphics, constant view changes and  movement, you never know where you or the ball is. At one point you are only viewing the top half of the machine so as you hit the ball and it begins to head to the bottom flippers you have no idea if you hit the ball until the full view returns and you see you've missed it. Too many time you cannot see the bottom flippers. I thought the 3-D effect would be nice, but it's horrible. I guess what I'm trying to say is everything is way too distracting. A "still" overhead view of the machine would be nice. There's even a time when all of a sudden you're seeing a side view of the machine - you try to hit the ball but of course you can't. This is the first pinball video game I've ever tried, maybe I'm just too use to playing on a real pinball machine where you can see the entire playing area at all times, but I must say this was a very annoying experience. Definitely getting rid of it. I should have known better than to buy it before any reviews came out. I've read great reviews about other games but I wanted one for the WII. I'm curious to read what others have to say. Guess I'll go back online (on Amazon of course) and continue my search for a fun pinball game.

title: Good, but a bit disorganized.
text: I enjoyed watching Kasparov discuss the Queen's Gambit with such brilliance, and I agree with other reviewers who say that he comes across as down-to-earh. There is no question about his passion for the game, and any chess player will enjoy the commentary of this legendary grandmaster. I give it four stars because a better production was actually possible. In fact, with a bit of focus and organization, this DVD could have been a valuable instructional tool. The problem is that Kasparov goes on many tangents, and while this is occasionally unavoidable when discussing variations, it can become tedious. It's not a matter of his English, either--he expresses himself well. Overall, I couldn't help but get the impression that this was filmed haphazardly--that is, he probably just sat down and began discussing the opening any which way. What was needed was the careful selection of themes within the framework of the lecture; the DVD could have been divided into crucial minilessons that retained focus instead of random observations with loose-fitting titles. If the aim was to teach, then the approach needs modification. I'm a decent player with club and some tournament experience. I followed him as best as I could, but I can see a beginner being easily overwhelmed and quickly losing interest. As a fan, it's a pleasure to watch him discuss the game; as a life-long student of chess, I expect more.

title: Great rhythm game!

title: Mac had a rought start but now works perfect.  KIDS HAVING FUN
text: I bought this program for my mac and while I could get it to load it would not keep track of anyone's progress (like it stated that it would).  I contacted the company and was given a patched program that works perfectly now.  I am using for my oldest child to learn to type and the younger one gets on at times too.  It is fun and highly rewarding.  Now that the progress is tracked it is great as he is moving through and learning new things.  The games are so much fun for him, makes it almost seem like a video game and yet he is learning to type at faster speeds.  I love that it breaks it up into chunks that are easier to digest and that there are so many motivating and different areas and games to learn.  I also like the reports and feedback that it gives.  Where I can see the letters and areas where he excels or has difficulty.  I can also see his speed vs mistakes.  This is a great tool and I am so happy that it works perfectly on a Mac now.

title: Is this Madden '12 or '09?
text: For the unfortunate people who can't afford to purchase a PS3, and have to settle with buying Madden '12 for PS2, I feel sorry for all of us. I feel like I'm playing Madden '09! Where are the upgrades, if any? The rosters are so wrong! I caught myself releasing, trading, and picking free agents up (on basically every team!) just to update the current transactions that have happened the past few months. Not to mention, all the rookies that are missing. What a disappointment! The franchise mode is still the same as '09...and by that, I mean it's horrible. I was so excited to purchase this game, but I completely regret it now. Such a waste of money. If they were planning on keeping the same game as '09 (besides the roster changes, big deal, whatever), at least warn us so we save our money. I highly, highly, HIGHLY, recommend that you DON'T buy this game, for PS2 at least; I'm sure it's great on PS3.

title: a review only for true RPG fan
text: This is a horrid game galavanting around as a RPG, let alone final fantasy, one of the best RPG series ever created. This game has no exploration, no choice control, no individuality, you can't even interact with NPCs!  If you don't know what a NPC is then this game may be just what you're looking for.  If this game did not have the title of Final Fantasy then perhaps it could be enjoyable.  Having such a name dishonors all the great gaming which came before this abberation! You can't control party leader, give commands, or freely explore.  My apologies for the rant, it is such a shame that this ONCE great franchise has fallen to such lows.  Stay away those looking for a RPG experience.  This is a CG movie of epic proportions interspersed with a few button presses from you, the "controller;" when I say few I do mean FEW.

title: Best Left on the Darkside
text: Darksiders 3 tells the story of Fury, sent to earth to vanquish the Seven Deadly Sins. Fury is one of the Horseman of the Apocalypse and is sent to a post-apocolyptic world? Planet? Somewhere? I played the first two Darksider Games and they were enjoyable Hack and Slash adventures with a few minor puzzles thrown in for enjoyment, plenty of spaces to roam free, although it was not open world, and a decent story. Darksiders 3? Not so much. The game is ugly to look at, the environment is crudely drawn, there are no real puzzles to solve, the camera angles are awful, the gameplay is glitchy. You can select from several different modes of play. The problem with these modes of play are that the difference between easy and balanced would be the difference between moderate and "kill me now" in any other videogame. Easy mode is a cakewalk, Balanced will have you hollering in high def! You are not able to switch modes if you find one or the other too difficult or too easy during your actual game. The other unfair and awful aspect of this game is that it rarely saves your progress so if you die you basically get sent back...waaaay back to the beginning of an area. Clumsy, unworthy of the xbox one and just about any other commercially released game out there, Darksiders 3 is just an ugly, rushed mess. Blessedly, the game is relatively short! One day I will actually follow through on my promise not to purchase games right upon release.

title: Great if this is what you want
text: I did a review on the circular gates which I feel is superior to these if you want the authentic Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat experience from the 90's. Most people get these for that very experience which I felt was not accurate. The 90's fighter cabs used circular plates, not octagonal, which is why the circular motions were smooth when performing special moves such as hadokens. With these octagonal gates you will get a bumpy feeling when executing those types of moves which can be ok if what you are looking for is to be able to jump diagonally with precision. That is what is good about these octagonal gates is that you will be able to jump diagonally with less issues than circular plates but my point is that octagonal is not the more authentic experience. In the Arcade 1up modding scene, octagonal gates seem to be the preferred suggestion to new people asking for advice on what they should use but if you ask me, I would say try the circular gates if you want authenticity, if you want jumping diagonal accuracy then go for the octagonal gates. Hope this review helps you out. Thanks.

title: Very good purchase!
text: This product was exactly what I was looking for in a video game, and I enjoyed the quality throughly. Also, the game arrived on-time without any ridiculous shipping prices or delays.

title: No snug fit, tracking doesn't work when it matters
text: If your getting this headset for some casual play or just to explore scenery, it's perfect. But if you want play real games and get into it, it fails to keep tracking when you need it most. Until they release the option to use lighthouses for tracking, I would not recommend getting this in it's current state. HTC's inside-out tracking tech is far behind Oculus's. I often found when I brought the controller up to my face to aim with a weapon, it's loses tracking and flings around everywhere. I regret getting this headset early, if you want inside-out tracking, get Oculus. They're way farther ahead with their software then HTC is. The fact that they thought they could release a headset in this state is just unacceptable. The flip design is great, but there no eye relief, and I'm constantly losing the sweet spot. If they had a way to properly secure it to your face, it'd be perfect. The headphones that come with it are cheap. They snap up and snap down, I often found they never stayed snapped down hard enough that they'd snap back up.

title: They work great with my PlayStation 4
text: They work great with my PlayStation 4. Audio quality is good. They are flexible so they fit good on your head and don't put too much pressure on your ears. I would recommend these. I received this product at a discount or free in exchange for my honest review. I am not connected with the company and I don't have any monetary gain. I'm  not required to leave a positive or false review, I just test the products and leave my honest review. My opinions are based on my personal experience with the product that I'm reviewing and I will update my rating and review if my opinion about the product changes.

title: Eh, not really sure these are worth the discounted price i paid
text: Not sure how much these really add to the game. The vehicles are limited to the Toy Box area, which me and my son don't really play in all that often. We typically play the racing add-on, which is excellent, or play through the Star Wars story add-ons.

title: A bit tricky to install, and not nearly as much of an improvement as I had hoped
text: This wasn't particularly easy to install. It required soldering a wire, which wasn't too tricky for me, but a novice could easily damage their Steam Deck. One thing worth noting is that my Steam Deck's original analog sticks had something covering the solder joint preventing it from being desoldered. I didn't notice at first since it was a mostly transparent sort of film. Once I pealed off that coating, it was pretty simple for me to desolder the wire for the analog stick and move them over to the new analog boards. The zeroing not the analog sticks aren't perfect, but I was able to reduce the deadzone a little. I think the main benefit of these analog sticks comes from the fact that they won't suffer from stick drift. I'm not sure they're worth buying if your current analog sticks are working properly, but if you want to prevent the analog sticks from developing drift then these do just that.

title: Doesn't Work

title: More detail than AC4 (for advanced pilots) but less fun.
text: Aero Elite outclasses Ace Combat 4 in terms of realism and detail but sacrifices fun in the name of it. The weapons, for example, are exact to the real specs and number. You have to pay close attention to your speed and altitude when landing, especially if you're flying VTOL in a Marine Corps AV-8B Harrier. The vertical take-off and landing feature of the Rolls Royce Engine only engages at a specific airspeed. Going through the VTOL training really helps you learn the basic skills for flying the AV-8B Harrier. Unlike Ace Combat 4, you can pre-program your replay views before saving it and even choose a different background music. Not to mention, you get the whole replay for the entire length of the game! Ace Combat 4 only replays the last 4 minutes and you cannot save each individual replay movie. Aero Elite even lets you land any plane on a city freeway or on almost any flat surface you can find on the face of the Earth like parking the F-16 Falcon on that helipad in front of your house in the Snowy Mountains Mission. Try parking the huge F-15E inside the pyramid in the desert mission. Mastering the technique of landing the AV-8B Harrier on the LHA at sea can be hard to learn at first but you'll be proud once you get it right and to watch or show that perfect replay is almost enough reason to own this game. Not recommended for beginner pilots. Advanced pilots dare this!

title: The Playstation 4 is a(Almost...) perfect video game console
text: Had to get this because i sold my original playstation 4 when i was in tough financial times. Only problem i have with this bundle is that the 500gb may seem like a lot of space, but in actuality it can only hold maybe 7 to 8 full length playstation 4 games, which means that i as well as people who bought the 500gb playstation 4 will have to keep downloading and deleting games to make room(once a game is either downloaded digitally or with disc, the game is automatically saved into your playstation network account so even if you delete your games, you can always redownload them for free) OR buy and install a new hard drive.Besides that and the bs policy of having to actually pay for playstation plus when it used to be free, The playstation 4 is by far the best video game console on the market today.

title: Great for parties
text: I first saw the game at a party of adults (27 and up). Instead of sitting and drinking, everyone was in front of the TV and playing, laughing and having fun. It is a great game to get some exercise, challenge your friends and have a good laugh. Unlike all the games that come out lately with fights and violence this is an absolutely innocent game suitable for all. Good also for parents to play and spend time with their video addicted kids. Can't wait for the US release to buy it.

title: A game that relies on online registration for so much content shouldn't need DRM
text: This DRM is ridiculous.  I bought this directly from the EA store and I have no idea how many activations I can make.  Even reading online about the retail box version I see a 3 and a 5 activation limit.  Nowhere before during or after downloading from EA or before during or after installing was I told how many activations I have total or remaining.  I hope if I still like this game a few years and computers from now I will still be able to install and play it.  I did buy it after all.

title: The power of an Amazon review
text: I had all but written off this game because of the barrage of negative reviews, but the consensus from the users that managed to actually get the game installed was that it was good. I took a trip down to my local store and saw the game for the same price as on this website. I decided to take a chance, after reading that Ubi had put out a patch for this game. True enough patch 1.0.3 seems to have cleared up any issues with requiring a CD to run the game, as I'm running the program now with nothing in the CD drive. I have noticed to crashes or problem. The game is fun and a good investment.

title: Simply Amazing!
text: This is a very deep dev kit that is very easy to pick up and well thought out. Navigation  using only the dualshock is good enough that move controllers are not necessary. Once you start playing around in Dreams you really get addicted to exploring all the fantastic options. While the tutorials are excellent and easy to comprehend,  my only complaint is they should be a little better organized from the beginner to advanced lessons. I think Dreams is a huge milestone in the history of gaming, thanks for making something so cool!

title: I do love that the mic doesn't pick up a bunch of ...
text: Headset works just as you'd think, speakers are full and without any crackle or fade while the mic pics up most speech.  I do love that the mic doesn't pick up a bunch of background noise, although at times it feels like I have to scream for it to pick up my voice.  Guess you can't have the best of both worlds, but that'd be the loss of a star.  If you're looking for a headset that will work for a very good price, i'd recommend getting this one!

title: Best way to experience Nintendo's 3D on the switch.
text: This headset is well made for the price, decently comfortable.  I had to adjust the straps so that they pull up just a little, because I find that my big nose gathers condensation which can fog up the lenses.  Compared to that joke the Nintendo Labo 3D VR goggles, these are a must buy for anyone who really wants to play switch in 3D.  I am playing Breath of the Wild with these.  It looks good, but the pixels do kinda stand out too far.  I don't know.  For less than 20 bucks how can you go wrong?
